Got it on chronogg for $11, for now the game is a lil bit disappointing. While I see potential the game, this isn't nowhere near like M&B or even a good shooter. 

Most maps are forest & open fields, everybody is shooting like ret*rds across the map, without really stopping to aim or use the environment to stabilize the weapon (i got spoiled by Red Orchestra 2 and the Rising Storm 1/2 on that one), the AI got eagle eyes and hive-mind abilities (one see you, all of them see you and fire at you at once).

So… Could be interesting to see what this game is like on release but for now, i will shelve it. Way too many issues, combat feel like a chore and finally strategic orders are not that quick to make (cant delete checkpoints without deleting all of them on one squad)

Could recommend this game only because of the “potential” but my past experiences with early access didn't let me.

40940384.review:
FGW seemed like a Mount and Blade clone until I started playing.  It's actually a pretty fresh, original PVE FPS with elements of strategy. 

Even though it's a recent release EA title, the game is quite enjoyable in it's current state.  The battles are fun and addictive.  Flanking and finding cover are legit tactics.  One gripe I have is that once you learn the mechanics and get a good gun the fights become trivially easy.  All you have to do is play defensive and snipe.  Hopefully the devs can find ways to make it more challenging.  It's still early though, and they are off to a great start.  

The strategy is simple and has room to grow.  The AI factions seem to be busy fighting each other and doing their things. 
 Hopefully with diplomacy, etc. it will become more fleshed out in the future.  Again, it is a bit too easy once you learn the ropes.  Trade and carefully picked battles will get you rich fast.  

Overall a promising and surprisingly fresh take on the M&B concept.  The price isn't obscene either.  Add in the frenzied pace the devs have been updating (so far...) and you have a solid EA game well worth full price.

40905599.review:
I am usually not one for writing reviews, however Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare is bringing the back of the old Mount & Blade Feel into modern times.

Instead of swords you have guns, instead of a bow you have a sniper rifle. Instead of a sling you got a Rocket Launcher (I suppose, I haven't found one yet but I am sure it will be in eventually).

While the game is still pretty barebones right now is the game also still in early access and the developers are patching like maniacs.

The gameplay itself is rather basic and again I can't help but draw a comparison to Mount & Blade.

You create a character (Character generation is pretty barebones right now), choose a gender, a flag and company name and you are ready to go and conquer the map. You start out with 2 squads and can hire more to replenish your company. The rest of the days you will spend fighting Bandits and Rebels, looting their equipment and selling it while your squads level up and unlock new weaponry and strengths, which makes them more effective at killing enemies as now they may be able to throw grenades.

There are various factions, each with their own units, which you can now capture and possible convert to your cause.

You also have 2 companions which are at your side and can be equipped, and leveld up, just like you.

The map right now is pretty barebones still with only a single mission for you to take and the rest of the time you'll spend hunting mobs to pay your squad.

----

In short, if you liked Mount & Blade and want it in modern times, then buy this game. For its current price its a catch and it will only get better.

40877198.review:
游戏有潜力，但是完成度非常低，感觉在玩10年前的游戏。 有不少bug，城市也比较少，兵种比较单一也几乎没有升级空间，贸易系统就是跑商，因为地图小，很容易。  说是有任务系统，其实没有，没有人会给你任务，没有城镇会有任务。

你也许会问，我为什么一直提地图小。 你玩过战团吗？ 4分之1的大小。甚至更少。 每个城镇的名字都可以背下来，就10多个吧。

每次存单开档，物品价格，顺序，金钱都有变化。 甚至本身城镇的高价物品也会变化，想象你刚记清楚所有城镇的高价品，然后改天就全变了。

其次，界面的设计真的非常烂，应该找个美工重新弄一下，都归咎于完成度吧。

最后，我依然给这个游戏打好评，因为这款游戏很有潜力，有潜力的和骑马与砍杀一样精彩。 

多元化是游戏的核心，希望游戏开发商记住这一点。

有时候真想自己开办一个工作室，然后开发游戏，真的有太多想法了。

Мне не понравилась эта игра, и вот почему: 
----------------------------------------------
 Я слышал много про эту игру,например "Убийца M&B Warband!" "Совсем как M&B Warband", а поскольку я фанат 
M&B Warband, то Я решил узнать правда ли это.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Начну с плюсов: Удобная механика вплане стратегии в реальном времени, большой выбор оружия и модификации к ним.
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                          
Минусы: Ужасная не реалистичность в игровой механике. (Если тебя критически ранили на поле боя,то ты попадаешь обратно на карту,и предположим у тебя осталось 3 бойца, а  у врага 5. И тогда ты берёшь, и закупаешь там же еще 10, и спокойно убиваешь противника. Это так убого.), 
--------------------------------------------------
Графика (точно не соответсвует скриншотам в стиме,либо это самые ультра, так еще и отрендеренно)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Так же нам дают 2 отряда союзников - Анна (вроде) и Влад, они не похожи не на отморозков,бывших военных, или других людей которые способны убить человека. Это просто девушка, и просто мужик которые решили РЕЗКО стать частной военной компанией. Бред.
---------------------------
Вообщем, если вы фанат M&B Warband, и желаете увидить тоже самое но в современном сеттинге,то точно не берите. Это Боль.  4/10

40867987.review:
这游戏刚0.13X就已经有大部分模型了，你是不是想到了另一个Unity游戏《Easy Red》？
对，确实，我一开始很怀疑这是个假游戏，毕竟《自由人：游击战争》初始版本就有完成度这么高的模型，很难不让人怀疑是买现货。其实买现货也没什么，只要后期能做丰满就行。毕竟开放世界加第一人称射击，还是挺有吸引力的，看起来就是一个无限爽枪游戏，而且什么都生成好不用像武装突突那样要捣鼓编辑器设置小队路点。而且看制作组更新很频繁，也弄了一个官网，不像是要弄假游戏的节奏。不过官网倒是拒绝中国IP注册。

[b]难不成还可以取代CS爽枪？然而是吗？[/b] 
当我拿着初期配给的小手枪爬到一具尸体旁边，试图打开背包拿取长枪时，这个想法立即破灭了。这游戏没有这种说法，没有东西可以在战斗中拾取，玩家的武器只能花大价钱在商店买。而且这游戏的子弹还存在抛物线，加上身上携带的弹匣数有限，玩法有点硬核，所以想倾泻子弹，那基本不可能，爽枪也就算了。
另外较为庞大的世界，和本来就不怎么厉害的AI，导致第一人称射击这一块其实还挺无聊的。虽然电脑也会找掩体，但是大部分时间还是无掩体瞎跑，击败玩家就纯粹靠数量和质量。而玩家要做的就是躲到一处视野开阔的掩体后面，然后探出身子一个一个点掉电脑的士兵，这种体验挺蛋疼的。然后敌方死剩1个，就郁闷的满世界找不到人，只能等计时结束后揭示方位。

[b]骑砍类沙盘游戏模式？[/b] 
很抱歉，我本人对《骑马与砍杀》没什么了解，只是看过一些相关模组的宣传视频。不过这个游戏目前毕竟才V0.13这样非常早期的阶段，虽然也能玩，但真的不丰满。里面的经商很死板，也没什么风险，因为每个城市的高价商品都是固定的，只有读取存档的时候才会改变，所以么经商来钱快，但是跑起来也超无聊。

[b]总有一款适合你？[/b] 
第一人称射击？算了。自由的沙箱？无聊。大规模的战斗？真够了。真实的战斗？就这样。策略游戏和养成？好像还可以。
确实没事干捣鼓一下策略板块，把一堆垃圾杂鱼练成精锐，还是颇有成就感的。这方面可以深挖一下。

[b]成也随机，败也随机[/b] 
游戏中的大部分道具和军队都是随机生成，但是存档之后该部分的信息都不会保存，仅仅只会保存和玩家相关的信息。于是下次读档或重启游戏，周遭的事物又会重新生成。比如一个城市的守军本来只剩2人，但是读完档以后又会变成80，甚至绝一点的可以靠读档来消除敌方的攻城大军。所以目前程序并不完善。

优点：
策略、第一人称射击、开放世界、随机生成，够自由。
养成成分。
前景不错。

缺点：
BUG极多。
不合理设定多。
策略地图使用简化3D模型，但是没有等高线，地形起伏不好分析。
蛋疼的延长游戏时间方式，简单粗暴的增加金钱和经验值需求。
毛子意淫作，武器套用现实物品，但是属性完全乱改。

评分：6/10，仅基于当前的V0.133抢先体验版本，仅供参考，正式测评等正式版。所以想入手的建议还是再观望一下。

40866316.review:
这款游戏真的很不错，很喜欢骑砍。结合了很多FPS的元素很棒。以后可以做个DLC叫《自由人，全球安保》
   
   以后可以增加点载具类和多做点兵种。我看到地图还有海，以后可以加一点水上战斗环节。如果可以把地图做的再大一点或者跨地图跑图的时候可以加入装甲车和直升机模组。当然做个全球模式会更好！你的佣兵公司可以转战全球各地！全球模式下你可以买架飞机或租架飞机到战区开展你的佣兵行动

玩法少了点提几点建议
（载具拦截：有防空火力或RPG兵种可拦截地图上载具单位如直升机，装甲车，轮船等）

1，地图方面：世界地图模式可以设置成全球模组。作为一个佣兵组织在世界各地进行作战。地图做大点（比如分成亚洲，非洲，欧洲，美洲几大战区）

2，玩法方面：可以增加护送任务（可以送人员也可护送物品）从一个城送到另一个城，跑图过程中会有多个武装组织追来进行战斗。抢劫货车和轮船，斩首行动等。增加战斗时的小队编队。

3，载具方面：载具方面可以加很多汽车，改装皮卡（可装大口径机枪用于载具拦截），装甲车， 坦克，火炮，快艇，直升机等。

4，支援方面：
   ①；载具支援：有载具的情况下可以最小伤亡数撤出战场。无载具情况看敌人是否比 自己强，强则少数突围，多数被俘或者自己直接被俘用钱把自己赎回来。弱则可全部撤退或干掉敌人撤退。

   ②；炮火支援：分成空中支援和火炮支援当然这些飞机火炮你必须买了才行。距离近两个都可用，距离远只能用空中支 援，根据自己据点远近情况选择炮火支援类型。

5，兵种方面：可以出反载具兵种或者能让自己的NPC升级自己带领的小队，火箭筒兵。防空兵
                     （用于拦截,可装备重机枪和肩扛式防空 导弹）

6，装备方面：可以多出些枪械，RPG模型，衣服，防弹衣，头盔。根据不同任务可以行更换

7，城镇模式：
                       ①：增加训练所，为驻扎部队缓慢升级。
                       ②：增加弹药商店，这样把枪弹分开购买时更能一目了然。
                       ③：增加载具商店，可已买卖装甲车，飞机
                       ④：增加载具停放基地：机场，车库，码头用于停放和维修载具。
                       ⑤：增加防御设施，机枪阵地，战壕，瞭望塔
                       ⑥：增加仓库，非常重要！！！这样玩家就不用带很多东西到处跑想什么时候卖装备都可以


提以上建议希望这款游戏越来越好！

40865604.review:
This is a game about the Ukraine and Georgian conflict, as told through the eyes of Russia.  This means, your job is to raid towns, enslave the locals and naturally, Russian weapons are superior to NATO platforms. Every meme about Russian propaganda is alive & well in this game. CNN could not have asked for a better cutout / sockpuppet case study. 

The game itself is made by two models, both of which were banned from twitter & twitch for copyright violations (by the real models/identities), their 10 undisclosed asian backers who operate out of a multi million dollar office in Hong Kong (naturally not registered with the authorities), and their shady Iranian asset developers, who work on cutout projects and run bot farms.

Questionable production history and team aside, the game is well done and is coming along nicely. It's like President Putin went to Daybreak games and wanted a Mount & Blade knockoff, with some added features like open network connections, stolen art assets & bad AI to try and get people interested in raping & looting small countries. 

In that respect, the game works well. You get to caputre locals, raid their villages, execute hostages and that's about it.  

If you assume the game is likely a shell and keylogger and follow along, it could become something impressive or at least a proof of concept for a real studio to try and expand on the M&B concept.

If you look at the reviews, some of these are astroturf accounts on Steam, which is also a red flag. 

(I wish I was joking, but this post is 100% real on the warning & game quality / backer relationships).

If you like Mount and Blade you will enjoy this game.
The game is a bit smaller though and much more limiting although it is still an early access game so it is still going through the process of being completed. The game is in my opinion: 
A fun experince for short periods of time as there is still not a whole lot to do except the campain. 
I think this game could benifet with a skrimish mode outside of the campain like Star Wars Battlefront 1-2 and Mount and Blade Warband, also I'm saying it 100% needed but I feel like a multiplayer mode could be fun like a mix of the RTS such as Total War and then the ground combat and you and a friend could go up against each other in that mode with maybe up to four squads.
Overall I don't normally support Early Access Games unless I really think the game will be a fun final project. 

If you like Mount and Blade go ahead and get this as right now it feels like a mod for the game.

40833347.review:
Super połączenie FPS'ów taktycznych takich jak ARMA oraz gier o lekkim zabarwieniu strategicznym takich jak Mount&blade. Gra prezentuje się cudownie, grywalność jest na bardzo dużym poziomie. SI moze i lata jak pokuriwone i prawie wogule się nie chowa(jedynie co robi to kładzie się na ziemi).Wyspa jest w miarę duża,ale po obrębach jest strasznie pusta (miasta w sumie są perfidnie na środu mapy-wyspy).
Plusy:
-Możliwość rekrutacji i ulepszania jednostek
-Ostatnio dodani towarzysze,których można "dokoksić" dając im lepsze uzbrojenie i pancerz
-Trzeba myśleć nad ustawieniem żołnierzy,żeby stracić ich jak najmniej albo i wcale
-Latanie"na pałę" jest bezcelowe w początkowych fazach gry,ponieważ przeciwnik może ci sprzedać kontrolną bułe na łeb i stracisz całe hp
-Ogrom broni,a dzięki ostatnim patchom jest ich coraz więcej(kałachy,pistoleciki,snajpy,jest nawet i pompa (!) )
-Mapy są ogromne,więc w późniejszych fazach gry kiedy bedziemy mogli wysłać na mapę 70 żołnierzy (swoich) to prawdopodobnie będziemy mogli sobie zrobić obiad na naszych komputerach.
Minusy:
-Cholera ta gra MUSI mieć tryb co-op albo dobry multi skirmish,bo ta gra ma taki sam potencjał co Ziggurat i smutno by było patrzeć jak ta gra jest tylko na singla
-O SI mówiłem wcześniej
-Z każdym updatem jest zawsze jakiś błąd(mały ale jest). Teraz jak to piszę to jeżeli masz lunetę albo kolimatorek na broni to musisz go czasami schować do skrzynki,a potem znów go założyć,bo gra nie czyta ci to jako dodatek i bardzo przeszkadza w strzelaniu
-Domki na mapach to puste cegły. Nie dość,że drzwi są zrobione chyba kurwa ze zjaw(bo mozesz sobie przez nie przechodzić) to jeszcze na niektórych mapach domki sobie kurwa fruwają(bo tak xD)
-Chowanie się za drzewami to czasami katorga, musisz wyjebać się cały za drzewa że ubić typka który jest przed tobą i perfidnie się schował za nim(oczywiście jest on od ciebie oddalony o jakies 200-300 metrów). Drzewa nie mają swojej obwódki,bo czasami lekko się wychylam i mam typa na widoku ale nie strzelę bo mi przeszkadza niewidzialna część drzewa.
Dobra skończę z tymi minusami,bo nikt nie będzie chciał kupić tej gry (na szczęście te minusy są tak rzadkie,że przez ten cały czas trafiłem na nie dwa-trzy razy)
Co chciałbym aby dodali w najbliższych patchach:
-lepszy feeling strzelania
-Więcej broni oraz dodatków(mam na myśli jakieś lasery,szmery,bajery,pompki,rowery)
-W grze jest shotgun,który jest do teraz bezużyteczny. Chciałbym aby dodali mapy,gdzie takie bronie będą się sprawdzały świetnie(np jakaś opuszczona fabryka albo stara szkoła)
-Więcej miast oraz dodanie jakiś posterunków albo wiosek,gdzie możemy rekrutowac jakiś gówno szczelców (np:rekrutów z pisztoletem[specjalnie pisze z błędami wy małe grammar nazi :*] )
-Kiedy zaczynamy grę to zacznimy jako jedna jednostka,bez oddziału rekrutów i dwóch przydupasów z dwoma przydupasami na łebka
-Możliwość zakładania tymczasowych obozów,żeby się zregenerowac albo coś w tym rodzaju
-Chciałbym bardzo zobaczyć bitwy na morzu,gdzie wpierw bijemy się na odległośc,a potem po pokonaniu oddziału na statku to robimy im abordaż i wpieprzamy im się z butam do statku(chodzi mi że wchodzimy pod pokład) i wycinamy resztę przeciwników).Tak samo można zrobić z obleganiem miast.
-Nie chce aby dodawali pojazdów,ponieważ nie wszystkie miasta są na płaszczyznach i prawdopodobnie samochody i/lub czołgi miałby przesrane
Narazie to tyle co chciałem napisać ,jeżeli dotrwałeś do końca i nadal uważasz ze pod jakimś względem tak gra to gówno i powinni ją spalić/rozjebać/sprzedać rumunom za flaszkę wódki to wiedź że takiej drugiej gry(chyba xD) nie ma. Grę życzę z całego serducha,bo jak mówiłem wcześniej ma potencjał skubana :)

40832746.review:
从题材上来说是一个非常新颖的题材，自由度很高的和骑砍几乎一样的玩法。
但是就目前而言，游戏的不足之处还非常的多。但是总体上来说有成为大作的潜质。
但是具体能成为怎么样的一款游戏就看制作人员是不是愿意花心思下去做了。
不希望你们只是打着骑砍的情怀牌来小捞一笔。
首先这款游戏最不足的一点就是玩法太单一。说白了就是找人对枪，不像骑砍的冷兵器有很多流派和玩法。
武器决定了你在战场上只能远距离对点。既没有突突突的快感，也没有战术布置的全局感。
你不可能对着弹雨冲上去送，也没有什么帮你打破僵局的办法，只能远程用狙对点。
玩了三个小时，很快的就厌倦了。
我认为载具是拯救这游戏可玩性的最大改变。载具，载具，载具！！！！重要的事情说三遍。如果有坦克，武装直升机，这样的部署就可能就不是远距离对点了。
侧面包抄炸装甲，空中近距离支援，RPG反低空直升机。
如果没有这些就毫无战术层面的意义，仅仅是表现在战斗上的游戏很容易令人厌倦。
我希望这游戏的发展方向不仅仅是单人战斗，而是小地图战术，甚至是大地图战略的的发展方向。
说道战斗，战术，战略，这里不得不吐槽一下人物的AI，只能说是蠢得不行，甚至是对着脸上的墙开枪，却不会绕一步打后面的敌人。
我知道这是一个半成品，这样要求可能过于苛刻了，但是既然放出来发售了，那就是商品，还是要说一下真实情况的 。
如果认真制作，这种题材新颖的游戏假以时日可能会成为系列大作，就好像骑砍，使命召唤，古墓丽影这样的血统游戏。
一代一代的经典，但是我希望制作组能完善一下这游戏的玩法，就目前而言，还是太过于简陋了。
希望你们把这款游戏做成现代骑砍，国家战争的一般的游戏。而不是打着骑砍的名号捞金。

40825810.review:
Freeman Guerrilla Wafare has ALOT of potential, and clearly has devoted devs. This game gets bugfixes and major content updates very often. 

This game as I said has alot of potential, and has alot of good. It is shaping up to be something like Mount and Blade plus Arma, and it's very good. The gunplay is very smooth, and is realistic. The maps are very open, unless you are doing a town fight. Early game you don't do a whole lot of town fighting, but late game you certainly do. The optimization keeps getting better but still leaves a bit to be desired. Further more I think the guns, although fun to shoot, need more diversity. Burstfire weapons, guns with higher or lower rates of fire, and I think they should widen the damage band so as to allow more diversity in how much damage weapons do. I hope they add vehicles one day, that would be a load of fun.

Overall I do reccomend this game as it gets updated regularly. the devs are good, and the gameplay is fun. I hope to see this game succeed!

40795610.review:
So far this game looks promising, it currently feels a little bit bumpy and and becomes tedious pretty quick. still, this game has alot of potential. However, I heavily dislike the addition of companion, because the leveling aspect of the game is a bit counterproductive right now. it feels like a cheap way of locking a big army at the start and feels like a forced progressionblocker. The first view levels there isnt even a choice for your skillpoint spending, since you need to get the maximum amount of squad per battle up asap. In later stages of the game, most of your choices are useless, since you probably only use one weapon type anyway. (and the weapons arent realy a choice either, you quickly end up with a good long range weapon like the as val) Since the skills are capped based on your current level you are more or less forced to pick useless traits for your skillpoints. And this all becomes a way worse situatuon for your comapnion, because the skill that are usefull for your maincharacter like the ones which increase your squad/party limit, or your navigation seem not to be working when ypu also level these points up for your companion.

Right now i would NOT recommend to buy the game in the current state, it gets boring rather quick and the latest addition of these companions just force you to pay even more attention to a system, that was tedious and not well thought out in the first place.

But please, keep an eye on this game, because with a little love and effort it could develope into a real treasure.

40771340.review:
Schwere Zeiten sind angebrochen, Söldner streifen umher, Nahrungsmangel bedroht die Bevölkerung und eine funktionierende Regierung existiert nicht mehr.  Freeman Guerrilla Warfare punktet bereits mit seiner düsteren Zukunftsvision, kann es uns aber auch mit dem Gameplay begeistern?

[h1][b]Allgemeines[/b][/h1]
[u][Hierbei handelt es sich um eine frühe Version des Spiels][/u]
Freeman Guerrilla Warfare wirft uns zu Beginn auf eine große Insel. Wir blicken auf eine Einheit, welche auf einer großen Map, umringt von Städten und anderen Einheiten darauf wartet von uns gesteuert zu werden. Schnell wird klar, dass es sich hierbei um eine Art "Gruppe/Armee" handelt. 

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
Das Gameplay richtet sich vor allem an Spieler von Ego-Shootern und teilweise sogar Mount & Blade - Liebhabern. Auf der Karte hat man unendlich viel zeit, läuft das Taktiksystem auf der Karte nur bei der Bewegung der eigenen Spielfigur. Ihr steuert diese mit der Maus auf der Weltkarte von A nach B, handelt mit Städten, versucht Gegnern auszuweichen und/oder überfällt mit eurer Truppe eine Gruppe von Gegnern, während diese gerade ein Lager aufschlagen oder für euch einen Hinterhalt vorbereiten.
Dabei ist man am Anfang ziemlich auf sich alleine gestellt, ist das "Tutorial" nicht wirklich existent. Aber nach einigen Versuchen hat man das Spiel dann doch verstanden und weiß, wie man sich auf der Map zurecht findet.
Habt ihr euch nun schlussendlich dazu entschlossen eine gegnerische Gruppe anzugreifen, zoomt das Spielgeschehen auf eine weitere Taktikkarte. Diese ist kleiner und konzentriert sich auf einen kleinen Ausschnitt auf der großen Weltkarte. Hier positioniert ihr eure Truppen. Anhand von roten Bewegungspfeilen ist zu erkennen, woher die Gegner vermutlich kommen werden. 
Dann, nach der Aufstellung, lasst ihr euch selbst auf die Karte nieder und könnt in der gewohnten Ego-Perspektive dem Gegner einheizen.
Doch Vorsicht ist geboten. Ein wildes "Drauflosrennen" kann schnell zum Tod führen. Daher muss man taktisch und vorsichtig an die Sache heran gehen. Auf der Karte kann man seinen Truppen Bewegungsbefehle erteilen und so die Verteidigung aufbauen oder eben die Annäherung an den Feind organisieren. Der eigene Spieler kann sich Hinlegen, Hocken, rennen, vorsichtig vorrücken und und und. Veteranen aus der ArmA-Reihe fühlen sich hier vermutlich pudelwohl.
Dann, nachdem der Kampf beendet ist, kann man die Gegner looten und baut sich somit einen immer größeren Reichtum an. Dieser endet nicht bei dem Besitz der Truppe sondern mündet in dem Aufbau einer ganzen eigenen Stadt. Freeman bietet viele tolle Ansätze, befindet sich jedoch noch in der Entwicklung.

[i][u]Positiv[/u][/i]
[list]
[*]Gute Grafik
[*]Tolle Spielidee mit vielen taktischen Möglichkeiten
[*]Herausforderndes Gameplay. Man möchte immer mehr Gegner erwischen, bekämpfen und sich weiterentwickeln.
[*]Die Belohnung eines jeden gewonnenen Kampfes führt dazu, dass man sich immer größere Ziele steckt. 
[*]Egoshooter meets Stratege meets Management. Was will man mehr?
[/list]


[i][u]Negativ[/u][/i]
[list]
[*]Manchmal triste Umgebungen 
[*]Detailarme Karte
[*]Motivation fällt nach einigen Stunden rapide ab. 
 [/list]


[h1][b]Technik[/b][/h1]
Die Grafik schwankt zwischen wirklich hübsch zu furchtbar hässlich. Die Animationen der einzelnen Soldaten brauchen ein Update, wirken sie doch noch zu plastisch.
Das Spiel läuft auf Mittelklasse-Rechnern flüssig.


[h1][b]Wiederspielwert[/b][/h1]
Im Moment spielt man mehrere Runden und fragt sich dann, wann kommt mehr. Der Entwickler ist angehalten mehr Content zu bieten, denn ab einer gewissen Spielzeit ist leider etwas die Luft raus.

[h1][b]Fazit[/b][/h1]
Das Spiel ist derzeit für jeden etwas, der gerne Taktik-Shooter spielt und dazu auch etwas Managment nicht verachtet.


[h1][b]Zusatz[/b][/h1]

40755850.review:
总的来说是一款非常有趣的游戏，优点如下：
---骑马与砍杀风格的经济系统和战略系统；
---不错的战斗体验；
---瞄准镜设计相当考究；
---以班组为单位的募兵及战斗；
---弹道下坠，不同枪口初速的武器拥有不同的远距离弹道表现。
缺点也非常多，总结如下：
---经济系统不够完善，开局商店随机求购商品后不再有任何变化；
---装备系统尚未完工，有些装备槽根本没有对应的装备；
---BUG很多，战斗系统非常不完善，且中途不可退出，非常影响游戏体验；
---武器的分类和配件、对应的弹药种类很怪异，给人一种想把武器弹药真实化，却只做出一个残次品的感觉
---大地图中战略ai大量bug，两个人就敢围攻几十几百人防守的城市

总结：游戏本身很有趣，很好玩，喜欢骑砍且喜欢FPS游戏的朋友不妨尝试一下。但是明显是赶工出来的怪胎，还没做完就被制作组毫无诚意的拿出来上架。战场内整体还从凑合，大地图战略烂成狗屎。

购买建议：不建议购买。如果制作组不下血本好好的完善游戏、修复bug，那玩家一般也就只会玩十来个小时就会因为种种原因弃坑。现在这个游戏撑死值十五块。

还是希望这游戏能改得更好，从设计思路上讲真的是不错的好游戏。所以还是给个推荐吧！

40749404.review:
This is a great game with the potential to be an amazing one.

Pros:
- Still early access and updates are frequent. These guys really care about this game.
- Combat system is solid
- Being able to command your guys around the field in a map view as well as being able to fight fps, is amazing
- The concept/idea of this game fills a much needed hole in the market
- A really fun game. Even when you're losing and doing badly, I wouldn't describe it as frustrating or unenjoyable.
- There is a good amount of weapons and character customisation which is a fun aspect to this game - although the ability to actually see your character in the outfit you've selected would be cool.
- The sound effects in this game are great for an early access game. Really adds to the games atmosphere.

Cons:
- The AI in combat can be poor, and you'll see your guys lie down in the open NEAR cover, rather than behind it.
- When you tell your guys to move to a position on the map, they'll move to it.... roughly. When you tell them to move to an area because it'll provide them cover, they'll go in that general direction but they won't really register it as cover that they should hide behind.
- Relating to the previous point - AI have no awareness of buildings/structures. There are different buildings around the map, but if you tell your guys to move to a building that would be great for them to go into to take a defensive stance, they will just stand around the building. A way to improve this would be adding the option to "point and command" during the first person view. Being able to tell them to hug a wall for example.
- The quests and interactions are minimal. The only quests so far (that I've seen anyway) is to take/capture a certain amount of cities... which is a bit lazy. I get the impression this is because it is early access though and more intersting quests and interactions with parties will be added. An idea of having character Leaders for each parties going around would be a good idea and an opportunity to develop more interesting quests.

This is by far a perfect game, but it is very enjoyable. Even though I have quite a large list of cons, this is one of my favourite games to play at the moment and I don't see me getting particularly bored of it any time soon. The room for development that it has I think will gradually get addressed by the very active development team, and when they do get addressed, I could see myself logging an embarrassing amount of hours playing this game.

40742067.review:
Una bella sorpresa!
Quando uscì su Steam lo snobbai a causa del suo aspetto abbastanza "spartano". 
Dopo aver visto un paio di gameplay e le recensioni mi sono convinto a prederlo.
Passata mezz'ora, con mio grande stupore, mi stavo già divertendo.
Direi che il gioco è in una fase embrionale (alpha potremmo dire), c'è molto da ottimizzare e gli sviluppatori stanno lavorando assieme alla community per cambiare alcuni aspetti del gioco ed aggiungerne altri (moltissimi). Gli aggiornamenti sono costanti, anche più volte a settimana (e non si tratta solo di bugfix). 
I ragazzi che lo sviluppano hanno detto di ispirarsi a Mount&Blade, Arma e Stalker. Posso assicurarvi che il feeling delle armi è molto Arma/OFP style. 
L'ai è decente, le prestazioni devono essere migliorate (gli sviluppatori hanno promesso che ci lavoreranno a breve) soprattutto su cpu AMD, la grafica è discreta, i suoni sono ancora temporanei. Il mio consiglio è di non farvi ingannare da tutto ciò e di dare una chance a questi ragazzi, che stanno già lavorando per ampliare il gruppo con nuove assunzioni e migliorare le loro attrezzature per dare alla community il prodotto che desidera.

40707814.review:
*EARLY ACCESS REVIEW THAT MAY BE UPDATED LATER*

This is shaping up to be great game and I thoroughly recommend it to anyone who has been dreaming of a strategic modern FPS. It fills a niche that AFAIK no-one has yet really addressed - ARMA has tried to do it but their system was just too hard to use and not enough fun to play.

Basically you lead a small group of guerillas in a nation that is in a state of chaos, divided into factions controlling towns, and have the goal of founding your own state. At the start battles are very difficult, with only 10 men on your side against 15+ enemies even in the smallest group. Later on your group expands and you can upgrade your weapons an body-armour but you never feel like any battle bears no risk at all.

My main gripe at the moment is that there isn't enough in the way of a plot to the game, and that it doesn't really resemble guerilla warfare right now - instead its more like a turf war between factions in a failed state. Also the weapons upgrade a little too fast - you pretty much never use any of the less powerful/accurate guns. A bit more close-quarters combat in some battles might be good as well. These are all fairly minor complaints, though.

My ideal game would be one where you have to over-through a powerful government and have to grind your way up from leading a group of peasants army with hunting rifles, revolvers, and shot-guns battling against police/militia, to leading trained troops with modern assault rifles against fully equipped professional soldiers. Something like a modern version of the Cuban Revolution (but without necessarily having to be a communist) would be good.

40698904.review:
[h1] My Experience [/h1]

When I first saw this game on steam and realized what it was I instantly freaked out because I love M&B. First I can say this game is well worth the price it currently is ($15) and for it being at an early stage I'll try and write a fair review. So right now, as this game is, it's definitly playable. Right now theres one game mode called Domination where the goal is to take over the 10 towns on the map. You do so by getting better guns and armor and hiring/training an army. You get this money by defeating enemy squads roaming the map and selling their loot. (Some money is earned right after the fight). The money system is pretty well balanced I'd say. When your in what I would call a "battle mode" the game starts by giving you a command birds-eye view allowing you to see the enemies starting location an a chance for you to set up your squad. You can give them orders where to move, whether to be cautious or move fast, or follow you. The enemy AI and maps are a little iffy as of right now; sometimes I'll see rocks floating and AI will look up in the air or just stand still doing nothing while being shot at. The firefights are very fun though; large scale shooting with like 50 enemies while you're mowing em down is great. Truly a grind killing groups of people and selling their valuables and buying ammo and medpacks and upgrading my army to kill more things.

Here's a list of Pros and Cons I've experienced with this game:

[h1] PROS: [/h1]
- Very balanced economy
- Skills and Leveling
- Decent amount of guns
- Decent amount of gun and class/inventory customization
- Armor customization
- Smooth Gameplay
- Basic command system
- Can run town as you would normally (Taxes, add buildings for econ, garrison, etc.)
- Multiple factions
- Mount and Blade type feel

[h1] CONS: [/h1]
- Graphics are a little bleh
- Enemy AI can be stupid
- Not many commanding options
- Floating buildings and environtmental objects
- Can get repetetive
- No autosave
- One save slot
- Object hit-boxes can be a little too large
- No use for non-weapon/food/equipment related loot other than selling
(Why is there such a variety of only sellable loot?)

[h1] Things I can suggest adding in the future: [/h1]

- More guns and armor (of cooourrsee)
- Larger variety of troops
- Touch up the textures a bit
- procedurally generated combat maps
- Rotate the map where you can move and see towns n stuff
- Button to make all squads cautious or charge for commanding
- Larger map
- Tasks (Which I know the developers are working on can't wait)
- Generals or higher-ups for squads and factions for diplomatic reasons
- Able to join army of leader (off of last suggestion)
- top of screen compass HUD
- cancel medkit heal when moving
- Walk around town and see civilians doin civilian stuff

Im 100% positive if the devs keep up the good work and effort with this game it'll be very good in the future. As for now it gets a little repetetive after a while. Anyways a Mount and Blade type game with guns is dope props for making it and I hope Freeman: Guerilla Warfare has a thriving future and I'll surely be looking forward to it.

40683847.review:
I will preface this review with the fact that I have played hundreds of hours of the Mount and Blade series. It is blatantly obvious that this game borrows heavily from that serious, which is a large part of the reason that this game is so good. If you are not a fan of Mount and Blade, you will likely not enjoy this game.

Like the Mount and Blade serious, this game allows a player to act as an adventurer in a hostile world with a group of followers awaiting your command in battle with the goal of establishing your own state. This game is definitely still bare-bones but is showing a ton of potential.

What makes this game different than Mount and Blade is the setting and the type of Warfare. The environment is definitely Easter Europe, and rather than a medieval world, it is a modern setting (possible post apocalyptic?).

This game includes a world travel mechanic, a first-person shooter battle function that includes a strategy/command function. On the world map their are towns and other parties to interact/battle with. At the towns there are merchants, hospitals, mercenaries and barracks to do business with for equiring equipment, healing and troops. The world map includes a day and night cycle and weather cycle which both influcence and are represented in the gameplay in the battle mode.

The Battle mode is still pretty basic but very fun. In the beginning, you place your troops and give them move orders and other orders. The friendly AI isn't the best (they try to shoot through objects), but they at least make some attempt to stay in cover and move in formation. The enemy AI varies heavily on their combat level, which is pretty realistic and cool. I would really like it if friendly troops could garrison buildings and other types of cover. What I like most about the battle portion of the game is that the gunplay is pretty decent. A lot of shooters are very lazy when it comes to shooting mechanics, but this game is an exception to that. Muzzle velocity of weapons matters, because ballistics exist. Also, it is necessary to use bullet impacts on the environment to determine point of aim hold over. It is important to control recoil as well. There are also a handful of accessories that you can attach to your weapons. Not bad. To speak to the battle maps, they are definitely not randomly generated, as I've only seen about a half dozn different maps used. However, the maps are decent in size, and the locations that you and the enemy start at always change, meaning the setup will usually be different.

I'll sum this up with a few pros and cons

Pros:
+ Borrows heavily from the successful Mount and Blade series
+ Good gun play
+ Factions offer some variation in troops
+ Decent variety in weapons to choose from (for a game in alpha)
+ Towns offer plently of resources to supply yourself and your troops
+ Economic/merchant system is decent

Cons:
- Map isn't easy to navigate
          Needs compass, more ability to zoom out
- Needs more faction variety
- Gun models look goofy
- Bugs exist, but none of them game-breaking, most just deny the use of some content
- AI could use improvement
- Very little instruction. Very hard to play for those with no Mount and Blade experience

In summary, this is a high quality alpha game and shows a lot of promise for its eventual release.

8/10 would go guerrila again

40658249.review:
提几个小问题吧
1 地图对地形的判断太不友好了， 而这游戏布局真的很依赖地形，在高地和在低地是两个打法 。
2 枪械还是稍微少了点，初期没多难就买了个ak12，然后就没啥武器可以换了，为啥手下都有scar，巴雷特什么的而我却买不到啊。
3 枪模没有体现出差异性。我试了几款枪，感觉差别都不大，反正都是打点射，说实话ak12配个带刻度的瞄具可以完全取代狙击枪，平均三发就可以打死一个队友还打不到的人，就算没打死也能压制住一个小队，子弹便宜，弹夹大，初速不低，威力也是第二高的。比起15000的慢射速狙性价比不知高到哪里去了
4 任务太少了，应该加些0友好度也能接的任务，城镇也需要加些任务。
5 守城明显比攻城困难，攻城只用把人排一排，之后就不用管了，敌人自会冲过来受死，守城由于房子的切割，敌人方向的不确定，加上部署小队的有限， 很难制定好的阵型，很容易就被人渗透了，建造工事也没明显的作用。
6 敌人进攻方向的不确定，红箭头的意义到底是什么呢？经常敌人完全不按箭头方向进攻，例如一边三个箭头，一边一个箭头，结果一个箭头的方向来了主力。要么就是箭头明明很远，结果开局就遇敌了。
7 npc之间没有互动啊，希望能加入npc互打然后玩家帮忙加好感的设定。npc跟玩家的互动也很少，土匪恐怖分子大部分时间都不会主动攻击你，哪怕他比我强很多。看我来也不会跑，只会傻傻的给我送经验。

40632082.review:
Well, it's a bit like a mount and blade: warband mod, with an unfinished map and floating rocks, tents, and trees. I mean, there are a few good parts to this game, I found it fun for a few hours. A few things..

First : Instead of using 1-3 for your weapons, the mouse wheel would be better.

Second : More laid out unit stats and weapons, the weapons my units carry don't seem to have descriptions, just pictures.

Third : While commanding units from the map is nice, it would be great to have a command while outside the map, saying "Find Cover" where units run to cover. This means you should mess with tree stumps and such more. It's fine if you only have like..3-4 Overworld maps.. just make sure they work. Infact, unit commands in general would be nice. Select a unit with 1-0 or whatever you need.. and then issue commands like *Run*, *Crouch*, *Prone*, *Grenades*


Fourth : Unit Veriety, so, having Rpgs is nice, but grenade launchers would also be nice. Having a unit go from Recruit, to Soldier, to Grenedier, to Elite ranger or whatever, is kind of boring.


Fifth : Character customization, things like looks, origin, and so fourth, which change your base stats and such..

Sixth : Leadership and command should be the same thing, so far it's a bit confusing on how it's written. I do like how there are only 3 attributes however.

Aside from all of that, the truth is, this feels like a serious Mount and Blade: Warband copy, or, an incomplete mod from Mount and Blade: Warband. . so I feel a bit odd buying this so far. I'm really hoping the game goes further than where it currently is, it has SUCH potential and I genuinely suggest people to play it.

Don't get me wrong, I definetly like this game, but it needs a lot of work.

40622944.review:
这款游戏刚刚上架Steam就被我发现了，小厂商游戏所以一开始并没有bia上首页大图，都是推荐那里看到的。之后看到了商店页面的介绍，武装突袭与骑马与砍杀的结合，我就把它买了。
刚刚下完，打开游戏看到主菜单，满脑子的绝望，因为主菜单和国产游戏斩毒黑与白特别相像，哇，那个游戏真的不想提有多差劲了。
然后还是点开了开始游戏。OK一大堆英文介绍统统不看，翻译起来太麻烦了，直接创建阵营。投放到大地图后发现，欸，进入后感觉不错哟。打开任务一看，占领10个城，emmmm。就我这10个小兵加把小手枪。
接下来就是赚钱之路，专门指着土匪抢劫，抢他们的钱，抢他们的枪，攻他们的城。最后走向人生巅峰。
游戏体验，怎么说呢，没有武装突袭3这么难吧，那个是出了名的硬核，操作上和吃鸡的FPP模式差不多。一开始开镜瞄准手抖还以为了是为了真实感，原来只是个bug哈哈哈，后来开发商修复了。
指挥作战方面的话，很爽，感觉你就是李云龙，你的部下全是二营长，只有意大利炮，和全体上刺刀吹冲锋号。现代战争背景的话，和骑砍的战略不同，中世纪讲究的就是弓箭手压制步兵，骑兵压制弓箭手，步兵阻挡骑兵，都是一个个方阵的进攻，现代战争更多的是打游击，单兵作战。所以指挥策略也不能直接蛮干。地图上侦察地形，只要攻下占据有利地形就能以少胜多。
最后要说，国人开发商真的特别良心，三天一更新，各种修复bug和更新新的内容，并且简体中文很快也更新出来了。点个赞！

40598560.review:
Let's be honest, it's gonna be a Mount and Blade clone but with guns. Arma? No. Simply no.

Fun mechanics with a very active dev team (when needed, mods are more active), frequent updates (slower now than before but obviously due to heavier mechanics being added. Crossreference this review date with News Updates from this date.)\

Graphics are nice for and indie team that seems to be taking minimal risks(as per the best referance, they beat Mount and Blade- unmodded). Could they go back and fix things up? Yeah.  Will they? Probably. I don't know. I hope so. - Sound is also fine. Could use more dynamic sounds or at least outside sounds with a falloff raidous)

Battle Maps are bland. They'd fit Mount and Blade well, sure. But for a shooter... they're just... no. Fine to an extent but c'mon. The team knows what they can achieve so hopefully they do. 

So far there are no city maps, no maps that could lead to a narrow heavy 'contention' area/battles (sadly, the best reference is lanes in MOBAs or hell, even city maps from Garrys Mod)
So don't expect to be wowed by the Battle Maps. The crew could certainly use some extra minds to help create maps outside the box. (Naturally, no objective based battles have been implemented yet but i've heard rumours of them)

As for the World Map, it is currently small. Does this mean the Early Access game will end quick? No. I had to restart around 5 times to finally get how i could 'juke' the game to get ahead and finally progress without running out of funds and squad mates (Yes. The start is very unbalanced. My tip - sell your pistol and all ammo, let your crew win a few rounds by themselves, buy a cheap rifle and then watch the progression skyrocket)

Back on track - the world map is small, but eventually you'll hit a grind (mine came heavily after my first base capture, before that, the grind was what any gamer will come to expect).
Obviously they're still adding features. So you're gonna hit a point where it becomes stagnant. Does that mean it isn't worth it? Buddha, no. 

Easily, one can see this game being worth upward to $40 max (to reiterate... MAX) if the Devs add more Battle Maps variety, expand World Map (and honestly, even that needs more variety or at least visual flair), and naturally - implement the features from Mount and Blade fully. It'd be nice to see what innovation can come from it being an FPS though (see current news of future off map Artillery)

Mod Tools would be very welcomed as well to assure longevity of this game as a service, unless they plan to make a sequel within under a year of release and make the game less of a service and more of a profit margin.

TL:DR - Game is great for early access, but sadly lacking in variety and understandably lacking in features. Worth the buy as a future investment.

My friend who did two tours in the Middle East thinks not being able to put your night op specs over your goggles -in his case, which would protect from sand or even wind in general- is silly. 40589810.review:
I've been playing this game for a few hours now and for a game that is essentially still a work in progress, I'm impressed.  The strategic element of building your rebel army, upgrading your squads, seiging towns and issuing orders to create flanking routes in the field so far is very satisfying.  Each engagement feels different and tense, especially at higher difficulties.  Play it how you want it whether you're RTS heavy and outmanuever your enemy with calculated orders or FPS heavy and want to join your men in the field.  There's still a lot more the studio is working on so don't sell it short if its not your thing right now.   

My personal recommendations for improvement would be to make issuing orders from the map a bit smoother especially when you're in a firefight, tweak the enemy AI so that once they're engaged enemy squads converge and try to flank you and possibly add in voice commands for a headset.  Other than that, its a solid game that I'm more than excited to see how it evolves.

Tactiquement c'est assez  bien avec le concept de géré son perso en FPS + des groupe de combat ttactiquement ça change d'un FPS classique. De plus le côté balistique, couvert et IA amie comme ennemie sont bien. Ceci dit on atteint vite les limites et les mission se ressemble beaucoup 
Lors des première mission on se tape le même terrain au moins 3 fois sur 5 .

Sur le plan rpg gestion du personnage et des équipes l'interface est simple mais bien avec gestion des armes de la nourriture de l'équipement  cependant là aussi  on s'aperçoit rapidement que pour l'instant beaucoup d'item (équipement , radio carte, pelle, electronique...) ne sont là que pour vendre et acheter sans réelle utilisation derrière.  Est-ce en dévelloppement ou cela restera t'il ainsi ???  

Sur le plan stratégique, on se balade et attaque des ennemie ou on va dans des villes pour vendre et acheté  on peut aussi les attaquer, les occuper et les faire prospérer .  Disons le tout net la partie gestion est logique mais simpliste voir ridicule et c'est moche 

Donc oui pour le concept et la tactique façon mount and blade mais pour l'instant non pour tout les reste. Beaucoup de travail avant d'en faire un bon jeu non répétitif et simpliste.

Le gros bug qui m'a fait abandonné : Après la prise de ma première ville  quand j'ai voulu revenir sur le jeu la sauvegarde m'a ramener au début de la campagne... Il me fallait reprendre à 0 j'ai donc abandonner

40582647.review:
Преде всего хочу написать вот что. Очень многие в обзорах сравнивают эту игру с M&B, в этом конечно есть небольшая доля правды. Но поиграв в нее пару часов, я понял, что в этой игре из-под каждого куста торчат уши Jagged Alliance 2. Конечно JA2 на момент выхода была полностью допиленной, но будем что разработчики Фримана допиляет и его со временем.

Плюсы:
1. Довольно интересное сочетание стратегии и шутера

Минусы - через несколько часов игры, в ней уже нечего делать:
1. Скудный арсенал вооружения
2. Однообразные карты - их 3 или 4 и через пару часов непрерывного чередования, они начинают надоедать. Причем карты ставятся вне зависимости от местности на глобалке.
3. Непонятный лут. Ну это как минус, так и плюс, смотря с какой стороны посмотреть. Сейчас в игре куча лута, как например бензин, или карты, совершенно не юзабельны. С ними ничего не сделать, кроме как продать. Но есть подозрение, что разрабы запилили их в игру не просто так и в дальнейшем лут будет нужен для создания чего-то (опять же как в JA2)
4. Отсутствие квестов. Их нет вообще
5. Пустой мир. Кроме фракционных отрядов там нет вообще никаких других неписей. Это не есть гуд. Все-таки ходить и все время выпиливать кого-то, надоедает.

Одним словом - потенциал у игры есть. Ничуть не пожалел потраченных денег, несмотря на явную недонасыщенность игры. Будем понадеяться, что разрабы не бросят проект и допилят его.

40558610.review:
For an early access game, this is pretty well done.

AI is decent. It can be easily outsmarted, but has it's moments. For instance, if you spray bullets around an enemy, they freak out and lay down, hoping to not be shot. Except they're in the middle of the field and making themselves bigger targets. 

There is the ability to play stealthily, and you can take entire towns solo, but it's extremely hard to do.

I'd like to see more uses for the items in game. Water and Pills, for example, are strictly trading supplies, and aren't useful in-game (at least from what I've played). I feel like if there's more uses for the items, that the gameplay would be much more involved. IE, do I use the pills to speed up recovery, or sell them for extra magazines? Should I trade away the shovels I've found, or use them to entrench a city of mine? 

I'd also like to see a way to automate your troops. An option to follow, or dig themselves into cover. Often times your allies will lay in the middle of the field instead of attempting to take cover behind the tree stump right next to them. 

Also, the ladders and things attached to buildings really need to be useable. The first one I encountered was a stairway to the top of a building and I ended up walking right through it. Kinda lame. 

Still, I bought this game and played it for 10 straight hours.... And truth be told it only feels like it's been about 2 or 3. So.... let that be my closing words.
40558610.developer_response: Thank you for such a detailed review, we will work on that!

40546575.review:
The premise sounds rather complicated and gives the reader a sense of grandeur but it is barebones as of now.  To be fair, it's a decent fun game for $15.

Basically a Modern-era Mount and Blade or at least has the core basics of that game. 

Troops: Recruit, replenish, upkeep and upgrade as they grow with experience. Troops aren't customizable as of now, there's  supposed to be plans for future squads acting like the companions in M&B with gear. Each faction has it's own base recruit squad and can be upgraded later on. Mercs act the same way but can often be recruited at the highest level. Better troops means better firepower and higher upkeep. However, I've seen high level troops get wrecked by basic recruits due to the AI.

Towns: Structures are built immediately after purchase. Affects properity and "security" (Barely. The more prosperous the town, the better the merchants restock it seems. Purchase items and sell for a profit in another town. Gear, weapons and recruitment. 

Gear: Standard fare of having armor for body parts (torso, legs, etc). Ammo for weapons are kept in belts and reloading discards a whole mag. 

Guns: Only several available right now and the Machine Gun seems to be the better off since it has better trade-off when it comes to ammo per magazine and range/damage. There is a bullet drop system, pretty easy to learn after a few clicks.

Factions: Move across the map and have their own settlement. Pay tribute and become friendly but they seem to allow you to wander into their towns no matter the level of hostility so long as you pay a "safe passage" fee. There's a few factions but most don't really feel that different from each other as of now.

Combat: AI is somewhat sluggish but manages to be at least be a threat or at least a nuisance. AI squad isn't the greatest at path finding but it does the job most of the time. Placement matters a lot here, higher terrain with cover(trees) can absolutley be lethal. Squads will take cover or go prone if necessary. I've taken heavily fortified towns with just a  few Sniper squads and Machine Gun teams. 

Overall a decent fun simplistic M&B shooter. Devs seem to be active on the discussion board and constantly offering updates/patches. I'm usually against Early Access games but this one is all right. Probably wait until it gets better patches and added content. 

$15 no regrets. Had fun for a few days.

The content in this game is equal to about half of an old PS1 Demo.  The AI is terrible, your soldiers will literally shoot into a hill because there are enemies on the other side.  The bandits in the map just walk back and forth.  There are several items in the game that do absolutely nothing.  Very buggy, crashed my computer several times... in fact I had to buy a new one after it crashed and my hard drive never came back online!! 40525393.review:
This is simular to Warband in respect to the world map, trade, and slightly for the encounter event combat.  It does have far better modern combat then Warband offered in the various mods found over the years.  It does need more content for the current sandbox map.  I made my way around the map to the multiple towns, but never found a quest beyond the win condition you get a the start.  While some more options for weapons/gear might be nice I do not see a reason for it beyond cosmetic options.  Adding different ammo (AP, FMJ, HP) to counter armor, cause bleed damage, or other effects might add to the combat experience.  More food/medicine items could offer a bit more challenge for morale of troops, and also health options.  This would be for faster healing due to more food variety, and better medical care due to varied drugs/supplies.  Vehicles might be okay for world map travel, but I do not think they would help encounter event combat.  Tanks, Humvees, and other vehicles would not add to the experience.  I even think adding simple support options due to vehicles like faster resupply, reinforcement, and supporting fire might lower the experience rather then add to the tactics.

Overall I liked my play experience so far, and look forward to what the future holds.  I have spent much free time on Warband, and the mods for it, just enjoying the sandbox open world experience.  I see that happening with Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare.  I dare say I might even enjoy a zombie mode of this game.  I do hate that I want a zombie mode, but I could see that working with this games decent FPS combat.

40517709.review:
之前在简单模式下开着内置修改器（ End键）摸鱼，最近才开始打困难。发现这游戏是有很大的发展空间的。。
[spoiler] 坦克DLC，飞机DLC，战场支援DLC，单人任务DLC，德国枪械美国枪械DLC，这都是钱啊！！！！ [/spoiler]
以下是我的一些看法：
首先是优点：
1 中文！（当然还是要努力，文本夹在源代码里想想就难受）
2 最高配和最低配两个游戏，对我这样的渣机很友善。
3 真实的弹匣，换弹癌的末日
4 真实的弹道与后坐力（准星在打一枪后不会回去的那种）
5 昼夜交替，天气变化，夜战与夜视仪（感觉后期会出热成像吧）

然后是缺点，bug（应该算是bug）与建议
1 大地图部队好像加了物理碰撞，会出现几个部队卡在一起的情况（还是去掉比较好）。
2 枪械有些少（ar41加上镜能打天下，RPG前期买不起，后期鸡肋）。
3 追击的判定很迷，离着很远（相对骑砍）就能被追上。
4 城市防守成功后，部队全部跑到了自己的部队栏里面而不是城中。
5 几大势力好像之间不会互相征伐（应该是没做好的缘故，或者说是城太少，怕他们开战一不小心就给打没了）。
6 ai的问题。被打就趴下是很好的，但为什么他们会打天打地？寻找掩体的判定也很迷，人多时总会有几个人卡bug一直向一个方向跑，然后卡在地图边界。

好像就这些了，应该还是有其他的但我给忘了。
最后还是要期待一下创意工坊，毕竟这类游戏是少不了这种DIY的。[spoiler] 幻想乡万岁！紫小可爱万岁！ [/spoiler]

可以说是十分有毒了，两天玩个不停。

就现在来看，武器系统十分寒碜，枪可以说是少的可怜。
射击手感 可能是我技能点不够，也可能是原本就很写实，也有可能是单纯的进度还没到，总之十分反玩家反人类反社会。
推荐个小诀窍，反正这游戏现在所有枪的弹道后座都是一样的，准心瞄到人然后打五枪，然后准心再移会之前的点继续打五枪，如此反复。
ai特强 尤其是友军的ai，能打能抗甚至还会帮你在地图上做标记，理论上来说你只要把他们领到交战区然后原地趴下看杂志就可以了。这是我玩的第一个人头抢不过友军ai的游戏。
顺便一提，既然是骑砍类 当然是有个部队养成系统，当然现版本也是十分的寒酸，不能给手下配装备只能经验满了后然后升级。经验系统很迷，连着打了七八场经验都没长过。就目前来看我是没看出来分支狙击手啊机枪手啊突击队啊有什么区别，除了每个都比我强。希望以后能加入支援型队伍 迫击炮小队 无线电兵之类，方便我交战后趴下看杂志。
你现在可以给ai发指令，大概分成两条 跟着我和不跟着我，希望以后能。。。。 妈呀这就是废话，能让我的部队直接a过去好让我直接什么都不用管玩会手机战利品就到手了。
跑商系统不存在的，我随便到街边抢点可怜巴巴的强盗的东西都比这个赚钱。
ui可以说是惨不忍睹，可能随便找个黄油做的都比这个好。
没有自动保存系统 必须手动保存，至于我怎么知道的只可意会不可言传。

以上全都是加分项所以我给好评

40483846.review:
这个游戏还有很多的提升空间，首先这个游戏的基调是现代战争，他做现代题材的mod就比骑马与砍杀更方便，骑马与砍杀我觉得更适合做冷兵器到一战的mod，而自由人这款游戏则更适合做二战以及以后的战争题材的mod，各有千秋，但是由于在开发阶段现在缺点也是很多的。
第一个缺点
bug就很多，而且有些bug比较让人丢失游戏体验，比如死活找不到最后一个人在哪，开秘籍击杀也杀不死，最后就得读档重来，如果你是艰难取胜的话，这个bug就很烦了。还有就是房屋经常悬在空中，队友卡在一个点上不肯走。这个希望作者可以慢慢打补丁，修复。
第二个缺点
就是这个游戏不像骑马与砍杀经营方面的功能那么丰富，可以说除了招兵和修几个城镇中的建筑物以外就没得了，外交方面也几乎为0，后期有钱了，无论那个阵营想停战都可以直接花钱停战。而且管理方面也没有什么需要管理的，也没有手下帮你带兵去打仗。他更偏向于是一个加了大地图功能的武装突袭，而不是加入枪战系统的骑马与砍杀。你很难从这个游戏体会到像骑马与砍杀一样征服大陆的快感，。当然可能这就是为啥取名叫游击战争的原因，游击嘛。
第三个缺点
野怪兵种的名字不晓得是汉化的原因还是啥原因，在刚刚开始玩的时候完全不晓得各个兵种之间的强弱，除了正规部队能大致看出来以外，野怪是很难区别的，比如到底是土匪小队强还是强盗小组厉害还是掠夺者更强，到底哪个是一级兵种，哪个是高级兵种？我曾经带着2个fac新兵小队去打2组掠夺者小队真的是被打出屎了。所以对于新手要一个更好的指导，比如可以直接标注一个等级，或者改一个更有比较性的名字。
第四个缺点
战斗方式太单调。主要就是机枪，步枪和狙击枪，外加点火箭筒，而且还没有载具系统。连一匹马都没有。既然是现代战争还是号称结合武装突袭的佳作，载具系统我认为是必不可少的。加入载具系统将会让整个游戏玩法更丰富，同时为更多优秀mod的制作提供了便利，玩骑马与砍杀mod的我就没遇到一个做现代或者近代载具系统做的完美的。只能往魔幻的方向走因为制作商根本不想让坦克飞机出现在中世纪。但是本作不一样啊，是现代战争，加入载具系统是非常好的一次尝试，如果能加入空军系统，那简直不要太牛逼。所以我们玩家还是希望以后能在正式版中看到更多的枪支，更多的配件，更多的载具方式。
第五个缺点
弹药问题。前期被土匪虐了几波后没钱买一堆子弹放在仓库，致使打着打着就没子弹了的这种经历相信有部分玩家是体会过的，这个游戏就是这样，他的弹药系统和骑马与砍杀完全不一样，他是一个弹药打完就消失了的，而不是下一把重新填满，这个样做也不是不好，毕竟这样可以让玩家知道子弹的珍贵，每一次都不敢乱开枪。这样是可以增加游戏的硬核性，就如同武装突袭一样，但是作者要知道我们没子弹之后真的就啥用没有了啊，连近战攻击都没有啊，这个就让人有点摸不着头脑了，难道作者没想过这个问题嘛。当然作者可能想过，毕竟商店战利品都会刷出铲子，野战刀这类物品，说明作者会出近战系统。我觉得现在的单药系统是需要改良的。
第六个缺点
掩体问题。大家都知道每张随机生成的地图都会有许多房子，（这里我可以告诉大家一个可能大家没怎么发现的小秘密，大多数的门都是空气，大家直接走进去就可以了），但是我们的电脑ai却不能进去驻防，或者把房子当作掩体，他们只能蹲下，或者趴下，这就让房屋变得毫无意义，这个希望未来能推出更聪明的AI，以及更丰富的建筑物，让巷战成为可能。
第七个缺点
毫无作用的一些武器配件，消音器，对就是他，唯一一个枪头配件。无论玩家在多远，只要玩家击杀了一名小队成员，该小队都会在5s之内找到玩家并开始攻击，这就让消音器完全成了摆设了啊，还不如给我一个补偿器呢。当然这就牵扯到上个缺点中的AI问题了。
最后一个缺点
也是我觉得最不好的一个缺点，场景单调，毫无背景故事可言。没有任何平民，没有任何可以进入的地方，没有如同骑马与砍杀中的酒馆，竞技场，城镇中心，监狱那样的建筑，都没有，玩家只能在大地图和战场之间切换，没有丰富的场景可以缓解这种审美疲脑，没有将领系统，没有领袖，没有国王。这样会觉得游戏太过于空洞，这个是最严重的问题，这直接影响玩家玩这个游戏的时长。每个势力给我的感觉都如同野怪一样，玩家只自理自立。这样我最多玩1、2个小时就会让我觉得这个游戏变得很无聊的感觉。很久很久才会再打开一次。而不会像骑马与砍杀一样，惦记着我的阵营，我国家的战争，我领主与我的好感度，我的威望有多少，我的荣誉有多少，我的城镇建设的咋样了，我的小村庄学校建造好没啊。这些丰富的游戏系统是骑砍有这么多死忠的重要原因之一，还有就是丰富的mod。自由人当然也不例外。这都需要在以后的版本中更新。
第一次些这种评测还写这么多是因为我确实喜欢这款游戏。我不是想挑刺，我就是想这个游戏能越做越好，越来越火。毕竟这个游戏的潜力是非常巨大的。希望这个游戏在2018年给我们带来更多惊喜。

40476772.review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Freemen: Guerilla Warfare is hybrid FPS and Strategy game. The player finds themselves the leader of a group of guerilla soldiers as you try to create and defend a new nation. The overworld has the player going to allied towns to trade, get recruits, or potentially attack. Enemies can be battled on the overworld also. Battles with enemy groups are in an FPS style where the player can order their soldier to move in a real time tactics style. 

[h1]Game Breakdown[/h1]
[u]Gameplay:[/u]
When a player starts up the game they are thrown right into the game. The player’s goal is to craft a strong nation of 10 cities. During this overworld phase the player is free to trade, recruit, and battle enemies. By default the player is allied with American style army and the Russian style army. The player is at war with bandits and terrorists. Each faction has its own units with their own unique upgrades, so it can be important to diversify a player’s army. The player is also force to pay and feed their army. These are both due at the end of a day, which last a while, and are received when an enemy army is defeated. The overworld management is very similar to Mount & Blade, so if you enjoy that kind of game and FPS games, then this is the title for you.

The game also has an RPG system. The player’s character will gain experience for killing units and participating in battles. This allows the player to gain stat points such as strength, dexterity, and intelligence. Strength give more HP and inventory slots, dexterity provides a boost in weapon damage, and intelligence provides an extra skill point for every point in the stat. Skill points allow the player to get better with certain weapons types such as rifles or heavy weapons. Others proved extra loot, more unit experience, and extra inventory slots.

Upon entering a battle, the tactics screen appears. The player can then deploy their recruited squads to fight alongside them. Squads can then be given orders such as multiple movement order. Units can also be told how to move such as charge which makes all your units run in a straight line no matter what, and proceed with caution where a player’s units will wall cautiously until they see an enemy. They will then move into cover and shoot back. Units can also be ordered to retreat, where they will run back to the spawn point and leave the battlefield. This is useful if a squad has heavy morale loss or only has one member left. 

The player joins the fight with their own specially equipped inventory. The FPS mechanics are really solid and an enjoyable experience. Bullet spread and recoil make sure that every shot has a certain inaccuracy. Player weapons can also gain attachments such as a scope, a flashlight, or silencer. Stealth works surprisingly well, and definitely feels like a viable strategy. The player can also equip body armor. This will slowly break as it takes damage, but it will often save valuable hp. What I really like about this game is that even though the player has an RPG system, they aren’t some superhuman gunslinger. A player who isn’t properly equipped will die just as quickly, if not faster, than their units.

[u]Sound:[/u]
The weapon sounds are so satisfying and were recorded very well. Each shot felt like it had a weight to it. Body armor sounds are also great. My adrenaline started pumping when I was low health and heard the “ting” of body armor breaking instead of my hp. Footstep sounds are decent and are just an ambient sound like in most games. Besides battle sounds, there aren’t that many sound effects which I found enjoyable as they didn’t distract from this game’s tense combat.

 [u]Graphics:[/u]
The graphics in this game are surprisingly good for an indie title. The weather effects are just beautiful. I loved the rain effects as they really add some interesting variety in a game that could start to look graphically stagnant. Weapons look amazing and so do the character models. The animations could use some work however. Characters getting up from the prone position while firing look very odd.
The HUD is minimal and non-obtrusive. The developers have created a perfect balance of informational, and leaving screen space open. The same goes for the strategy layer's graphics. The UI is minimal but effective allowing me to effortlessly create a strategy instead of being troubled by menus.

[u]Performance:[/u]
The game runs quite well. When I turned down the graphics from very high to high, I had difficulty telling these graphic levels apart. This allows players with lower specs to enjoy just as much graphical fidelity. I am also happy to report that overworld doesn’t have any lag even though there are often many different armies walking around simultaneously. I think there is currently a bug where units will look straight up after standing up after being prone.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[u]Pros:[/u]
Solid FPS Gameplay
Great Developer Support
Great Performance
Great Graphics

[u]Cons:[/u]
Animations Could Use Some Work
Tooltips could use some work.

[u]Rating[/u]
[b]8/10[/b].

If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url]

40470641.review:
Fantastic. Fantastico.
Of course the game is on early access but the core and essence of it is very well denoted. It is more than obvios that it's biggest inspiration has been Mount&Blade Series and guess what, it works. 
Think about it. M&B Series are all about Medieval warfare, how could Modern warfare fit into this style? 
Well basically, moving your "Character/Party" across the map is of course quite boring sometimes, (in both games) unless you have a mission or need to fullfill, but here, the combat turns into something completely new as the game has a great AI and combat mechanic. Completely different to many other shooters we can come across. Think about ArmA for instance. It is a Slow paced warfare game (And an excellent one) yet, haven't you tried searching a game that actually gives you any sort of freedom, action and actual tactics in the midst of combat? Worry no more. F:GW is your pick! 
So far, you'll be able to pick between several rifles, pistols, SMGs, even machineguns and an RPG. Also, there is lot of gear to protect yourself, and this is something i really have to point out. Getting a good helmet for example, will not only protect you more but also keep your head in place one you are hit. Same goes for the vests. 
Creating an army is WAY easier than M&B series (and sorry for repeating this too much) so far, but loosing it is also quite easy. Tactics are essential, and besides the game so far is really limited when it comes to the orders and the maps, it is simple incomparable to run between the woods, a hill or even in the open field while getting shot from every place, then taking cover, ordering your troops what to do while these inform you what the hell is going on! 
The campaign map is of course really basic so far. There are basically not many missions, or diplomacy, but so far this game is SO promising i can't stop playing... at least just for the combat! 
I highly recomend it!

40464167.review:
For a Early Access game, this game is fairly well polished.  Granted, it does still need a few tweaks here and there, but it does offer lots of hours of fun.  Basically, the best way to describe this game would be to take Mount and Blade, and add in FPS to it.  

That being said, the game does come with a few quirks, but judgeing from the Dev team's response to issues addressed on the forums, they are looking at and working on them.  Granted, not every issue can be addressed, but their presence and interaction with the community is pretty solid.

Now for Pro's vs Con's:

Pros:

Visual:

Visually the game isn't stunning, but it still renders a respectful graphical approch.  There are a few things that need to be fixes (mostly in the deployment map,  It can be difficult at times to properly judges the height and incline of hills) However all in all, the graphics are pretty well done, especially when zooming, even though the graphics at times may seem a bit...clunky/rectuangler.

Audio:
The ambient sounds while in battle are well done, and give you a excellent heads up to local surroundings.  The audio helps you "audioably" locate the next battle, as well as if there are a few enemy units taking pot shots at you.

The only down side is that when you or one of your teammates are hit, it sounds like glass shattering, not actual body hits.  This may have been by design, but it can be a wee bit jarring.

Gameplay:
This game is very fun, and I find that I can loose myself for a hour or two, killing bandits and the such, as well as building up my company.  It very fun, and I've spent quite a few hours working on my own stratagey, as well as stareing at the deployment map, re-adjusting my attacks and such to make sure that my units level up and get the most exp possiable; all the while closing the map to wreck the poor sap that tried to step up to me.  

All in all, this game IS fun, and a enjoyable experiance.  The devs are very active on the forums, and they deserve respect.  Not may AAA titls even come close to this closeness of interaction with the community.  They have a long way to go, and they know it, but they are still working on it.  

If you are looking for a "M&B" style game with FPS mechanics added in,  I strongly suggest giving this a buy.  I'll give this a strong 8/10.

40455455.review:
Freeman: Geurrilla Warfare is a Mount and Blade inspired FPS/Strategy/Management game set in modern times, where rebel factions of a collapsing nation (resembling Russia) duke it out for control. 

Equipped with the same rough-around-the-edges charm of Mount and Blade, but backed up by a team of impassioned and competent developers, Freeman is a sure fire purchase for anyone who enjoyed Mount and Blade. 

Though still early in development, the game already consists of a fully functional world map, fully functional battle encounters, a whole roster of troops to recruit/upgrade, and a boat load of weapons/armour to purchase. In short, the game is more than playable in its current state. I've already put 20 hours into it, and I think that'll double in the coming days. 

Gameplay-wise, if you're familiar with Mount and Blade, then this is more of the same (in almost every detail). However what I appreciate most with this game, is that the gunplay and FPS elements match the quality of Mount and Blade's combat system punch by punch, leaving you with the impression that effort and time were put into it to get things feeling right.

In short, you cannot go wrong with purchasing this. You have my word. Now buy it and support these guys, damnit!

40441784.review:
Although this is a premature review with only 2.5 hours played, I must admit that this is really good so far.  I'm playing this on a GTX760 and an i7 cpu from 2009 with 20GB of DDR3 RAM.  This is identical to the Mount & Blade series map navigation.  Feels a bit like ARMA without the complexity or huge learning curve.  

The Good:
-Simple/fast gameplay and control system.
-AI is good overall and not too much micromanagement needed or allowed.    
-Very large map with decent amount and variety of terrain/towns.
-Good resource management system.  You must work for everything.
-No Rambos allowed.  This is challenging and you better be careful.
-Graphics are decent, nothing AAA, but it's adequate for EA.
-Sound is ok so far.
-Bullet physics and damage system is very good so far.
-I can loot the armies I defeat and keep or sell their stuff. 
-I can imprison enemy fighters and then bribe, threaten, propogandize, execute, release, induct them into my army etc..
-No bugs so far other than a minor text overlap I found in one screen.
-Save system with high replay value
-Varied equipment/fighter class system.
-FPS for me is around the 30's, which looks fine to me on my system.
-Very challenging.  I've yet to capture a city or gain/afford much better weaponry or equipment.
-I'm off work today
-The price is right for what is currently offered.
-It's singleplayer and that means none of the usual multiplayer BS is there to ruin it.

The Bad:
-No vehicles, but maybe that's a good thing.
-I'm getting pissed because this is really challenging so far.
-The liquor store isn't opened yet and a cold beer might relax me and reduce the number of my prisoner executions.
-if I don't capture at least one city by noon, I'm gonna rage quit.
-I'm going to look really biased because I can't think of any bad stuff to include in this section. 
-I'm not a fan of the band White Stripes at all, yet Bayern Munich plays it waaaay too often when they score a goal.

Have a nice day.

I really hope the devs see this, there are some tiny and easy to fix problems that really ruin the game for me. I won't mention the gameplay issues and improvements that I know they are or will address. I'll keep it short and simple under the form of a list:
-The footstep sounds are bad especially when running. When you're running through soil it still sounds like you are running on concrete pavement and its louder than the gun shots. Immersion breaking.
-Your character racks the slide or re "cocks" the guns every time you swap weapons. Immersion breaking and annoying.
-The gun fire sound effects could be better.
-The blood is bright red. Really bright. In pitch black darkness you will see bright red puddles 300m away. Immersion breaking.
-The smoke is also very bright. Its almost like looking at infra red smoke through optics. You will see smoke plumes from great distances that really contrasts with the night time background. Immersion breaking.

Good game with a lot of potential. The devs are really putting in the work with all the frequent updates. Keep it up :)

40419655.review:
想象中骑砍火了以后很快会出现的产品，一直到2018年才看到。
优点：
1.游戏风格平民亲人：
继承了骑砍风格的大地图游戏模式和角色、士兵培养机制，不仅骑砍玩家游玩畅通，非骑砍玩家也同样很容易上手。
2.游戏玩法多样化：
面对敌人玩家可以依赖娴熟的走位和对武器的熟练使用体验第一滴血里兰博的第一视角，也可以苟在掩体里打开即时战略地图使用无线电指挥泥腿子们对敌人编织出密不透风的火力网。
3.这游戏真他娘的便宜
4.皮
5.皮这一下真开心，强行凑到五点
缺点：
1.射击手感：
高倍瞄具除了游戏内的AR41使用ACOG，其他枪械的瞄具大概只占屏幕中间十分之一的面积，也许游戏内的角色举枪都是平举在胸前手部伸直，像是广播体操那样。也许有人说是为了方便观察瞄具外的环境，那么学下ARMA可以左右看不就好了么，装备栏和ARMA很像，肩扛单独装备槽，但是为何瞄具不学习下呢。。。
2.画面：
倒不是说画质多么差，骑砍也没好到哪去，但是画面效果却无法恭维。。。子弹无论口径无论打到的是树木还是岩石还是墙壁还是泥地，一样扬尘超大持续时间还长，超级严重影响游玩体验。。。。
3.游戏还没做完，更多的缺点暂时不提。
我是如何爱上这款游戏的：
出生点一出来跑去城镇招了5个志愿者，跑去打27人的土匪，我15人的兵死剩6个，打死5个土匪，我用一把格洛克打死22个土匪。。。也许这就是兰博吧

40416631.review:
游戏刚起步，bug真的多。虽然游戏的创意很好，制作组也很有诚意，但是还是建议大家再观望一段时间。游戏目前的平衡性很差，纯近战单位几乎没有存在价值。另外由于AI只会瞄着头打，头硬=防护高，某些头部防护不足的近战单位更是惨不忍睹。背包里东西太多会无限减速，身上带的部队太多会无限减速，最要命的是把多余的部队驻扎在占领的城市里，敌人来攻城，防御战打完了，驻军不回驻地，直接全回身上。游戏能存档，但是只能存一个档，而且一旦读档，已占领城镇的关系等级会自动变成70%，部队的士气会变成70到80，还得自己一点点调回去，逼死强迫症。AI的智商会有点捉鸡，不会打提前量，所以一般跑S型就没人打得到。不过这AI之后估计还得改，现在的AI不仅会打天会打地，还会冲队友疯狂开火，好在没友军伤害。
不过这游戏有弹道下坠，有子弹飞行时间，有枪口上跳，不同的枪初速也不一样，不过最可贵的是这游戏有弹链的概念，每隔几发子弹就会有一发曳光弹，也算贴近现实。游戏的画面可以，优化也还行，就是地图太少，好像就两张。目前有天气变化有日夜交替，估计之后地图还会再加。
这游戏虽然目前还不够好，但是挺值得期待，制作组更新也挺勤。建议大家先不要急着入正，先观望一段时间为好。可以先去三大妈游侠下载体验一下，觉得好再考虑入正。（虽然游侠的版本由于版本号问题已经和最新版大不一样了）
PS.这游戏自带修改器
另外反映个问题，我的只要切换到RPD-97冲锋枪就会出现贴图错误还没法开枪，还有别人跟我一个毛病吗？

Very unresposive Ai they have a very basic movement they won't get in formation once in combat, meaning the player is unable to attack or defend properly  example; the player can just send them to a point on top of a hill half of the squad can be behind the hill unable to shoot and the other on top. 
The "Strategy" part is just click on a squad and send them to off to a point that they may or may not be in a right or good position to fight back.

The player is limited to a few squads lock by a level system there is no point in locking the army size if the player has to pay a recruitment fee and a monthly upkeep, this adds up to pointless leveling grinding around the map fighting bandits just to be able to capture a town or do some meaningful progress.

The combat part or FPS the player has to buy his own ammo is a consumable item very good mechanic ,However the player cannot loot dead soldiers in combat or the map there is no weapons or ammo to pick everything disappears there can be 40 dead soldiers in the battlefield and no one bullet to take The player has to run back to get ammo from the inventory box in the battlefield.

The game needs a lot more strategy It can be a great game in the future or a very casual point and click strategy will see.

40402969.review:
This game is perfet if you're looking for a arma  type FPS game but with the RPG aspects of Mount & Blade as has been stated over and over again in the reviews. to be honest I never write reviews for games but I felt compelled to for this one.

once I got the game and hopped on I realized how barebones the game really is but the potential is infinite and obvious. once I got off I immedeitly joined the discord and the devs are amazing. the update the game almost everyday (However as of the time I'm writing this, 2/25/18, They are working on a big update that will take about a week. They are hard working and will see this project through to the end. If you do decide to get this game I highly suggest you join the discord where you'll be able to ask questions, report bugs, and stay up to date on the updates for the game.

Pros: 
-runs on my crappy laptop
-fun gameplay (though repetitive at times, more on this in the cons)
-good weapon physics
-Devs dedicated to fixing bugs and improving all aspects of the game
-good sound quality
-Strategy matters and controlling your squads is vital in ensuring you are successful in engagements

Cons"
-Map variety is lackluster though the devs have said they plan on improving maps in the future
- AI is currently lacking any depth and inter-faction and faction-player interactions is minimal (Devs are currently working on this for the big update I mentioned earlier. I will fix this as soon as it is released.
-RPG aspect of the game as stated above is lackluster. It doesn't currently feel like I'm heading a guerilla faction though this might also be addressed in the next update.
-Bugs are constant as updates are released but this should be obvious. Don't be surprised by them the game is a work in progress and bugs are almost guarenteed. just report them to the devs and move on.

I strongly suggest this game and strongly suggest you be an active member of the community. It not only helps the devs but it will help make this game something special.

40381856.review:
Weil ich ein Mount and Blade Fan bin habe ich mir das Spiel geholt. Prinzipiell gefällt mir das Spielprinzip sehr gut, die Mischung aus RTS und FPS. Gut finde ich auch die Übersichtskarte bei den Gefechten, und dass man den eigenen Truppen Wegpunkte geben kann. Die Kämpfe machen Spaß und man freut sich, wenn der eigene Squad den Gegner dezimiert. Die Menüs sind noch etwas spartanisch, aber alles da was man braucht. Zum Glück gibt es regelmäßige Updates.
Bisher sind mir aber auch einige Fehler aufgefallen:
- Beim Spielstand laden befindet sich mein Trupp irgendwo, aber nicht auf der letzten gespeicherten Position und die Motivationspunkte sind auch niedriger als beim Speichern
- im Verteidigungsfall der eigenen Stadt sind meine Truppen nicht zum Bewegen zu motivieren, bleiben einfach stehen oder hängen in der Luft. Unbedingt nachbessern!

Trotzdem ein motivierendes Spiel und kann ich trotz des frühen Stadiums empfehlen.

40367614.review:
建议加入战场里的载具系统(期待正式版有多人遭遇战，我要和别人互怼)，非常有潜力的一款游戏，其他要求就不提了毕竟才游戏刚刚起步这么多要求也处理不了(各种bug是有的体谅下吧)。

关于各兵种优劣势
游骑兵
比较不错的输出，前期感觉和志愿军差不多(炮灰)，中期后期升级游骑兵能在战场上提供非常不稳定的轰炸(有时候炸的地方根本就没人)。
俄军
毛子军队形象，火力输出还是可以的不过个人感觉很脆自带吸铁石，推荐狙击路线，超远距离输出。
美军
前中后期都非常好用，性价比高。关于重步兵建议升级三队就可以了，全队scar非常厉害，重步兵火力压制就够了。
雇佣兵
顶级雇佣兵有三个分支(就是三大正规军的雇佣兵版本)。佣兵按需求来购买，前期正规军没培养好之前高级兵种用可以先用雇佣兵代替主力输出。个人看来算是性价比超高的兵种(雇佣兵各项数据比正规军要低)，有钱就能买高级军队还不用练级，想什么？买啊！
红衣军-土匪-掠夺者
为什么这三个要放在一起说呢，作为全游戏里面最吊炸天的三兄弟，收押之后能通过洗脑、给钱收买或者毒打一顿让他们屈服于你并壮大军队规模。虽然他们战斗力一般，但是他们人多势众所用的资金也是最少的(放出来之后只需要补满员给两笔安家费，而且几乎不用支付薪酬)，前期能提供比较可观的输出后期又能作为炮灰吸收火力。

接下来说一下打法，由于没玩多久也不好说怎么打最好。指挥流的顾名思义主加智力就好了，只要不死，你的军队就有神秘光环加成(反正就很强别问这么多)。solo打法呢这个不推荐前期很难打，推荐有消音器和迷彩伪装，武器最好有狙击枪左轮或者散弹枪也可以。这个打法可以无伤攻城，趴下打死一个就躲起来继续下一个，不过个人不推荐太无聊了这游戏就是要聚众打枪才有意思。

至于枪械...自己上网看详细资料吧

纯属个人见解，不喜勿喷谢谢。

40359287.review:
玩了九个小时评价一下
我先说说这款游戏给我的感觉
1.虽然是骑砍的类型，但是战斗系统毫不含糊，不会有骑砍低难度开无双的情况出现（买了全套最高护甲的防具+大狙仍然不敢同时打5个），没有急救包秒怂
2.大致上的玩法成型了，基本就是买基础兵——打土匪卖东西赚钱升级——兵种升级购买更多雇佣兵——打城镇——建设再防守城镇。就这样，说起来挺单调，上手就停不下来
3.游戏十分不完善，不过潜力真的很大，很希望它能成为像骑砍一样的神话
以下是我发现的bug以及建议之类——
1.首先就是大地图部队菜单中左上角显示部队人数和最大部队人数的界面，时常消失，看不到部队人数
2.被围城了，先存了个档，没打过ok读档，可是围城消失了？？？我是真不知道该哭该笑
3.战斗中的地形问题，我的部队在背坡趴着向脸上的斜坡开了三分钟的枪，应该算很严重的bug了，望尽快修复
4.我认为不应该把同时参战的部队数锁定在7个，可以像骑砍一样自己设定部队类型，也便于操作。一张图里百人大战岂不更加过瘾？
5.丰富一下NPC吧，加入几个能招募的英雄人物，帮主角分担些技能点，加入对话触发剧情任务的机制，扩大地图并再增加一些有趣的技能点，让各方军阀的存在感高一些（玩到部队70多人是见谁打谁，目前各势力真的没有存在感）。
6.兵种问题。目前兵种还是分类不太够，大体就狙击手突击队机枪小队三种，添加一些例如侦察兵（锁定敌人的位置且本身不易被发现），反装甲小队（RPG明明有），丰富一下部队的AI吧，当靶子真的不明智
谢谢你们对中文的支持！！！
我也会一直关注下去的，祝自由人长寿健康

40353694.review:
Okay i only played 7 hours of this and i already love it!:
-1:This game is amazing!
I love the way they mixed a strategy game and an FPS!
You can either take the role of a strategist/tactitian or just a field commander,you can order your troops around idividually
or rush in as a group,i love the freedom of choice...
-2:For a brand new early access game it's suprisingly "realistic"
Well it's not as hard as arma but not as easy as call of duty i think it has a good balance of both
You gotta keep the moral of your troops high or they will just leave you mid battle #NotCoolMan
Well morale is easy to get...just pay them...Apparantly..money buys happiness! So yeah..to keep a high morale just make it rain...
Now for the FPS part...There is bullet drop and bullet travel time...i love it!
-3:There is some kind of diplomatic relationship thing going on, it's very basic but it has a lot of potential!
-4:Trading is awesome! If you know the location and demands of the merchants you can make some dank profits!
For example i can buy jewlery from one merchant for idk....1000 and go to the other merchant that want's to buy jewlery and sell it for 1410, love it....
Now....THE CONS!
-1: A lot of bugs! i found one that lets you aim and shoot through a tree..
Sometimes when you press escape in the combat map you glitch and get stuck in the main menu.....and some others....
-2: No autosave feature...Yes....Yo uhave to save manually...you get used to it after a while but....in the beginning...
I lost my progress twice already... now i save every time i finish trading....
-3:The graphics are bad, well they aren't GREAT , but it's not really a big issue...(although..the weapon designs/models are FREAKING AMAZING!)
Suggestion to the devs:okay so in this game i think that COOP would be really interesting & fun! Online would be too much and would maybe not fit the game...idk really...but i know that COOP would be amazing!

7/10...
Its only 15 euros....a game like that (in its finished state) could sell for 60 euros...it's worth it! it's Fun!

40351654.review:
如果以骑马与砍杀为基准10分的话,以目前的完成度来说这款游戏大概只能拿到5分,or less.

相信制作者团队是非常喜欢骑马与砍杀的(以下简称M&B),将M&B的核心模式搬到了这款游戏中,领队,兵种树,野怪,个人属性,大地图,战斗地图,战利品,跑商,领主任务(未完成),攻城..然后融入了一部分现代FPS游戏的内容,枪械,附件,弹药,弹道..简而言之,就像是把M&B套在了现代战争的背景中,融合了这两款游戏类型的产物.

那么..好玩吗?

非常好玩,特别是对于钟爱兵种树又喜欢FPS的玩家来说这款游戏完全击中了我的诉求点,看着手下的部队在自己的带领下慢慢成长起来,毫不墨迹的就能随地找个敌人部队突突突.虽然游戏目前完成度低,小bug多,但是我仿佛看得到希望,又得知游戏的初始制作者中有一位国人,更加充满了期待.我自己也是一个程序员,知道靠业余时间来完成一个项目不是一件轻松的事情,特别是一个能让人依稀看到未来的游戏,大家对它的期待太高反而不是一件好事,希望游戏制作者不要有太大的压力,慢慢努力就好,听说节后会扩充团队,会有更多的开发者加入进来,这是一件好事,但是更多的开发者意味着更多的预算..一个小团队不是那么轻易的就能生存下来的,祝,武运昌隆.

  前面说到的完成度低,意味着待开发的东西太多,决策性的事务太多,是否还是要照搬M&B的模式,还是要加入开创性的内容.当然对于一个普通玩家来说,我的期望太多,我希望战斗界面能更加人性化,像全面战争那样的兵牌操作.我希望射击手感能更好,我希望画面优化能更好,我希望能开发出主线剧情,我希望有多种游戏模式,我希望太多太多,玩家的愿望一定会很多,所以制作者的决策层面会非常重要,得在短期内做好下一个开发阶段的各项任务优先级,但是,多听听玩家的意见一定没错,毕竟你们一定是想做出玩家玩的最开心的游戏,对吧?
