40346442.review:
I've put around 250+ hours in Mount and Blade and I've been a fan of Arma and other tactical series for a long time. I like the concept of this game, or rather I love it. I know its very early access, but this game has made me rage and thats something Mount & Blade hasn't done for me. I enjoy the tactical fights, but the bugs at the moment make me upset to play it.

When I've spent the better part of a day leveling, upgrading, and outfitting myself. I take up a tactical position to support my troops, move my high armor people to overwatch and suppress in trees. Snipers take up on another copse of trees, then I start popping heads and moving for an advantage and I turn around to see that a common looter just killed three of my rangers? My MG team is 2 units down? Cover? Tactics? Nothing matters when 40 looters litterally spawn on top of my flanking position with me and my snipers and we all get mowed down instantly. Welp...I guess I should have predicted that? lol

Yes, the game is good, the concept is good, but the spawning needs to be fixed. Yes, Mount and Blade had weird spawns in battle, but you generally knew where they were after 1 large fight. This has happened a dozen times to me in various ranges and spots. I am just...I can't right now. This game is wonderful, it really is, buts its too early to enjoy. Thanks for the hard work. I impulse bought the game and put too many hours in to refund, so I guess I'll wait till its better balanced and I don't see effort I've put in learning and tactically positioning just to have my entire 60+ men of upgraded squads litterally die to a bunch of looters with SMGs and T-shirts.

UPDATE 2/26/2018 12 PM (Storytime)
So I just experienced what I could only describe as a hour long bug. It is day 4 in my campaign, I have liberated one town. I have 50 units of Tier 1-3 quality (Snipers, MG, FCA rangers). The town gets attacked by 95 men, 3 star, of looters/marauders. (Mind you, 3 starring my own units isnt implemented yet!) I defend my town with the garrison 63+50 garrison. I deploy my men strategically (Or try to) Snipers on far side overwatch, armored marauders in the trees/behind buildings, Rangers/Grenadiers on the sides. (Can only Deploy seven squads). Raiders go in....first six casualties in killfeed are my rangers/Grenadiers. Im supporting them with rocket/AR41. 2/5 rangers left, retreat, replace, reposition. Finally down to 10 units, conscripts, to the enemy's 23. So? Run them out of my town, run out as well, decide to pick off slowly with my remaining conscripts. Red High light area where enemy is. Slowly move in. Now its my remaining 8 VS 4 looters. "This will be worth it.." I move in, crouching, crawling....Conscript team watching me from the hill about 20m back..... The remaining four looters teleport next to me from the red area, of which I am in the blue area (My spawn area) and without allowing me any chance at cover. Unload into my face and im dead. I am then givin the option to send my units in to "clean up" where I get a screen of the enemy forces somehow regaining 23 Units, wiping out my group of 113 to 70+ losses, and 85% of my army has left me. If I go back in to fight, I will receive around 2000 dollars as opposed to potentially 20000+Guns/loot all because the game decided I was too far from the enemies and so that I must want them to be closer to me...So teleport them onto me? It made me laugh and rage and also made my friends laugh who are watching me stream this to them.

Final Thoughts?

In the end, after spending nearly 30 hours with the game...Ive decided to change my mind. This is early access, and I feel the game is 60% or a solid 6/10 already, bugs included. So I figure when its fully done, hell, two or three more updates. This game will be nearing a 10/10 on any scale. This may sound negative, but for people in the M&B community, there is some good jank here. I love the animations of death, I love that my squad will scream for help because one guy with an SMG came out of the bushes and they shot him so many times that his body was a bloodmist before he hit the floor. Its...just great. For hardcore fans of this type of game? Buy now, support the devs, and save a little cash. For casual people? Give it some more time to cook.

Date 23/02/2018 will be updated as things change

i was shown this game via youtubers Steejo & SplatterCatGaming and found their letsplays thinking wow what an interesting game hope they continue their letsplays as it makes for great entertainment seeing how people play differently

iv played for 2 hours so far and the only reason iv not played it longer is its bed time 

im sure going to be playing this game more once im back home tomoz night 

what this game offers 

Tactical map squad control along with first person gun fighting play how you want .. lone sniper or squad hide somewhere and tell them where to go .. they often find cover lie down etc which is rather neat .. but if they are told to stand somewhere silly like in a gorge hiding is often off the table and unless you tell them to retreat they will just stand their ground and die .. meaning you really need to think about how your troops get to a location with waypoints and that the location is a great location eg top of a hill over looking a large open area with tree cover etc makes a large difference 


tho the menu and interface takes a little bit of understanding eg paying your men etc i was able to pick it up really quickly and i am registered blind their are a few areas where text overlaps etc but this is EAG it will be fixed and it is hit and miss perhaps my windows DPi is high or something who knows HAHA...


i do find myself just walking on the world map to pass time until day as i cant see very well in night time this is just me tho steejo for eg manages just fine XD .. if i get cought i spend the night battle telling my men to climb on a hill and the others to move around the enemy and attack sideways etc  .. perhaps difficulty settings could have say a day only game and for harder modes perhaps night only ...they do have night vision goggles but they cost alot so its more of a early-mid game buy if u need currently im not at the point of affording night vision....

having the day only option (PLZ devs add maybe hugs) is so i enjoy more of the game than just walking around the world map passing the time till day XD dont get me wrong the day and night cycle is great how its implimented just wish i could have an easier time mode hehe .. 

but so far i have myself a 3 squad setup who are higher level than me because erm they can see better XD  does help when shooting people to have good eyesight.. tho in RL im great with a bow XD



so if you like gunfighting FPS and or tactical squad control this is certainly a game i would point you too and im sure the devs are going to make this into a very interesting game reminds me of ghost recon if they made it into a world map mercenary conquest 

playable... yes 100% playable it is a game .. it is not a tech demo but an actual game you can play and enjoy with goals etc

graphics...4/10 they are ok they are not AAA but its an EAG so im sure in time they will polish it out eventually the graphics atm are certainly playable personally i like pretty but i play a game for the game not the graphics 

Audio... 6/10 i would say its ok but it really needs more options as the birds are loud etc .. needs more atmosphere sounds wind(howling) debris settle(leave rattle) weather.. seems abit oddball be nice for more control but im sure that will come in time

gameplay 7/10 .. played 2 hours writing this not a single bug or crash game worked exactly as intended and the game plays really well tho my PC isnt exactly a potato so its not exactly useful in spec limiting Threadripper x1950 kind of not potato

replayability 10/10 ... well im sure when i max out and conquest the whole map like in a long time because im poo at games i will certainly try and do it better again and by then im sure the devs will have added more game modes they have added a drop down box so that is certainly expected.. perhaps in time they add a day count how many ingame days did it take to complete a playthrough and unite the nation? i know they have a killcounter etc 

interface 6/10 ... it works but things like clicking into a town the option right under the curser is attack eek .. there is a few graphical glitchs on the menu but nothing that causes issues in gameplay just names splashing over buttons eg the top of the squad menu other than that its functional and im sure the devs will add and make adjustments as development continues 

developers 10/10 ... they are always patching and updating the game is alive and kicking to be played from what i have seen from the patch notes the devs are hot on fixing bugs everyone reports etc .. it makes me confident the game is worth investment hugs to the devs and thanks for making this game :)

personally i bought the game not knowing if i could play it and if not well im supporting a game i enjoy watching others play so why not .. as it turns out the game is certainly playable for me and i cant wait to see what the devs make of it 

the game page is awash with hints of a large update in the works cant wait to see what they add .. so expect my review to change as the game does 

and yeah im terrible at english xx

40340001.review:
Most reviewers call this "Mount and Blade  with guns", as someone who never  got to play Mount and blade, I can't really compare it to it. 
Buy I did play Rome Total War and Operation flashpoint. 
This is somewhat simplified take on of a merge of the two. It contains fun FPS elements without over-complicated systems.
The game-play is very addictive, I see great potential to this game and hope the developer will continue supporting it.
The game does get somewhat repetitive and lacks additional content to make it more interesting, but hopefully this will be improved with the continuation of development.
Current version is 1.2.2, and the developer seems to be updating this game weekly. I had no crashes and performance is good. Met minor bugs but nothing substantial.
I recommend this to anyone who enjoys a fresh look on FPS elements with a simplified strategy elements.

40335967.review: I bought this game on a sort of urge since it appeared to be very good. I have to say at first I was extremely disappointed due to the amount of glitches with movement and other things but the devs are really active and patched them within a day or two from when I got it. Now it runs very well and is really fun to play. It is a very unique and interesting take on the RTS genre and kind of accomplishes that dream of being able to be on ground level amid the action and actually take part with your soldiers. I definitely recommend this to anyone who likes strategy or even casual games as it isn't too difficult or complex. For those of you who are more interested in the FPS side of it, I can say the graphics are decent. Obviously from the screenshots you shouldn't expect the best but the textures for guns and characters (units and player) are average for games without millions of dollars smacked into them. The ground and tree textures on the other hand are decent at best but it shouldn't really bother anyone who isn't a snob. One last thing to mention is since this game is brand new, there are going to be bugs, like the ones I have encountered along with game crashes. This has happened every now and then to me and I try to save before/after every battle and significant part of the game to avoid losing half my progress through a campaign. All in all give it a shot, for the price it is worth it, and that's coming from someone who buys 75% of their games during steam sales.

40335796.review:
Wait, an early access game that is actually getting updated almost every couple of days? And somehow seems to have hit the sweet spot of starting with strong bones and using the updates to add more elaborate and better things over time instead of starting with nothing but fluff held up by twigs? I would say preposterous but the reviews don't lie- for being on V0.122 this game shows immense potential. Let's all hope the devs don't get drunk on early success.

Also yes this is Mount & Blade with guns, but frankly it's about time it was done so I am not complaining.

40329943.review:
So far so good for the game. As has probably been said to death, much like Mount & Blade: Warband with the town system, leader element, factions etc. 

Overall though it's highly enjoyable; pretty simple to get into the game, click, point and shoot. But harder to be extremely good at it. The AI tactics are far superior to similar games I've played. They try to flank, remain in cover, surround etc. whereas other games it's more aimlessly run at the enemy because logic. 

There's a few glitches every so often. Most common one I've seen is spinning up in the air shooting but nothing that makes it unplayable. And the majority of glitches so far are getting patched out quickly. Plus it's Early Access. Noone can really expect a game without teething problems. 

Furthermore, unlike other Early Access games the developers seem to be wanting to improve the game as much as possible. It's constantly expanding with new features, new missions, new maps etc. 

Well worth getting especially given the price.

玩了一会感觉发展潜力挺大的，正式版出了一定是款好游戏，就是现在可玩性不高，进钱主要来源于战斗和卖战利品，游戏没有基本贸易这么个概念吧，食物数量多但是消耗也快，攻城还是比较难的，NPC基本没有任务，现在版本就完全是个自由模式，前期望远镜极为重要，手枪子弹多而且便宜，但是绝对不能一直用，你会难受死的（别问我为什么QAQ）。电脑枪法一般吧，但尽量不要在夜间战斗，你会跟瞎子一样，根本不知道自己咋死的。

40314950.review: It's a really good game. Essentially, it is like if Mount and Blade were set in the Cold War era. It's a ton of fun. A bit bare-bones at the moment, but the developer is constantly adding new stuff. Since I bought it a week or two ago they have added a day/night cycle, nightvision, weather, varied battle maps, weapon silencers, mountable flashlights, functioning binoculars, and they do a good job of fixing any bugs that come up. They also plan to add side missions, diplomacy, adaptive AI behavior, off-screen artillery that you can call in during battles, companions, and a bunch of other stuff. Games like this are the kind that I am really glad I bought because I get to help support a small developer as they make a really great game. Definitely buy it.

40313467.review:
This is heavily inspired Mount & Blade Guerrilla warfare game, and it does it quite well for the price. It's Early Access and it shows, but the support from the developers seems really strong and the concept has so much potential. 

Here's what I'd like to see in the future from it though: 
-Vehicles: if possible, I'm not sure if this is a realistic demand for the dev team, but it would be very fitting, you could slowly buy much more powerful vehicles as well, from quad bikes, to an old truck with a mounted MG, to  heavy tanks, and I don't think this is possible, but if we could get helicopters that would be cool too.

-Alliances: If you could choose ideologies and have the AI factions react to you in certain ways because of your choice that would be totally awesome. I'd love to see the ablity to influence other factions also. 

-Better feel: It's Early Access, so of course it's going to be clunky, but a lot of Unity Engine EA games never escape the broken feeling they started off with, so I hope these devs can prove me wrong. My main problems with the clunkyness is from movement, animations, and overall slow responses, it would be lovely to see them make the game feel more snappier in some aspects, it doesn't have to be an arcade game like COD, but you can still have a satisfying movement system that is realistic.

-Defences: I'd org@sm if they added some structures you could place down, like barbedwire, sniper towers, fences, bunkers, and the ability to dug up some trenches.

G a m e G o o d

40308439.review:
大体みんなが言ってるようにざっくり言ってしまえばこのゲームは現代版mount and blade。となると戦闘は必然的にＡＲＭＡ的なものになるがＡＲＭＡよりは大分カジュアルめ。
倒れた兵士が負傷か死亡かスキルに基づく一定確率で分かれたりワールドマップをてくてく歩いたりシステムはビックリするほどM＆B。体力や防御力がスキルで伸ばせるので育てていけばARMAよりずっと死ににくくなる。

ただ国を取って全土統一じゃ～！ってノリの解説文が最初に書かれる通りやることや出来ることに関しては本家より大味かも。
どっかに仕官して成り上がって政治家のお友達も作ってそっからいざ独立じゃ～みたいなM＆Bの楽しみ方はアプデ待ちか、予定外かどっちかな？出来れば期待したいが。

最初はマカロフ一丁で戦場に放り込まれるので"これマジ？仲間や敵の装備に対して俺の装備が貧弱すぎるだろ…"てなるけど、敵は倒せば札束を落としたり結構な値段で売れる銃を落としたり兵隊の維持費や弾は安かったりで波に乗れば割とすぐに長物も手に入り結構簡単に金には困らなくなる。

名ありのコンパニオンや会話システムについては次の大型アプデ（2018/2/23現在）で導入されるらしい。その告知ニュースで"大きなアプデなので一週間ほどかかる"とわざわざ言われているように、このゲームは開発チームの健康が心配になるような高頻度で（というか早期アクセス開始以来ほぼ毎日、遅くとも三～四日に一回）アプデしていて大きなバグは発覚次第すぐにつぶされるので非常にユーザーフレンドリーである。
最初の最初は随分とまぁ荒削りなゲームだったけど、この約一月でランダム生成のフィールド戦闘マップに建造物のパターンが追加されたり銃器にアタッチメントが追加されたり色んな要素が徐々に追加され続けて、まだまだ成長が期待できるし付いて行きたいと思える。

フリーマンに続け！

40305906.review: I don't usually write reviews, but I feel the need to write one in reccomendation for this game. Even in its current state, it is a lot of fun to play, but that isn't the main reason you should purchase this game during it's early access. The main reason I am insisting you pick this up is because how well the developer has been communicating with the community with everything. Whether it's technical issues, bugs, or even gameplay ideas, I feel like they are watching close and listening to us. Another reason is how dedicated they are to their update schedule. In other early access games, you're usually left twiddling your thumbs wondering when the next update will arrive. These developers release an update just about every Thursday, sometimes more between the weeks, and these updates aren't just random bug fixes, they are adding new features nearly every week. If you're against playing games in early access, that's fine, but to support the game developers for Freeman: GW, I think they deserve the investment without a doubt.

首先感谢开发组推出了中文版，对于一个老骑砍玩家喜欢这类模式而果断收了，希望后续开发在内容上能让游戏更出彩，从0.121版本的状况来虽然是骑砍模式而基本玩法已经成型，但现代战争版本给了游戏不小的潜力和想象空间，不知道接下来开发组会朝哪个方向发展继续优化游戏内容，目前玩法是雇佣步兵养成，攻占城镇，建设城镇等都是面板操作骑砍老套路，没有超越的迹象，希望给于若干建议优化游戏内容。
兵种玩法方面：
- 增加载具系统，玩家可以搭乘操控，另外可雇佣专业驾驶员搭载。如：（装甲车，坦克，自行火炮，陆航武装直升机等）【既然有RPG，就让它有反装甲的存着意义】
- 增加远程火力支援兵种，如：（迫击炮，榴弹炮，轻型牵引式火箭炮）
- 步兵AI人工智能选项,自动脱离战场和便捷快捷键，细分勾选剩余1-2-3人时自动激活撤离选项。（由于上述载具和远程火力支援会使战斗热度和伤亡会提高提速，使步兵的损耗难以控制所以采用此机制，对于FPS游戏来说难以像RTS那样操控单位。）
城镇建设方面：
- 添加进驻部队的训练设施，指定单位进行训练，缓慢提升经验，直至等级升级。
- 设置防御工事，手动设置位置蓝图，设置时承担费用，根据时间进度条完成建造。如：（机枪手地堡，反坦克壕沟或水泥墩，狙击嘹望塔，步兵战壕，战地沙土防爆墙等）
望采纳，望此游戏健康长寿。

40289608.review:
[h1] TL;DR [/h1]

Mount & Blade with AKs. Nice concept, a lot of fun in its current stage already, but it's very early in development, so expect bugs, glitches, performance problems, AI blackouts etc. Also a little repetitive, but I expect more features to come over time. Would still recommend it for its full price.

[h1] The Long Version [/h1]

This one's an unexpected gem. As many stated before me, it's basically Mount & Blade in a contemporary setting. I always liked the concept of M&B, but I am not really a medieval fan, so I never really got into it that much.

While it is EA and there are a hell lot of bugs, technical problems and what not, the general gameplay is already there. I like the gunplay a lot as it requires some skill and training, but it's not overly complicated. The strategy part is also a lot of fun, but the AI and the controls don't work as expected at times.

Apart from the polish, performance, UI tweaks and everything that is probably going to be improved in future updates anyway, I have a few suggestions:

- background info: I know this is never going to be a story driven game with a fully fleshed out backstory, I'd still like to see some basic info added about...well, pretty much everything. Where are we fighting, why did this conflict break out, who are the other factions, what are their motives? Just a few bits of background, for the immersion.

- more variety and options: all you do for now is engaging enemies, taking their loot, selling it in cities, buying new troops and equipment for the money, rinse and repeat. I'd like to see random encounters with all kinds of factions and places. M&B e.g. had random cow herds running across the map which you could chase for food. This exact mechanic wouldn't fit this game's setting of course, but that's just an example. Why not trading caravans? You can buy and sell your stuff there on the go or...well, rob them. Why not civilian groups who you could help...or rob. Why not stumbling across an abandoned mine where you randomly find some gold ore? You know, just stuff like that gives you more to see and do.

- quests: to prevent repetitiveness, there should be a variety of quests in towns and by random encounters that differ a little from current combat focused gameplay. For example, I imagine an escort mission where you have to bring a certain person or object to another town without it getting stolen/kidnapped/killed. That way you could also go for more roleplaying as a peaceful merchant or whatever.

- moral: the game already has a karma system, I haven't figured out if it has any impact yet, but as this games takes on a modern day civil war scenario, you could use this opportunity to put the player into the difficult situation of making difficult choices in wartimes. It would also harmonize perfectly with what I've mentioned above. Help civilians or use them to your own advantage? Based on your decisions, the karma you have (or don't have...) should have some impact on gameplay, how people react to you e.g.

That's my "short" list of suggestions for this game. It will probably take some time as priorities are set elsewhere for now and there's a lot of work to do in general, but from what I've seen and heard so far the devs are very active, so even though EA can be a risky deal sometimes, I'd still recommend this game at its full price. I have a feeling that it is going in a very right direction and we can expect a lot if we are patient enough, and even though this is a very rough gem for now, it is already a lot of fun and feels very satisfying. Nothing better than winning a battle without any casualties. Or being close to affording that super expensive yet super effective body armor. Or being close to leveling one of your squads to the max lvl...well, let's just say, this game makes you keep going.

let me be clear, this game is not very broad or too deep at the moment. But the things is does do it gets right.

Great gunplay - straight forward but tight and realistic. 

Tactics - Simple but the AI for this type of game is shockingly good. If you send your men through trees they will use them effectively as cover. Getting into a large firefight is an awesome experience, the AI will use cover and try to flank. 

Graphics - Servicable. Nothing flashy but not bad enough to take you out of the moment.

Overall its a solid and fun game. Definetly worth the entry cost and the base theyve created could end up making a classic.

40265813.review:
Freeman Guerrilla Warfare is an interesting mix of elements, some aren't fully baked yet, while others are suprisingly well realized for a game in such an early stage of development. Right now there aren't any side quests or anything like that, so the only objective is to grow your army and fight skirmishes with the different factions. However, the gun and shooting mechanics are excellent, with most of the mechanics for it already put in place. This game is semi-realistic, so the guns aren't hitscan but rather have bullet drop. Since most of the fighting you do is fairly long distance, this means you have to rethink your aiming somewhat.

I'm looking forward to when they introduce the quest system, as well as more weapons and map variety to come. They already introduced a patch that adds buildings and roads to the skirmish maps, when before it was just forests and plains. The dev team seems to be active in the forums and they are pushing out updates quickly.

I'm looking forward to seeing how the game develops over time. For $15 this is quite a steal, even in its current limited state.

40260035.review:
在直播中试玩了这个游戏。
感谢你们的好评，让我体会到了啥叫尴尬。
游戏的交易系统很垃圾，每个城市收什么东西都是固定的。你就选商人，然后在两个城市间跑就行了。所以交易系统等于没有。
游戏的战斗系统很菜。哪个他喵的射击游戏腰射和鸡苗有这么垃圾。当你在腰射灵敏度超快的时候，你的鸡苗慢到爆。加上困难难度的敌方在任何时候都优先打你。游戏的战斗系统也十分让人不适。
策略方面，你在布置战术的时候明明很远但出不了路径点。明明选了冲锋你的士兵却在那小步子前行。有时候甚至无法操控他们。策略方面也跟没有一样。
NPC的军队浮空是很正常的。房子浮空也是很正常的。房子的门和楼梯还有窗户甚至没有做碰撞体积。我以为我在玩《大货车极限竞速》。
我不知道你们所谓的官方更新很快是啥意思。修复啥玩意儿。
如果STEAM的EA模式能让这种碰撞体积都没做好的游戏开始出售的。
做个碰撞体积很累吗？ 建模他喵的都没做好，却把精力用在出官中上面。这样就可以获得中文区玩家的好评惹。
另外我在直播时遇到了严重BUG，在进入战斗的时候另一队人也对我同时发动战斗。我在选择与第一队人交战， 第二队人撤退后，与第一队人的战场里没有任何敌人。上面的战场倒计时就是个摆设。然后我被困在了这个战场里面。我选择让我队友撤退接着我还是没法撤退。是的，我走过了整个战场，除了漂浮的建筑物，屎一样的星空贴图。 没有任何敌人。
EA不是开发商把这种简陋游戏放上来的方式。
你可以先不做官中，你也可以射击手感之类的以后再说。因为这些花费的精力都还挺多的。
但是你这建模的碰撞体积，浮空的问题还有那贴图啊！
这不是应该在官中前就做好的最基本的东西吗？
因为看到那么多人给的好评于是买的。感觉被欺骗。
现在不适合购买这个游戏。EA太差了。等以后好一点再买吧。官中不代表无脑好评。

40258032.review:
6小时客观建议与评价
游戏让射击游戏与骑马砍杀相结合，元素很棒。但随之而来的BUG 玩了6小时发现很多。
BUG  有敌人悬浮空中。偶尔出现队员不能命令。被发现后敌人是可以穿过草丛就像透视那样打你。没被敌人打到有时也有护甲破碎声。敌人在地图上有时很远会看到红圈现实大体位置。但大部分都不知道敌人在哪，而是遭遇后大地图会显示敌人大体区域红圈，有时找几个敌人 不知道在哪全地图找都找不到很累。逃跑后再进入战斗状态 有时部队不显示有时只有1个部队，明明我好几个部队。

游戏改进建议
这游戏很好玩 是真的  玩的停不下来。但战术其实很缺乏。由于BUG导致不知道敌人在哪 从而导致无法用战术打，就算可以  但如果每只小队与其他小队有点距离 小队死伤很大我现在就是全部队跟随 这样伤亡很小。所以建议 官方出些火力掩护 选项 或者能让部队少开枪多猥琐。部队的装备也可以帮他们换换防具就更棒了。
游戏中的世界地图其实嫌小  稍微走走就到头了。还有就是装备配件嫌少  枪械也有待增加，装备瞄具也有待增加 品种太少。还有装备的  身体防护和外衣看不出哪里有区分 最好写上标注装备在哪个部位的。防具品种也有待增加。人物死亡时建议防具随机几率消失  不然没意思。死亡后队伍胜利后应该也要得到战利品。失败时物品也要消失。还有敌人人多和部队好貌似是能爆的装备物品会多和好。而如果你去杀2次  第二次是之前被杀过一般的敌人 好不容易赢了 东西真的亏死。建议爆物品不要一次杀的多才爆好东西  敌人的部队 该大体爆些装备的  就爆多少些装备  不然兵死光了钱没有了  真的就GG了。赚钱的方法不多   目前没看到多少武器  狙击枪也只看到一把大狙。俘虏最好也可以卖掉  不然真的很废柴。还有房屋建筑 最好能进入 甚至还可以爬到楼顶  现在的房屋基本都是摆设   而且有些大的房子  地基一半在地上 一半在空中  这种BUG太大了 影响游戏视觉体验。
总结
游戏评分 （满分10分）
游戏画面  5分
游戏好玩度 7分
游戏耐玩度  5分
人物建模  5分
人物模型动作 3分
总体来说  作为一款才50元的游戏  已经很棒了  但如果优化加上用心再去制作  到时再加价我也愿意去购买
但目前 这游戏  对于50块钱来说的游戏  已经做的很棒了
但对于游戏性  耐玩度  还有待好好加强
对于50元游戏来说  总体  我给7分   最主要的是画面和耐玩度还远远不够  包括现在还有很多BUG  和很多不够完善的地方 
元素的多样化   加上 真正的战术性  好好的 还要加强

40256931.review:
아주 단적으로 말하면 마운트앤블레이드의 21c 버젼, 발전가능성이 매우 큰 게임입니다. 

오합지졸 민병대들을 프로용병으로 레벨업시키고 적대적인 무장세력들을 격퇴시키고 포로로 잡고 부대에 편입시키거나 사형시키거나 마을을 점령하고 운영하는 등. 자연지물을 이용한 전략전 분대운용도 재미있습니다. 다만 마블과 달리 프리맨의 아군 분대들은 플레이어의 명령이 없으면 알아서 필드를 돌아다니며 적을 찾지 않습니다. 아니...오히려 그랬다가는 순식간에 각개격파 당해서 플레이어는 피눈물을 흘리게 되겠죠...

전투진입시 적의 대략적인 위치는 알려줘도 정확히 어디서 어떻게 튀어나올지는 모를 일이라 잘못 배치하면 시작하자마자 부대원 1/3이 갈려나가는 멘탈터지는 일이 발생하기도 합니다. 기껏 비싼 돈 들여가며 키워온 저격수부대들이 고지대로 올라가다가 전멸당하는 꼬라지를 보게 되면...ㅂㄷㅂㄷ

아무튼 그렇다보니 분대가 많아질수록 여러 분대들을 상황에 맞춰 이리저리 움직이느라 직접 필드를 누빌 일이 줄어든다는 단점(?)이 발생합니다. 플레이어는 과거 선두에 서서 개돌을 해야했던 쏘가리에서 강력한 용병부대를 거느린 중대장으로 진급하여 안전한 풀숲에 엎드려 분대들을 이리저리 배치하게 되는 것이죠. 묘한 현실고증...물론 전장 진입 전 당신의 분대 배치가 만족스럽다면 당신은 수십명이 넘는 당신의 부대원들과 함께 필드를 뛰어다니며 테러리스트들에게 신나는 총알세례를 퍼부어 줄 수도 있죠. 할렐루야!

8/10 드립니다. 미래가 기대되는 게임입니다.

40250255.review:
Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Being a military strategist is one thing, leading your troops on the battlefield is another, but both are extremely important if you want to win each battle and ultimately the war. Commander, it’s time to make your mark in this world! Mobilize an army, from conscripts to mercenaries, and capture cities from your enemies and bandits. This is not going to be easy and you’ll need the best leader to command his men in this guerrilla warfare. 

Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare is a FPS / strategy and management game where you lead your own faction with the primarily goal of capturing and managing more towns than your opponents to win the game.

After launching a new campaign, you’ll arrive in the world map. Your army will be represented with a soldier and the flags you have chosen when you created your faction. Underneath your animated figurine a number will be displayed which represents the number of men you’ll have under your command. The map world is a nice 3D map where you’ll be able to see towns and other armies moving around. You’ll also have the ability to check out your party at any given time, as well as your inventory, the number of prisoners you have, and information on the different factions, by clicking the tabs at the bottom of your screen. You can move all around the world very easily and at the start of the game you’ll not be at war with any factions, but beware of the bandits. Actually, it’s best to attack them first by clicking on their respective figurines. Try to attack the smaller group first.  When your figurine reaches its target, the battle phase will take place. First, you’ll have to place your squads (five men per squad) in the spawning green circle. Somewhere within the battle map a red circle will also be displayed and that is where your enemies will most likely be spawning. Make your way to that circle with your squads and engage with the enemy. You have the ability to swap from the FPS to the battle map and vice versa as you wish.  You can also select waypoints for your squads to follow and select whether you want them to move cautiously or as fast as they can to reach a certain position. If they need to, you can choose to have them fire at will or follow a choice of other commands. Bear in mind, you can’t jump into one of your squads and take control of one of its members. They’ll engage the enemy as soon as they see them and they’ll be marked with a small red circle on the battle map. On your first battle, you’ll only have a revolver at your disposal, and you won’t have any armour. Eliminate all enemies and collect your loot, which will always include money, weapons and other items which you can trade each time you visit a town. If this is the other way around, the likelihood of losing your squad is pretty high and you’ll probably need to get to hospital (in towns) to regenerate your health. I must mention that each time you personally eliminate an enemy (not your squad), you’ll earn experience points and each time you reach a new level, skills points will be allocated to you, which you can then distribute into a large number of skills on the skill tree. 

A few options are also available in the towns; selling or buying weapons, armour and/or food, and hiring mercenaries, too. If it’s your town, you can construct buildings such as factories and markets, as well as farms to generate income; also houses, police stations and a few others. Make sure you always have money and food in your inventory so you can pay your men and keep their morale running high. 

I really like what I am seeing here and the developers are updating the game frequently. The FPS phase is pretty fluid but needs some polishing. The strategy and management aspect is really easy to use and you get all of that for only $14.99 USD. Excellent value, I must say!

Graphically it’s good, but as I mentioned above, needs a bit of polishing in the FPS phase. Plenty of weapons, amour and items to loot, buy or sell. This is a superb game and it’s only on early access!

Positives:
~~~~~~~ 

+	Good graphics
+	FPS, strategy and management phases
+	Large number of weapons, armour and items to loot, buy or trade
+	Easy to learn and play; challenging and addictive
+	Good value for money

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	Needs to be polished a bit
-	No achievements or trading cards as yet 

If you like strategy, FPS and management games, you’ll get all in one in Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare. Superb value!

8/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

40242492.review:
Have you ever wanted Mount & Blade to have guns? Have you missed the original Ghost Recon experience of ordering a squad around a map? Have you wondered why RTS games that involve pew pew metal things never let you go down on the ground level and control them in an FPS mode? Good news, this is just the game for you! Well... Not quite yet. This game is literally Mount and Blade meets guns. It follows the same platoon based party system, leveling, inventory, recruiting, and everything else. Where this game has excellent potential is the on the ground shooting and commanding of troops in a way that I haven't quite seen done right since Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear and SWAT 4. 

But.... keep in mind this is game is still in its extreme infancy. The developers appear to be extremely passionate and responsive. I would stay away from the game for the time being and just watch it at this point though. The directional audio is screwed, the graphics are obvious placeholders, the AI is a bit lack-luster, and the camera feel's disconnected and sluggish. The core concepts are there and if the developers play their cards right, they will be able to polish this into something great. I will be editing this review if the project loses steam and rarely gets updated, but I do recommend this as a follow/wishlist title to come back to in a year. 

Tl;dr Like Mount & Blade but wanted guns? Watch this title for purchase later. Otherwise understand that you're buying the game in its current unpolished state, it's more just to show support for developers who appear to be passionate about their game.

40241190.review:
Inevitable comparison to Mount & Blade is inevitable.

*EARLY ACCESS TITLE*

Yes, it is basically M&B Warband but in Chechnya with AKs and RPGs.  That is not a bad thing. Yes, it has some bugs (I'm looking at YOU, floating immobile troops on town defense mission!). This is early access.  I hope to see this game continue to be developed and polished, because it is a solid concept.

Some unexpected pluses... the weapons are not hitscan but actually model a reasonably in-depth ballistics system- I was surprised to discover this as I noticed my tracers and dust plumes from shot impacts hitting low of my aim point and was satisfyingly rewarded with hits/kills once I adjusted my aim to more carefully account for both elevation and recoil. 9mm carbines/pistols will not shoot as flat as 5.56mm rifles, just as should be the case.

Another pleasant surprise is the troop AI. Your troops will follow your orders (providing their morale isn't too low) and the orders both make sense and are followed sensibly. In other words, if you order a unit to move to a point on the map and "proceed with caution", you can tag along and see that they will, indeed, move along in a cautious, alert fashion, keeping low, scanning for enemies, etc. If they spot enemies, they react accordingly. They don't just blunder along oblivious to incoming enemy fire. Order them to "charge" and they move with more urgency, but again, they act like they have brains.


I'm really looking forward to seeing the progress this game makes.

My only reservation is this game is VERY early access, however, with communicative devs and a great early system in place, this game has the potential to be a very fun, highly replayable sandbox game very much in the vein of Mount & Blade.

40239451.review:
[h1] This is a great game that has massive potential, but it must improve soon or I think it may fail.  Here's why. [/h1]

I've had a blast with Freeman with my time with it over the weekend.  It describes itself as a sort of Mount and Blade + Arma cross, and MaB and Arma are two of my favorite games of all time.  And in large part, it holds well to said description.  The game is almost better labeled as some sort of MaB conversion mod with its very clear and obvious parallels.  You have the same Overworld view with little dudes with flags sticking out of them representing armies, you have very similar leveling/skills systems, you have very similar economic systems, and the same goal of achieving regional/continental/global/whateveritis domination.  You have warring factions such as the ARF, FCA, Unman Brotherhood, etc.  If you've played MaB, these similarities are blaring, for better or worse.  

As for being like Arma though.. that I'd say is more or less debatable.  The combat is often very long range as it often is in Arma, but Freeman has a faster pace to it.  The combat revolves around commanding squads of 3-5 men each.  The trick is outmaneuvering your enemy utilizing the terrain to your advantage, whether it be for cover, concealment or higher ground.  While Arma's isn't necessarily absent from those aspects, Arma's combat features far more depth that provides a totally different feel of the play.  I'm not necessarily suggesting that Freeman's combat is worse than Arma's, but rather that it may be subject to some debate.  I will say what Freeman specifically does NOT do as well as Arma, and that is immersion.  Freeman's sound systems seemed at times glitched and ultimately pale in comparison to Arma's especially when you factor mods such as Dynasound and Enhanced Soundscape.  Though, really, this review shouldn't revolve around comparisons to other games.  Let's look at the state of this game and where it may be going.  

Let's set one obvious and very important factor in place: [b]Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare is still currently in a very immature state of early access.[/b]  The game has only been out for a few weeks though the developers seem to be keeping on top of updates and content.  There isn't a ton of content as it stands, but I'm sure that that will change with time.  There are a number of weapons, equipment, and economic goods that can give you some options, though it's obvious that some articles of gear are meant to be more powerful than others.  Currently, there isn't much to do other than to just fight, though there is plenty of indication that there will be some kind of questing system at some point.  The economic system seems pretty straightforward for now, and while that may be okey for early access, the economy is very exploitable.  It involves little to no guesswork and allows you to turn small amounts of $2000ish into FAR larger sums such as $80-100k in only a couple hours of trading (and even then I'm sure that I could've done it more efficiently than I did.)  The economy as it stands is one thing I think the devs should rework a bit to make it a bit tougher.  For instance, changing the cities' Demands ingame every week or so rather than just at startup of the game, or maybe you have to have some points in the Trade skill to get more benefit from Demands or something.  I'm sure there are better ways of doing it, but right now it simply feels cheaty.

There are MANY other issues in the game, but almost entirely they all fall under the bug category.  As this game is in early access, [b]it is 110% plagued with bugs, some minor, others game-breaking. [/b]  Here are some of the more major issues I encountered while playing:

[list]
    [*]One of the guns (I forget which, it was a 5.56 weapon) seemed to shoot very high when equipped with the ACOG scope.  I had to aim low against my target instead of high like others (to compensate for bullet drop)
    [*]The map of the city that you start the campaign with (Gornisk or something like that) seems to be bugged to hecc and back.  AI on both sides float in the sky, sink into the ground, totally ignore my orders and seem to be totally invisible.  That map is unplayable.
    [*]My cities seem to get besieged by the Unmen way too often.  I've had to fend them of the aforementioned Gopnik or whatever its called map several times in a short period against my will.  It was incredibly annoying.
    [*]Leaving the game map to leave the battle (also on this same cursed map) brings me to a dialog that displays the enemy's ever so thoughtful comment of "My men will have no mercy!" with no way to close it, leaving me to have to restart the game (often without having saved for a long time which I guess is my fault.)
    [*]The prisoner's screen bugged on me a few times, sometimes not letting me do anything to my prisoners other than try to convince them to join which doesn't work often because I didn't get to do anything else to them.
[/list]

I'm sure this wasn't all the issues I encountered and I'm sure that others have found many more.  But these and other issues is why I suggested at the top of this review that the game may very well fail without attention directed at this sort of thing.  I think the devs said somewhere that a bug fixing patch was coming up which I hope pans out well.  My suggestion to the devs is to hold off on content and focus a while on retracing their steps and fixing as many of the left behind messes as possible.  Though, I'm not a game developer.  I don't know how or when they intend to go about fixing the issues, and frankly may well just be an impatient consumer waiting for them to rush to me an experience I'd enjoy.  I suppose the key for we consumers is to simply [b]wait and see if the bugs turnaround.[/b]  If the devs pay adequate attention to this issue, then [b]Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare may become one of my favorite games.[/b]  Otherwise, well... it may just kinda drift into the cheap-clone oblivion.

EDIT: A dev has said after posting this review that they've fixed the more aggregious issues I previously mentioned in this upcoming patch.

EDIT: Composition and formatting mistakes.

If you can get past the initial jank this game is a real pleasure to play. 
It feels like a modern set mount and blade with the overworld recruiting, the shooting is quirky albet easy to get used to (one of the 9mm smgs having awful iron sights but it's a pleasure to use for example), and running your little militia feels just like a game of mount and blade with assault rifles and hand grenades.

40214727.review:
I wanted to go out of my way to write a short little review of this game, because rarely does an early access game make such an impression.

The description and trailers are on point, what you see is what you get. If this sounds like the sort of game that you're looking for, it probably is. The gameplay loop is very addicting, even if there is very little polish atm.

A few gripes:

- No auto save. I've lost two campaigns now, one because I didn't manually save (my fault) and one because I accidentally hit 'quit game' in the menu, which booted me to desktop without a confirmation. UI is still really, really rough.

- Sound is... weird. There seems to be no direction to the sound. Sounds are oddly tinny, especially at a distance. 

- Gunplay needs work.

- General jankiness, but you have to expect that lol

Overall, this game is really promising. I'm already haing a lot of fun with it. The shooting already feels good, even if gunplay needs a lot of work overall. That is one of my biggest concerns in a shooter, and they already are off to a good start. For $15, this is a safe bet!

40212861.review:
昨晚带着手下人推进，拿着我的小手枪打死了最后一个敌人，虽然我也吃了一颗枪子，但还是很有成就感。[strike]比以前玩全战时打十次史诗大捷还开心[/strike]
我是骑砍粉，所以我喜欢这个游戏。原因和当初玩骑砍一样，这是一个个人视角的战略战术游戏，既能指挥部队（而且是在枪林弹雨中指挥，我有一次下命令时就被打中了），又能自己上阵杀敌（虽然我基本不战斗，目前拿的还是缴获的马卡洛夫）。
我率领着部队缓慢推进，爬上山坡，突然看见前方左侧后山闪过几个人影，赶紧带着士兵进入树林中。我蹲下慢慢前进，想靠近一些看得更清楚，这时候，手下开火了，敌人出现在了我们的视野内。我赶紧趴下身，几颗子弹打在了我前面的石头上。
以上这些只是我目前游戏过程中的一个小片段，上帝视角无法给我这样身临其境的体验。在高高俯瞰的战争之神面前，任何地形、埋伏、陷阱都能被轻易识破，我现在对这种游戏方式越来越没有兴趣。
我并没有否定全战这类游戏的意思，相反，它们是我最喜欢的游戏，从我开始玩罗马1算起，已经快10年了。只是，现在我的口味变了而已，骑砍玩了四年多，也有点腻了。自由人游击战争这款游戏，给了我耳目一新的感觉，在此我尤其推荐全战老玩家试一试，从卫星视角到成为士兵的一员，虽然规模和谋略与全战无法相比，但多了很多细节的乐趣。
开发者的态度很好，发售后一直在更新，昨天的更新就加入了昼夜系统，期待推出官中！
我个人的建议：
1.增加战斗画面下的指挥系统（就像骑砍一样），目前指挥只能按M切换到战术地图操作，比较麻烦。战术指挥命令也可以增加一些。
2.[strike]增加让士兵推进占领地点（骑砍的坚守此地），以及自主索敌的命令。现在的charge命令个人感觉意义不大，而且兵貌似只能跟在自己后面，不能让他们主动进攻。[/strike]
(更正:中午发现可以指挥坚守，双击地图上的地点命令，我的锅)
3.能自由移动缩放战略地图，这样更容易把握大局。
4.城市、npc互动方面的增强，这一块可以参考骑砍，我就不赘述了。
5.加入掩体和工事制造系统，就像骑砍拿破仑一样。载具系统对开发者的体量来说可能比较困难，所以现在我觉得不必强求。不过加入炮击火力覆盖系统倒也可以。
6.无关紧要的，希望加入第三人称视角。这游戏的第一人称视角和大部分FPS游戏一样，没有身体建模，可以参考一下辐射4的视角系统，第一和第三人称分开建模，如果能捏脸更好。（强迫症表示必须要看到主角）

40207768.review:
A warband game with modern skirmish combat out field - awesome! Devs have made a great start on this game.

Positives:

- Great skirmishes which feel way more authentic than popular shooters
- Awesome sound effects
- Really fun progression (what there is so far)
- The weapons are great overall (see performance comment below)
- Enjoying the Eastern European flavour of the voices and style a lot

Improves:

- Get a military advisor, especially when characterising and naming equipment
- Get an English native speaker to check everything
- Check the maths on the bullet drop - I wouldn't expect to have to aim 8 feet high over 200m with 7.62mm rifle.
- More equipment: a range finder would be particularly useful to make up for the lack of visual acuity in the game vs real life when judging distances
- Bigger deployment areas would help when placing troops: Would also be great to have set formations rather than micro-manage, as well as troops who know to speed up when they are lagging behind the others. Another refinement would be for soldiers to prefer side-by-side positions when firing, rather than shooting past each other which is really dangerous and looks a bit silly

Further ideas for the devs:
- Eliminate radar images of enemy - not realistic, it's cheating. Substitute with sound or visual signatures that are temporary. The red indicators could maybe become available later with ground-sensing radar purchase? This could need a squad to operate.
- Eliminate the time limit with showing enemy's location: Substitute enemy that are more aggressive who come forward
- Teach the AI flanking manoeuvres
- IR lasers at night for aiming weapons
- Artillery would be a great addition, start with a mortar team
- This game is screaming for tactical UAV to help sense the enemy! This should also be operated by a squad. It could also be cool to have a Cessna fly overhead and provide verbal indications over the radio (NOT map indications - it's too easy!)

Overall really impressed with this game, definitely got my $15 worth of fun!

This game is very fun, at the moment there is too little content to keep most people entertained for too long, but the concept is absolutely great. 

It obviously draws much if not most of its insporation from the Mount & Blade series, even mechanics like holding spacebar to travel faster on the map have been copied, but the focus on guns and squad movement on a tactical map during battles is defintely unique and refreshing.

40200372.review:
As many other reviews have pointed out, this is very much like Mount & Blade. Can even be considered a clone, but it has it's very own twists.

Let's go with the similarities with M&B.

- Running a town is pretty much the same, you can add structures to update the town's stats and income. However, the only way to get a town is by removing the opposing faction by force.
- Trading is pretty much the same, however, the best place to sell commodities doesn't change, yet.
- Recruiting newbs in towns or hire trained merchenaries in each town is about the same. Every faction has it's own strengths and weaknesses on their troops.
- They seemed to have added the infrastructure for NPCs to give you tasks, however, they don't yet.
- Gear can be looted or bought.
- Overmap movement, hunting bandits or npcs of opposing factions.
- Battles are similar, you start in one spot on the map, and have time to set up your troops before engaging.

Of course M&B is older and much more polished. Not to mention the mod support which makes the game better overall.

The things that Freeman: Guerilla Warfare bring to the table.

- Modern warfare and FPS.
- The way you can command your troops is more effective over what of M&B has, with an overlay map display. To which you can go back to at any point during the engagements to command.

I may have missed mentioning some things, however as it is, this game shows promise. And if you enjoy M&B, I think this will be a good addition to the genre. Now let's see where the devs take this game to.

40199848.review:
Absolutely great game so far! My friend recommended me this game, saying that it is like Mount and Blade mixed with ArmA, and ofc that did catch my intrigue.

I will say this, although this game is in early access and still very early in its development, the potensial and fun is definitely here. Currently I have about 8 hours in this game and I can already make out that this game, with proper support and continues updates from the devs, will surely become something big. Even though it is rather niche of a game, I do believe that there is a market here, for specific people like myself.

I will say this, stable game all around, no crashes so far, performance is rather good, albeit in some instances it will drop somewhat, from 60 - 50. Usually this is because of the map and when there is a lot of combat going on.

There are ofc room for imporvements, one of these would to make the open world combat more interesting, for instance instead of always getting a random forest map, why not have like a road and some buildings a long it to fight in, or maybe a tiny village etc. It would also be great to see the houses in the Town battles be enterable, currently I have not found a building that I can get into.

All in all this game so far, I super fun, it's just the right mix of ArmA and with some Modern Millitary Shooter mechanics, not to realistic, and not to arcade.

[h1][i]ЗДРАВСТВУЙ НЕБО В ОБЛАКАХ, ЗДРАВСТВУЙ ЮНОСТЬ В САПОГАХ...[/i][/h1]
Давайте разберемся с самого начала: Я влюбился в эту игру по непонятным причинам. В игре отсутствует сюжет, пока нет побочных квестов (хотя затравка на них явно есть, ведь у некоторых НПС есть пункт “есть ли работа для меня?”), довольно скудный арсенал оружия (если учесть, что это военная стратегия-ФПС), нет техники и довольно мелкий мир. За что можно влюбится в эту игру? За отличный сеттинг и неповторимый геймплей, вот за что. Игра дает нам лишь одну цель, которую стоит достигнуть любыми методами. Эта цель довольно проста: Подчинить своей власти целый остров. Для достижения этой цели, нам необходимо будет нанимать войска, экипировать своего бойца, не забывать поощрять свой отряд деньгами, строить стратегию ведения боя и, самое главное, набираться опыта. Ведь в самый первый раз все прутся напролом не понимая сути данной игры. Здесь очень важна тактика ведения боя, ведь на равнине вас просто расстреляют, как кучку салаг, чтобы этого не допустить, очень важно рассредоточить ваши силы по стратегически важным точкам, или же просто вести их за собой, как истинный лидер.

Поговорим немного о стратегии. Нам дается довольно большая (жаль, что не бесконечная) карта, на который присутствуют отдельные фракции. Каждая фракция по началу игры относится к вам абсолютно нейтрально, но правда есть отдельные, которые мародерствуют и ваш маленький отряд - это просто лакомство для них. В начале игры нашему лидеру дается пистолет и маленький состав из 10 людей (по мере прокачки лидера можно брать практически любое количество людей на миссию). И вот с таким началом нам необходимо воевать, собирать лут с пораженных соперников и продавать ненужные вещи в ближайшем городе. Не забывайте лечить ваших бойцов, покупать еду для сквада, лечится самому, нанимать бойцов и так далее. Во время самого боя, нам дается ограниченная карта, на которой враги обозначены в теоретической красной зоне, а наш отряд стартует с маленькой зеленой зоны. Можно сразу раздать приказы вашим бойцам двигаться по определенному маршруту, зачищая по дороге всех неприятелей, а можно приказать следовать за собой и прикрывать вашу пятую точку. Что примечательно, приказы можно группировать, например: снайперов расставить на склоны холмов, рейнджеров послать на передовую, а маленькую группу наемников прикрывать вашу спину во время боя, причем тактику ведения боя можно менять во время боевых действий.

[h1][i]ОРУЖИЕ НЕ УБИВАЕТ, ЭТО ДЕЛАЮТ ЛЮДИ[/i][/h1]
Как я говорил ранее: в игре не очень большой арсенал оружия, но не забываем что игра находится еще в раннем доступе и затравочка для большинства довольно интересных функций присутствует. К примеру, вероятней всего будет наземная техника, еще больший арсенал оружия, побочные квесты и даже возможно появится и сам сюжет. Атмосфера в игре просто шикарная, во время военных операций вы действительно чувствуете себя командиром отряда, который отдает приказы и лишь от вас зависит жизнь армии. Вы вольны отправить бездумно бойцов на гибель, а можете возглавить операцию сами, делая тем самым живой пример универсального бойца. Также в игре уже присутствует осада городов, но для полноценной осады нужен очень хороший сквад, ведь иначе вас просто вынесут за 3 минуты боевых действий. Единственное что напрягает - окружающая среда. 90% времени нам придется воевать на открытой местности, где толком нет укрытия, хотя оно ой как нужно в подобных играх, ибо вас выносят за три попадания.

 Вот так тихонечко мы перешли к сеттингу и геймплею. Игра, практически, идеально собрала в себе такие различающиеся по себе жанры. Чаще всего разработчики могут оперировать лишь с двумя из этих жанров, но только не эти ребята, они идеально показали как нужно работать над проектом. Геймплей очень разнообразен, нужно понимать, когда нужно решать все политическим путем, отпуская заложников, переманивать их на свою сторону пропагандой, а когда стоит сделать из себя тирана, чтобы только при вашем появлении враги тряслись от страха. После многодневного плутания на карте не забудьте поднять боевую дух ваших товарищей, ибо во время боя они смогут попросту предать вас и сбежать, оставив наедине с врагом, как вам такой сценарий? Про стратегическую составляющую я уже писал, но это также относится к геймплею. Ну и стандартный ФПС, в котором нужно уметь занимать правильную позицию, иначе вражеские войска вас попросту расстреляют за первые минуты атаки. Да, АИ кажется довольно тупеньким, они не особо умеют занимать хорошие места, но по мере прохождения и патчей… они становятся умнее, по крайней мере теперь они не стреляют сквозь камни и деревья.

Графическая составляющая на высоте. Да местами видна дешевизна картинки и недоработки визуальщиков, но в целом на это даже останавливать свой взгляд не хочется, особенно когда вы целиком и полностью прониклись боевыми действиями. Недавно в игру добавили погодные условия, теперь может спуститься туман, начаться дождь и это выглядит шикарно (но не смотрите в прицел, ибо он ломает погоду). Также разработчики добавили смену дня и ночи, делая игру еще более реалистичной. Прорисовка персонажей выполнено на среднем уровне, она и не плоха с одной стороны, но до хорошей ей еще очень далеко. Отдельно порадовала прорисовка оружия, прицелов, но как бы не было печально, перезарядка револьвера очень убого выполнена, ведь ГГ влаживает невидимые патроны в барабан (надеюсь быстро пофиксят). Звуковое оформление также двояко, с одной стороны выстрелы, шум дождя и отчет бойцов звучат довольно хорошо, но передвижение игрока… мне иногда кажется, что по мне открыли огонь, а нет, просто мой солдат наступил на щебенку… Музыкальное оформление звучит бодренько и добавляет еще больше экшона в перестрелку.

[h1][i]ПЛЮСЫ И МИНУСЫ[/i][/h1]
Плюсы:
+ Сочетание трех жанров: FPS, стратегия, RPG (в виде прокачки персонажа и сквада)
+ Увлекательный геймплей как во время планирования атаки, так и во время боевых действий
+ Захват городов, при наличии хорошей армии
+ Атмосфера полностью передает всю бессмысленность войны
+ Напряженные боевые действия (в режиме реального времени можно раздавать приказы своим бойцам) 
+ Довольно неплохая графическая составляющая (появление погодных условий и режима смены дня и ночи)
+ Хорошая звуковая сопровождающая

Минусы:
- Пока нет четких заданий, лишь открытый мир и свобода действий
- Довольно глупенький ИИ
- Довольно малый арсенал оружия (надеюсь, что скоро завезут еще больше моделей)

Отвечу на главный вопрос: Нет это не очередная копия PUBG. Игра больше напоминает ранние игры Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six, когда вы берете на себя роль лидера отряда наемников. В целом я в восторге от игры, по какой-то причине. Что заставляет меня играть в этом довольно пустом мире? Да я и сам не знаю, но это просто шикарно (извините, эмоции). Однозначно моя рекомендация и маст хэв!

40186359.review:
After an hour or two of playing, I'm really impressed with this game.

Waypoints (rather than the normal "go here using best path" style in most RTS) method of movement is great for setting a patrol or advance path. I wanted to flank a group of people and was able to queue and then fine tine waypoints for my flanking group.

As everyone says, yeah, it's Mount and Blade: Warband with guns, but it's that in a not-Ukraine/Donbass setting, which is very interesting. Games like Syrian Warfare and this game are taking a great look at modern low intensity conflicts with many actors, whether it be through a state lense or non-state lense.

My biggest problems so far is the AI. Not the enemy AI, who are light infantry gods, but your party's AI. You definitely need to position section level weapons like machine guns and RPGs a certain way. You can't do that sometimes because the AI just says fuck it and stands there pointing guns in random directions. Yeah, they do go to ground and move far less when in contact, but out of contact they can just stand there doing nothing or appear four metres in the sky for no reason. As this is EA, I'm guessing this will be ironed out.

It would be great if there was a campaign that had a bit of a story or NPC commanders offered tasks. That's probably coming, but right now, it's just a sandbox to walk around in. There's definitely nothing wrong with that, as it's a very fun sandbox. For now.

Devs have a tonne of work ahead of them, but man, I'm looking forward to seeing what updates they'll add next.

Great job.

40182556.review:
So, I'd be lying if I said this wasn't 'Mount and Blade with guns' - no exaggeration.
This is not however a bad thing. If you've played M&B, the above decription should give you an accurate description. If you haven't, make sure you buy mount and blade too because it is also a great game.

The developers update frequently and it's pretty good for a game in beta. I love that the ballistics are fairly realistic and the AI is pretty good (though unforgiving)

So I'll focus on the things I want to see moving forward:
1. I'd like the faction army spawning to be persistent and strategic, not random. I'm sure this is in the works but it does bother me a little for the game to be billed as part strategy when on the overall map there isn't really any more strategy to picking who to fight than picking which mobs to farm in an MMORPG. Ideally the NPC's would be on foraging missions or whatever tied to the faction's ability to spawn more dudes so that there is a strategic incentive to raid rather than just leveling your guys.
2. More interesting and more varied terrain. don't get me wrong, I just did a couple of battles in poor weather and the effects, moving trees, etc really wowed me but I'd like to see more cliffs, ravines, urban environments. Picking terrain matters a little but not a lot right now.
3. More variation in troops. The Uman terrorists are running around in red which is great because it makes them easy to shoot. I think if they were easier to spot/target by the AI but had stronger morale that would be sufficiently unique for them. 
4. kind of tying into the first item, a point to anything. Right now armies aren't really doing anything unless they're attacking one of your settlements. maybe have a villiage kind of thing where each settlement has outlying villages that must be protected to provide income or can be raided by an opportunistic army. More variety in battle than 'hunting down and killing all these guys right here'

The game has a great potential. It has the same playing style of Mount & Blade series. You walk around on the map with your squad, defend your villages, conquer new ones, trade with other villages, hire soldiers, kill the enemies, make tactics, manage your army. Same basics with very good pistol mechanism. This time modern weapons of course. You should buy this game if you like these kind of games. An endless sandbox with modern weapons.

Are there any problems? Of course yes. This is an early access and if you support the devs, then they can easily solve those problems. There are some bugs. Sometimes the enemy just doesn't attack you and your guys may not move either. The only solution of this bug is your movement. You have to find out where the enemy is and go there. Anyway, not a big deal. Will be probably solved with the next update.

And here are some suggestions for the devs:
- We may be able to pick up the weapons of dead guys on the ground.
- The bodies of dead ones are disappearing sometimes. Has to be solved.
- We may be able to manage the weapons of our troops. I mean, their inventory.
- More flags will be appreciated.
- There is a little shaky thing when you use your scope. Has to be solved.
- The enemy's attacking problem. It must be a bug because they are (and also some of our guys) flying on the air without moving.

40171541.review:
After I've played this game for a few hours and since most of if not all this game had to offer I can say that this game has potential and in its current state is fun dispite the bugs and glitches the game has. This game is Mount and Blade meets Arma and gives the best of both of games.

Pros: Combat is intense and fun: in combat it is not uncommon to see dust flying from where bullets hit near you, and hear bullets flying past your head or even hitting your armor. In combat you have to take your time and fight together with your troops. You try to rush in you will die.
Intersting leveling and upgrade system: The leveling system is very in depth and similar to that of Mount and Blade, as you do need to level up skills to command more troops and inprove your own character, however, you also need to level up skills to be able to bring more troops into a battle itself. the leveling system is nice, but some changes to it could make it better, for example expereince gained only appiles to the squad or person that killed the enemy, this means that some squads get levels very quickly while others are struggling to get experience, maybe if their was a way to train troops outside of battle it could make sure that all your troops stay at similar levels.
differeing Factions with pros and cons to each: this helps it feel though you are in a different world, and gives reasons to troops from each faction in your army, as one faction might have good snipers, but little to no heavy or close combat troops.

Cons: Siege/ defence battles need more work: It seems in every siege or defence battle I constantly see mine or the enemy troops flying in the air or glicthed out beneth the map or even in trees, and this is in every battle which makes the battle unwinnable as the only way to win is kill all the enemy troops. Maybe adding a timer for the defenders to hold out and make the battles shorter and it would be better then just kill all enemies.
Repetative gameplay: As of now this is every battle in the game Get attacked/attack enemies kill all of them to win this just gets boring after a while since is basically the same thing over and over. 
Frame Rate drops: While in battle my FPS usually stays at a reasonable level and I have no problems there, In the world map my FPS sometimes goes as low as 10 FPS and my laptop is pretty good. 
Final thoughts:
I would give this game a 4/5 and i know this came out very recently, but until the bugs are fixed I just cant give this game a higher rating, and is it worth the money I would say yes as the gameplay is great if repetative at times, the leveling system is very complex, and combat is intense but at the same time just think that this game is still in early acess and still has many bugs so think before you buy this game. However, if your a fan of games like Mount and Blade or Arma, I would without a doubt recomand you play this game, as it combines the best of both games into a thrilling experience.

40148713.review:
可以说，这款游戏弥补了骑砍在近现代题材mod表现力上的空缺，就我玩过的一些骑砍mod，如二战中国战场、卡拉迪亚现代战争，星球大战等等，其枪械手感根本比不上真正的FPS游戏，这也是骑砍此类题材mod稀少的原因，并不是玩的人少，而是技术上的不足。有需求就有市场，这是我看好这款游戏的原因。
当然，这款游戏尚在开发期，还需要更多的改进，如人物模型，战斗AI等等，下面说些我对这款游戏的期望吧。
1、弹药系统，我物品栏里有一个手枪弹匣，我把它用在GLOCK上有17发子弹，用在其它手枪上就变成了10发，12发，是不是很不合理；而且打完仗后都是要收拾战场的，怎么可能把只打了一发的弹匣直接扔掉；很多人为了节约子弹，总会在战斗最后留下一发，以便在下次战斗时自动补满弹匣，这些凭空出现的弹药又怎么解释？官方若想保留这个硬核设定的话可以稍作修改，把物品栏中的弹匣换成子弹盒，内有一定数量的子弹，装备到身上后再变成弹匣，并减少物品栏中的子弹数量。
2、人物角色，骑砍和上古卷轴这两款游戏最大的差异便在角色模型上了，尤其是漂亮的女性角色，不过这不需要官方亲自动手，只需要增加一个第三人称切换功能和最基本的捏脸功能便可以了，其他的完全可以交给玩家。
3、场景互动，希望城市做出来后可以有最基本的互动，如椅子可以坐下等等，这也是很多mod的基础，我的老滚能坐在椅子上看书，能躺在床上睡觉，能拿起食物吃掉，而原版中只是能在椅子上坐下而已。
4、人物互动，多加一些有名有姓的npc啊，我名扬大陆有个屁用，连老婆都没有。玩骑砍时最爽的就是你在不出名时遇到了一个贵族女孩，你向她表白，但她家里不愿意，等你声望高起来时，她家反而开始主动巴结，自身成长时别人对自己看法的改变绝对是一个爽点。
5、战斗系统，不是所有人都喜欢硬核的，所以我希望今后可以通过mod对战斗系统进行调整和定制，比如，我要瞄准镜大一些，队友和敌人头上都有清晰的图标，击杀时有舒服的音效和清楚的提示，像战地1那样。
最后，希望制作组能专心于新功能的添加，而不是剧情的完善，那只是个新手教学而已，骑砍和老滚的火爆绝不是靠它们的剧情，而是mod的丰富性上。

40148649.review:
Bottom Line up front: is the game fun? Yes, with a barebones core established and fairly quick updates, the game continues to improve and I hope it will in the future. 

If you enjoyed M&B there's quite a good chance you'll like F:GW. The Derpiness of M&B battles has returned, complete with flying corpses. The game as a whole is rather barebones at the moment, however it progressing rapidly. I've owned the game for two weeks and there have been four updates that have added noticeable content, with several patches for bugs in between. 
This isn't a simulator though, this is not EFT or Arma. There is realism but it comes more from tactics and company composition, Superior Firepower is the name of the game and it's not acheived through sheer numbers though they do help. It is possible to win 3 to 1 odds in this game, and do so handily with proper troops and positioning. 
I'm looking forward to the day this game is 100% complete, and let's be honest it'll probably happen before Bannerlord arrives.

40144665.review: If you enjoy M&B you will enjoy this. The gunplay is nice and the animation and textures are good ,just a a little rough around the edges. It scrathed a werid little itch for a Yugoslavia c.1990s simulator. The potential for modding makes me giddy and I really hope KK Game Studios opens this game up to the steam workshop soon. As of its current state it seems a little bare-bones when it comes to content, The lack of quests and RP is a little sad, but im willing to bet its on the way. As of now though KK has created a wonderful foundation for themselves. So far there have been a few annoying bugs i've delt with, if you recruit a squad of bandits after you capture them, when you deploy them they wont follow orders even if your stats are high enough to control all the squads you have. On top of that when you attack a group of bandits with the same type of unit that you recruited, they wont spawn and you have to wait out the timer to reveal the enemy location on the map, only to find that your uncontrolable bandit squad is being registered as the only enemies. I made this mistake only twice and found I had to restart the game or retreat (that has some negative effects). I also noticed that when I was putting a bunch of new gear on, I put night vision goggles on last and they removed my armor value, slightly annoying to say the least. Other than that I have only had some basic bugs with hit boxes being weird and buttons being weird in menus. I went into detail about these issues not to scare you off but to make known of some issues I have seen. I've had a great time so far and am really pleased, and for the humble price of $15 I can easily overlook any little bugs I have encountered. Best Balkanization Simulator 2k18

40141417.review:
In 16 days they have added

-Day and night cycle
-Weapon Customization
-Prisoner system ( more in depth as m&b, extra options like propaganda, torture, execute, threaten, bribe)
-Weather system
-Ambient sound improvement

Not to mention the devs are extremely close with the community on their discord, report a bug, and there is a big chance and dev will personally acknowledge your report and make sure it's fixed in the next update.

*The gunplay is solid and statisfying, it's the main thing that keeps drawing me towards playing.
*Strategy isn't a small part of this game, order a squad in an exposed spot and they can get mowed down within seconds but a carefully planned flank can get rewarded with alot kills. And yes you can actually apply guerrila style hit and run tactics against bigger armies, knowing when to retreat to fight another day is extremely important if you don't want to lose your army.
*Combat is tense, just like your soldiers, standing in the open for a few seconds too long can mean getting mowed down, AI is suprisingly smart and will often try to flank you with mulitiple squads.
Retreating is some of the tensest things of this game, you'll lose alot of soldiers and there will be alot of dirt spatting up all around you.
*Features on the world map are limited but fun, I'm sure they'll add more in the future.

According to the devs Co-op will be very likely implemented and multiplayer will probably be added after single player is improved an optimized.

In short this game is the same kind of addicting as m&b: warband, and if you like fps combined with RTS, this is absolutely your game.

40132628.review:
自由人：游击战争

首发那天入手，还没汉化。简简单单玩了一会儿，游戏模式和骑砍一样，游戏内容还是较为简陋。除了跑商就是在大地图上找散兵游勇练枪法。但是，它依旧很吸引我。有两点：

一
与骑砍拿破仑不同的是，它可以机瞄，可以装配件，定制个人装备。

二
小队指挥系统，虽然小队AI有些智障，但也不妨碍我当总指挥的快感。像全战那样指挥战斗，像阿妈3那样躲在掩体里祈祷自己不要被敌人针对。

游戏画面与细节

相对于骑砍来说，那是好太多了。光影与建模都比骑砍最新的DLC维京征服要好。要说不足的地方，那就是某些枪械不是很写实，狙击枪像玩具枪，无论是射击手感还是换弹动作以及枪声。

战斗分为白天和夜间，夜间可装备夜视仪与手电筒。要我说，夜间战斗如果面对敌人的步兵海，简直是丧心病狂！这也是游戏里的特色。兵种高级不一定能打过低级步兵海。它让我想起来，现实中霉菌遇到阿拉叔叔游击也要躲在掩体里，大喊空中支援。笑~

其实在游戏里，还真是这样，敌人AI枪法很迷，有时很准，有时看着子弹就在你脚前击起尘土。一旦你被击中，那中弹特效真心赞。红屏，晃动，周围一切都变得黑暗。

最近游戏经常更新，开发者也在群里表示要每天一更，所以这篇评测我就写大致的游戏情况。另外，我也没啥时间详写。2018年，老婆还没找到，我先找老婆去~

This game has a lot of potential, it's the most fun i've had with a game in a while but in the current state it does get quite repetative. 

- AI is a bit clumsy which is a little frustrating which takes away from the fun, but not enough to discourage you from playing. 
- A few bugs like the zeroing for the scopes is not correct, but that may be because the muzzle velocity is higher on some guns than others, again, not enough to be too much concern, just adjust your aim accordingly.
- The sight for the RGP is just black for me and doesnt work, but to be honest I don't plan on sniping terrorists with a rocket so they will be in range for me to just guess where to hit.
- Trees have a invisible wall a metre or so around it, so you'd find youself hitting the tree more than the enemy, but they cant hit you anyway for the same reason, so whatever.
- Climbing ladders, opening doors and melee would be a nice addition, but i'm sure that will come in future updates.

Overall the game is in a good price range even in its current state. A few major updates with more content, bug fixes and general tidyness in menus will make this game simply awesome. Even if they do not add anymore content, I'd still be happy with buying this game, but would be wasted potential.

40126344.review:
[h1] Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare[/h1]

Freemna: Guerrilla Warfare hat rein garnichts mit dem stummen Helden aus Half Life zu tun, im Gegenteil.

Wie die kurze Spielbeschreibung schon sagt: 
Taktischer Sandbox First-Person Shooter gemischt mit Strategie und RPG Elementen, bei dem der Spieler die Rolle eines Kommandanten übernimmt, Geld sammelt, eine Armee aufbaut und in klassischer First-Person Manier kämpft.

Man startet in einem Menü indem man sich eine Fraktionsflagge aussuchen kann (bald kann man auch eigene hochladen) und einen Namen festlegen kann. Dann gehts weiter auf die Taktikkarte. Dort steht man mit seiner Figur und kann sich frei per Mausklick bewegen. Ein Klick auf eine freundlich gesindte Ortschaft und unsere Figur Marschiert schon los. Angekommen werden uns verschiedene Interaktionsmöglichkeiten angeboten. So sachen wie Handel, Krankenhaus, Rekrutieren etc. Dort kann man jedenfalls im Kampf erworbene Gegenstände verkaufen und wiederum neue Gegenstände einkaufen, denn man startet zu Anfang nur mit einer simplen Handfeuerwaffe.

Somit komme ich zum eigentlichen Gameplay:
Wir können diese Städte nehmlich nicht nur in freundlicher Absicht ansteuern, sondern auch um diese zu erobern. Die Kämpfe sehen so aus, das man auf einem Kartenabschnit seine Truppen in Stellung bringt und an deren Seite als Kommandant der Schlacht in der Ego-Perspektive bewohnt. Wärent des Gefechts, kann man seine Truppen via Wegpunkte oder sonstigen Befehlen navigieren.

Das Spiel ist noch recht jung, ich schreibe dennoch dieses Review, da ich hoffe weitere Leute dafür zu begeistern!

40125608.review:
+ similar to M&B = lot of potential
+ like a Gun specialized Mod; if you enjoyed Gun Mods like 1866 you will love this game
+ Devs working on it

- at this time, there is not a lot of content (you will be bored after some hours, there is not much to do)
- price with 15 € is way to much for actual content

For all beginners: Invest in Troops first, then in a solid rifle (then scope!). Neglect armor and other stuff for beginning to save money, later start with helmet to prevent unpredictable sudden deaths.

Skill in command and leadership to have more troops. for this skill, you need attribute INT, which gives you +1 skill point like in m&b. In battles it is important to survive, don't try to beat all enemies alone. You must play defensiv. If you die, you somehow (bug should be fixed, but it's still there) don't get loot even if your troops win.

Weapons: Most important factor in my opinion is muzzle velocity because the bullet drop is very strong, you will feel like in a tank simulator :)
later, if you have the choice, don't play with guns less than 2000m/s- you can take the vintorez like me, which has 2600, enough damage and 20 bullet mag.

40115252.review:
Too ealry and it's rather buggy, need another six months in the oven maybe even a year.

This concept is something I really wanted to try. It's also an idea I had for a game long ago but this is nothing like my idea. It's a very broken version of Mount and Blade. It can be with enough time and coding a good game but not at this point. Save your money, wait for a completed release.

Details:

Getting into the game I took on the baddies just to find out the loot was just a bad meme. Yep, the enemy is shooting rifles of various sourts but drop nothing like what they had. This is a HUGE game breaking mistake. Don't make me fight a 31 man unit ( with 15 guys) and then give me two revolvers and a handful of odd items to show for it. ARE YOU F'N KIDDING ME! 

After having a nice run attacking three groups and getting some loot the game decided to put a ghost enemy unit near me of three enemy. I attacked but no enemy unit was there. Ran around and the "Enemy" was the bandits I had just captured in the last fight. I could not kill them as they were marked as friendlies, so I retreated but could not leave the map. So I left the game but it did not save anything so an hour and a half lost.  

I spent only 2 hours on this game but the crude graphics / gameplay circa 1999, no depth has me asking for a refund. 

Good concept Devs, really bad execution.

I have to say, I am very surprised by the community when it comes to this game.  It's clearly not ready for release, not even in Early Access.  I have no understanding why people rated this game so high in its current form.  They must be hoping that it is going to improve.

In its current form, the game is horribly unpolished and very rigid in combat and the world map.  Yes, it's a lot like Mount and Blade, but it's not even close to that level of playability yet.  You can't even adjust your settings.  You either select high, medium, or low...

Like so many games these days, this needed to be developed a lot more before considering a release.

This may very well be a great game one day, but it's just not there yet.

40098292.review:
结合射击策略养成为一体的游戏，非常有意思。
说几个小技巧，大神可以略过
1，自己队伍中尽快出狙击队，npc队伍我没见过狙击队，炮灰侦查，狙击队安全距离接战，20人规模对20人基本损伤可以控制在2人以内。
2，游戏地图极广，对于玩过弹道狙击类游戏的会友善许多，最快时间买狙击，保持1个山头开外到两个山头，身穿狙击隐蔽套装，有效保证自己存活率。这个距离玩过弹道狙击的一般第二枪都能打中，运气好的时候连着一枪一个，接战距离在一个山头外无论敌我步枪队命中很低。
3，攻城战攻方优势明显，看评论区表示攻城人数差距大不好打，这里说说我的方法，6队打80+人成功案例，配置是2队狙击6人，3队步枪15人，1队机枪3人，开局迅速转移至能有效狙击城内的最远最高的狙击点，两队狙击和带狙击的你是主力输出，其余4个队保持一定距离环绕狙击队周围，不能让对方游击队绕路过来骚扰，在补给箱内带足弹药血袋，你不能挂。攻城一共15分钟，前10分钟以狙击为主，敌方基本集中在城镇内，预计能击杀60人左右，人数上差距不明显就可以考虑冲锋了。前10分钟我自己击杀过20人左右，其余40人左右都是狙击队干掉的。整场下来自己共击杀24人。如果换成步枪队火拼那基本就是1换1，损失很难控制。
4，对于一些实在头疼军队工资的朋友目前有个bug可以利用，新的一天来到，保存退出游戏再重启，你就不需要付拖欠了的工资了。

40092416.review:
This game, has so much potential,and looks to be, possibly one of
the best new RTS this year. There are so many things that this game 
does well, but as with any game this early in development, it has its
flaws. There are a certain amount of bugs, that just become a pain 
in the ass. The hitboxes on items, felt like they were cut out quickly 
so in many cases, when you are trying to get an angle, you'll end up
shooting the rock, or building in front of you. This im sure will be fixed 
in time, but for now is just a minor convenience. As for the RTS portion of 
of the game. It feels unfinished, and is very unsatisfactory.


FPS
The FPS portion of this game is what the devs seem to be focusing on.
They have done pretty well with the combat so far. The guns seem to be 
fairly well balanced, and trying to get better guns does something. 
Cons: The only issues I have with combat, are the hitboxes of all
the scenery. The hitboxes seem to be much bigger than the actual object
which make peeking corners very hard. The other issue is that, the AI,
isnt very smart, making it very easy for you to kill them, without 
putting yourself at risk.

RTS
The RTS of this game, is not all there to say the least. For long time
lovers of RTS's this game, comes as a disapointment. There are only basic
controls of squads, you are only able to tell them where to go, and even then
the shoddy AI, might not go there. The base is there to make the RTS good though.
The RTS isn't great, but it still might make it.

World Map
The actualy campaign portion of the game, is a great concept. They dont have turns
in this game, instead, while you are moving your army of mercenairies, time goes then,
but when you are stopped, time is paused. It's a concept i've never seen in an RTS, and works
quite well. When enough time has passed, you have to pay your armys salary, the longer it takes you 
to pay them, the more their moral/loyalty goes down.

Player
The player customization is quite good also. The more battles you win, more kills you get
the more XP and levels you get, and the more levels, the more skill points, and with those skill
points you can get a large amount of things, such as more health, more weapon damage,
or more squads you can lead into battle.

Conclusion: I will keep updating the review as the game gets updated, but currently, refining hitboxes,
fixing the AI, and hopefully giving a little more love to the RTS part of the game.
This game sitting at 15 dollars, is a worth purchase(for me) I've gotten quite a few hours 
of good fun out of it already, and i'm hoping to get even more.

40076103.review:
It's a tough gig to get the ball rolling once starting a new character. For the first few fights you'll have to plan carefully and fight even more carefully.

The battlemaps are sized medium to large in scale. Plenty of room to abuse terrain be it urban, rural or countryside.

The squad commands for the moment seems rather clunky but still workable. Utilizing a waypoint system in which you have to be viewing the map overview to place or remove waypoints. Similar to the first installments of Rainbow Six and Ghost Recon for the PC wayyyyy back in the day.

And just like many of the other reviewers say, it's pretty much Mount & Blade with a modern combat theme. I'm a little hesitant to compare it to Arma because for me it seemed to have more in common with Squad. However I'm rather excited to see this game develop further.
