Great idea for a game.  It should be good once it has been thru pre-alpha testing; unfortunatly it is way too early too even consider this almost "Early-Acess"

If you do get this and intend to play before release; your $$ will grant you the ability to participate in constant untested updates where you get to send in the bug reports (not kidding) for each update.

Also, this is a "Arma-lite singleplayer only" as it stands; if you already have and know how to use Arma, (or Operation Flashpoint for that matter)  you already have a finished and more robust product (that you can play with your friends).

When this is done and the unnanounced MP has been included, it will be worth the $$, but right now i would wait for the summer sales and get it for 25% of it's current asking price.

Геймплей на стратегической карте - Бродим и прокачиваемся на бандитах и террористах, захватываем города.

Геймплей на тактической карте - Управляем отрядами на местности и бегаем от первого лица. Стрельба доставляет удовольствие.

Из оружия Пистолеты-пулеметы, Пистолеты, Ружья, Штурмовые винтовки, Пулеметы, Снайперка, Дробаш и Гранатомет. 
Можно устанавливать разные прицелы и глушители. 

Ваши отряды вооружены Ружьями, Штурмовыми винтовками, Пулеметами и Снайперками, также у отрядов есть осколочные гранаты, дымовые гранаты, подствольники. 

Также можно приодеться в Шлем, Наколенники, очки, перчатки и броник, что повысит вашу броню.

В свой отряд можно нанимать либо наемников, либо солдат из 3-х фракций, также можно взять в плен и завербовать, тех самых, бандитов или терористов.

40058774.review:
[b]This game is Mount and Blade with guns, and (currently) lacking the same level of "polish".[/b] And when you can say M&B actually has polish compared to something else, thats not generally a good thing.

However, Freeman:GW has quite a lot going for it, and considering how recently it went live, it's state in early access, and what we already have to work with in terms of content, I think it's safe to say this game will most likely be worth your time. [b]If you can take the good with the bad, and the concept alone sounds great, then the game will be worth the $15 price of admission for you. If not, give it some time[/b], as the game is quite honestly PLAGUED with rough edges. But for the most part, what's in the game does function more or less. 

As a last general statement, [b]I really do want to reccomend this game, but as with any early access title, tread lightly.[/b]

Now, in regards to early access period specifics that don't seem to pertain to random bugs:
[list]
[*]The UI needs a bit of work, there is an annoying issue pertaining to buttons staying "selected" even when the mouse cursor has moved to another button, hard to explain, easy to notice

[*]There could stand to be a bit more optimization with either the player models or the gun-scope models, one of them is killing my frames in even smaller battles

[*]The gunplay is functional and not altogether bad, but sights (both irons and magnified optics alike) are all over the place, quite literally; they tend to simply line up somewhere on the screen and it's hard to tell if you're supposed to be using the sights themselves or the invisible crosshair in the middle of the screen, I'm 90% sure it's the latter since you seemingly have to compensate for bullet drop at every range, even point blank (although this one could just be me being bad)

[*]The AI seems to have the unfortunately common ability to see and shoot through non-solid objects the player cannot (bushes, grass, etc.) making for some potentially annoying moments considering the more or less "open field" layout of the battlefields thus far

[*]There are just so many ways to lose frames in this game that to list them all would likely double the length of this review
[/list]
These are all ultimately minor gripes in the grand scheme of things, and as stated I do not see them as bugs, more design oversights/mid-development hitches that otherwise don't seem to belong in the final product, whenever that release may be. While at time of writing I have a mere 5 hours of game time, [b]these have all been apparent enough and common enough that even in that small time span, these things were easily identifiable. The dev team seem to have their shit together (another notable positive) so I have faith that most of these will be addressed in the forseeable future.[/b]

40047310.review:
Problems with this game which really currently resembles more of a boring mod:

AI factions are so passive and idle (except hostiles ones might occassionally chase you) that they feel like they are just background/decorations, they as far as I know never interact with each other, never intervene in assistance to player against any mutual enemy factions, never battle eachother, never siege down any enemy settlements, despite being nominally "at war".

Not only that, AI factions do not give out any quest to you, and you start out at war with the Uman Brotherhood and Bandits, who follow the strange rule mentioned above and only attack you, the only thing you could do if you do not have a death wish is probably to grind for a long time, which I am in the progress of, and is starting to feel tedious to me.

Right now the game is unfortunately a shell without much immersion nor fleshed out content, it's easy to be bored of it and frankly I couldn't possibly recommend this game at this state.

I'd give it a 4/10, it has some potential, and I would revise it in the future should the developers address the aforementioned problems.

40043728.review:
最初在3DM上看见了这款游戏，本来感觉画质一般，没打算玩，但由于他一直位于周榜第二...
好奇心驱使我下载试玩了这款游戏。刚进入游戏，那个画面让我开始怀疑三大妈是不是脑抽了（因为我之前没有接触过骑砍之类的游戏）耐着性子想试着找找这游戏吸引人的地方。
开始战斗时我直接让我的两队人跟着我，拿着手枪就冲上去感觉自己可以杀出一片天，没想到这游戏根本不是无脑突突突，对面人只要发现你之后无论你怎么躲藏他们的火力都会一直跟着你，你需要一些小战略让自己的士兵占领重要地形，狙击手血少需要一些步兵的掩护，机枪兵血多攻击少他们的士气总是地沉沉的，你就需要让他们冲锋杀敌涨士气。你会无时无刻享受到指挥官的感觉。
那种指挥士兵血战砂场的感觉一下子使我上了瘾，本打算早早休息，没想到玩着玩着就玩到了天亮，第二天也是想都不想就入了正。（因为本人对游戏挑剔，习惯先在3DM下载试玩，再考虑入正。）
在此鄙人有几点小建议希望制作组可以考虑一下
1.最重要的一点，官方中文。
2.人物个性化（所有兵种都除了衣服脸都是一个样..）
3.兵种多元化和士兵枪械的自定义
4.防守时敌人有时会集火一个城镇，我一次只能控制七队人，大概28人左右的。他们有100多人，根本派兵就是出来就死出来就没士气。这个让我很烦恼，希望城镇驻军可以自由应战，有一些防守区域让他们架枪。
5.战斗地形，我在城镇附近沼泽附近与敌人交战，进入战斗后的区域还是平原山林..（这点有点鸡蛋里挑骨头了）
6.希望有天气和昼夜变化
7.更完善的AI
话有点多了...
总之
支持这款游戏！很棒！

40041812.review:
I like this game a lot but I think feature wise it needs fleshing out. The setting in and of itself is that of insurrectionary warfare and it would be cool to see the devs make our paramilitary groups able to do more, y'know, paramilitary stuff. Like maybe drug dealing, or building tunnel networks, or smuggling guns, or helping foreign governments who have economic interests in the region in return for funding or weapons or soldiers or something. Also some sabotage might be fun. Like one thing about being an insurgent group is being able to bomb things. I'd love it if we had some options there.

Like there's half a century worth of cold war history full with ideas. What made Mount and Blade so good wasn't just the combat. But rather the big breathing world full of interactivity. The inter-politics within the factions, being able to start enterprises, that sort of thing. If the game gets that, then I'll gladly recommend it.

Salut à tous ! 

Et bien comment dire ... ce jeu je pense plaira à ce qui aime le Mount & Blade mélangé  au plan stratégique 

Niveau Gameplay Fight
Avec les quelques heures de jeu dessus , je peux déjà dire que graphiquement il est très propre , le jeu se rapproche plus à un jeu simulation arma pendant les figth  qu'un call of duty un bon jeu arcade , j'entends par là qu'il faudra ajuster votre tir en fonction de la distance et du mouvement , ce qui est un bon point pour moi , en suite le style de combat avec la map  en donnant des ordres direct à vos troupes et vraiment intéressant car ça ouvre plusieurs possibilité aux combats ce qui pourrait être sympa à voir sur un M&B , les armes sont très jolies , éjections des balles à chaque tir est plaisant 
Pour ce qui est des boots qui nous accompagnes ... Comment dire ils sont vos chiens de gardes , ils vont tirer sans regarder devant eux , qu'ils aient un arbres , un mur , un rocher, ... Ça les empêcheront pas de tirer dessus si l'ennemi et en face deux à 100m un petit hic mais difficile à régler je pense encore , après il y a aussi le buisson impossible à traverser haha 
Un reproche que je pourrais faire ces t le manque de combat en urbain car la plus part de vos affrontement seront dans des pleins style M&B , je veux bien croire que des escarmouches dans les plaines ça existe mais pas à chaque fois , il y a bien des cabanes de chasseurs , usines , écoles, bâtiments abandonné dans les plaines parce que les seuls combats avec bâtiments seront les prises ou défense de ville pour ma part ce que je trouve dommage car avec le plan et les ordres cela pourrait vraiment rendre les combat encore plus intéressant 


Niveau carte 
Sa présentation est comme M&B donc on ne s'y perd pas , assez similaire, oublié le fait de vous balader dans les villes à pieds , cela n'existe pas 
Un bug assez régulier pour ma part c'est que par moment mon perso refuse de se déplacer sur la mal alors que le monde bouge ou bien il se met à l'arrêt et refuse de se remettre sur play...
Ce que je trouve dommage mais peut être que ça viendra plus tard ce sont les véhicules , que ça soit pour le déplacement ou les combats , dans les combats moderne il y a toujours au minimum une jeep qui traîne par la ^^ car faire les déplacements à pied constamment c'est assez lassant 

Je pense que ce jeu pourra plaire à pas mal d'entre vous , après 15e ce n'est pas chère pour ce jeu puis je pense que ça va un peu monte une fois qu'il sera un peu plus connu , j'espère que des véhicules seront vite mis en place et pourquoi pas un Mod  multijoueur 

Si vous avez des questions n'hésitez pas ;) 
C'était Metalbin pour vous servir !!

40039580.review:
游戏本来我挺看好的，自从我看见是U3D引擎后我就放弃了，实在抱歉。
而且说是现代战争版骑砍，不如说是骑砍引擎弱化版+现代战争威力强化版。
游戏大地图界面按空格加速行走会严重卡顿
战斗方面过于拖沓，半天找不到敌人，有些时候找对面人活活找到卫星部署，强行拖慢一场游戏的节奏。
AI动作僵硬，莫名其妙对天鸣枪，队友枪法甚是感人，哪怕是比较高级的兵种，打起仗来也跟一群暴徒一样打泥沙玩的。
游戏前期只给你一把手枪，哪怕最开始给你的志愿兵枪都比你好，然而你只能活在看队友瞎打，自己手枪打不着的尴尬处境里
李云龙同志：他娘的，官越大，枪越小
游戏里面不少东西明明是感觉来说有用的，但是你怎么都用不了，比如望远镜之类的（也可能是我没搞懂怎么用）

但是游戏说实话除了引擎让我不喜欢之外，其他各方面都让我感觉还是很有潜力的
以后如果可以加入的东西有（制作人考虑的话）：
昼夜系统（包括夜晚用的夜视仪头盔或者手电筒之类的装备）
炮火支援（信号弹）
机枪脚架（不过这个版本的机枪也挺OP的，后坐力相比其他武器威力并不大，而且子弹也多）（这个以后如果可以出城那种买弹药（一箱100发，然后30发，或者45发，从一箱里面补充的就更好一点，也合理）
游戏我还是推荐的，但是如果说是冲着骑砍那种的话，还是要别抱着太大希望，很容易让你感觉到不满的

40039354.review:
**REFUNDED**
This game has a lot of potential but in the current state is no where near worth $15. Maybe I will buy it on sale or something unless it improves greatly. At this point in time I am done buying games that aren't finished. I would rather pay a higher price for something I will love then pay a low price and wait 2 years just to be let down by unfulfilled promises and lack of delivery.... like we see ALLL THE TIME... Don't get me wrong. I had a little bit of fun and can see this game turning into a favorite. Just don't want to spend money on something like this just to wait around for it to happen.... 

I have checked the "Follow" box and will keep up to date on what seems to have the potential to be an awesome game. Although I am unsure how long that will take. I will be back and will change this review to recommended should the development justify it.


In Short.. I would rather wait till the game has more content and is more playable rather then throw away $15 for the current state of the game. The hour and a half I played I had a little fun and was more trying to figure out commands, controls, and what to do. 

Overview:
There is only one play mode, one campaign where you start out with yourself and a band of rag tag bandits.

The objective is to overtake the world... or well... Island you start on. It was awesome to find a game like there where you can take control of your player in the battle field and fight in hopes to sway the tide.

Positives:
It has a lot of potential.
The combat seems pretty good for what it is... but I would hope it improves with the rest of the game.
Strategy counts, rocks, trees, buildings, where you go and what you do matters on the battlefield.
RPS and Grenades make cool booms
Charging at the enemy with 4 groups of troops is a really cool experience (you will probably die though)

Negatives:
There are a lot of things missing... A LOT. Pretty much the only thing you can do at this point is find enemies like bandits and fight them over and over till you can afford to buy better guns and troops to take with you.
You can only play one person, and if you are wounded to near death you are taken out of the fight.
No Difficulty Changes... only one difficulty setting
Only one small map to play on
No back story, no dialog, no tutorial...


What would make me buy it again:
Content, content, content....
I was weary as the game is in early beta stages and it looks awesome from the store page. I was dissapointed to buy a game that seemed to be missing so much and has a price tag of $15
Cheaper price tag until more content is added

Suggestions:
Ability to Loot Downed Enemies/Friendlies
A LOT of different starting game options (Start with a town, without, equipment, guns, etc...)
Add Scenarios
Add different Difficulty settings
Add keyboard commands to move troops around
Make moving troops around easier in the map menu... (I.E. Left click to select, right click to designate waypoint)
Add a tutorial... Really had no idea how to do much the first 30min or so.

40038586.review:
I really don't do too many reivews (first one I've ever done for a game on Steam) but I I'm liking what I see from this game so far and can only hope that its potential will be realized through its EA stage.  It shows a lot of promise!  As everyone else has pointed out, FGW is essentially the wedlock child of Mount & Blade and whichever FPS Maury discovers to be the father through paternity testing.  If you are familiar with M&B, you will instantly become familiar with the overall map, town layout, combat setup, trading, etc.  In addition, you'll be familiar with the "started from bottom, now we here" routine in that you begin with a Makarov pistol and two squads of rebels without a cause.  Like nearly all ground force commanders, your early success largely depends on riding the backs of your soldiers to victory against fairly less competent armed groups, all the while you mindlessly stand out in the open trying to figure what everyone is shooting at.  Fortunately, from my observation the AI is pretty strong; your squads will not foolishly rush into open fire, and have the sense to take available cover or hit the dirt while sending steel downrange.  Of course, you will have to take out some tangoes on your own in order to gain any experience and the confidence of your men.  As you gain some XP, you will be able to command more men and take more squad into battle (assuming you spend your skill point wisely).  In the world map, you can trade, recruit, heal up, and lay siege to villages belonging to different factions involved in the conflict.  Your men have the luxury of limitless ammo, your character will regular refits of ammo, medkits, frags, etc. (do your damn PCCs).  

While the game is obviously incomplete, I see a lot of potential for this game and believe it will grow to be a good sleeper title.  Worst case scenerio, it will serve as a placeholder for M&B Bannerlord. I believe that most of the cons I see for this game will be addressed during its EA period, and highly recommend it based on potential:

Pros:
+ M&B w/ mordern weaponry (enough said)

+ Ballistic trajectory.  I can appreciate the facts that rounds are not always going to land exactly where my line up at distance.  You'll find that dirt kick up and Kentucky windage will be your friend.

+ Weapon Variety.  The different types and calibers of weapons is quite impressive IMO. 

+ Sound quality.  Seems like a small thing, but the sounds of gunfire are quite effective in letting me know what type of squad I'm up against.  Also, while generic, your squads do well to notify you of their situation (although it may be difficult to determine is providing the feedback).

+ Strategy Map.  The map to command your squads during is pretty useful in that terrain and vegetation is well depicted, and it easily allows you to set up waypoints and make quidk drag-n-drop adjustment in the event of contact.  Known enemy positions are also shown easily.  After a set amountof time, enmey locations are revealed, which may be a bit cheesy, but helpful given the rather large map size.  

+ Inventory Management.  Having to manage your own inventory put me back to Faces of War (another favorite mine), and to some degree adds to the realism.  That being said, it may be a bit weird that YOU ARE THE ONLY ONE who has to worry about an ammo count.  Fortunately, ammo is priced reasonably enough for it to not be a big deal.

+ M&B w/ guns (I may have said that already).

Cons:
- No missions.  Obviously the devs are working this, but currently the only quest is to take over 10 towns and oblierate some of the game's factions.  It's certainly easy to piss people off, but I haven't seen a way to gain favor of a group that at least neutral to you. 

- No vehicles.  The battle maps are quite large and IMO shoudl be able to support light armor or transport vehicle at the least.

- Body physics.  The ragdoll effect from neutralized soldiers is neat, but sometimes they seem to die in a crounched position with a weird head nod going on.  From distance it may seem like your target is still a alive.  Certainly not a deal breaker, but something I ould like to see fixed.

Reccomendations:
~ Minimap.  A minimap, or at least a compass would be a welcome addition to the UI.  It is very easy to become disorientated and switching to the startegy map just to get your bearing can be frustrating.

~ EPWs.  In M&B, you're able to take prisoners whom you may decide to recruit, ransom, etc.  Seeing as to how FGW already draws so many similarities, I think it neat would be neat to incorporate this well, with similar options, or even the ability to interrogate prisoners on intel of thier group's future movement or something

~ DIrect Command.  I may be wrong, but as far as I can tell the only to command your squads is through the strategy map.  It would nice to have to some quick direct commands (move to flank, suppress, run like hell...) to squads in your proximity without having to cycle to the map.

~ Specialized Squads.  I don't think a single hero would be appropriate in this game, but it would be cool to occasionally run into a spec ops team or some form of special group that you hire to join your force.

~ Rollover Squad Members.  While I can understand the frustation of the two men who weren't selected to be the MG or sniper team, I would to have ability to refit them as a different squad rather than let them take their ball and go home.

May be some things I but that's about the gist of it.  If you enjoy M&B, this is well in your comfort zone.  If you're on the fence, I say give it a shot if you nothing better to do with $15.

40034194.review:
After getting this game I definitely realized the potential. Especially with internet not being available at my house, the basis of it keeps it very entertaining. I think especially in the future it will be AMAZING, but for now I can still have a lot of fun on it. It's a great mix of command and action, your the general of a small army and you can control them, but you are alos one of the soldies. Amazing concept and good execution so far. That is my schpeal to those looking to see if they want to get this game. Get it. Even if you buy it now and wait a year for it be polished. Help support this project! The reast of this review is for devs..

My suggestions/issues

I may not have the greatest graphics card in the world, but I can usually run most games on high if not ultra. However, this game I have settings to performance rather than graphics, and everything else on low; however if Im using a sniper or the pka scope im almost unable to see whats going on because my screen is skipping around really bad, especially the more troops I have deployed or enemys spawned.Even with an assault rifle and a red dot, it will get choopy if 10 enemies are spawned. I also tried lower resolution, to no avail. But realistically I shouldn't need a top notch computer to play any game on low resolution, as not very many people have those anyway. I hope that's something that can be fixed seim-easily. That is my main issue currently. If that was fixed I would have no other issues with the game. Just makes it hard to play. I understand there are many non-funtioning features currently and I'm positiive you are already aware of them.


So I'll finish off with this:
Nothing I say here is knocking your game, just trying to help you with the things that would matter most to me at least while were in the developmental part, as well as seeing a couple of them in the final edition.. 

Suggestions
-Maybe add a way to control troops while in the FPS mode
-Our own squad with us as leader that plays while we are on the map screen controlling troops so we don't have to catch up
-Pick up ammo/other things off dead soliders
-Variable zoom scopes, and scopes with metering (for gravity of bullets)
-Melee weapons, crossbows, other unique weapons would be cool
-Add a "take cover" command for troops with the "caution" and "charge" commands
- Ability to make stuff out of the random drops (ie. electronics, gears, camos, skins, maybe moss to help with camo while in the field or ghillie suits for us snipers, or abilty to make cover out of nothing (maybe utilizing the shovel to dig a mini trech, or sandbags for bunkers,something like that)
-A button that we as players can use to mark enemies our troops haven't seen yet
-Vehicles, and drones for scouting (something to help us scout so we can prepare for an ambush from behind) when deployed
-Enemies actually spawning inside of red-zone
-Leveling our own troops up further (not sure if that's implemented yet just haven't been able to upgrade my snipers at all)
-Buildings on atack battlefield would add different strategies and more than just hills, rocks, and trees. 
-hitmarkers, so we know if we actually hit someone from across the map when it's hard to see.
-Day and night (night battles would be awesome, but then make sure to add night-vision and infrared scopes, as well as utilizing the flashlight - maybe let us attach it to gun as well) - Give AI snipers this ability as well
-Being able to revivie our troops would be cool, though not necessary. that ones up to you.
-Stealth missions or something involving more stealth. Maybe a whole force full of stealthy snipers to take down a base - mission
-Last but not least, don't be afraid to take ideas from some of the more popular games and implement them.I fel like COD mixed with skyrim mixed with GTA mixed with Payday II mixed with God of War mixed with Fallout would be badass (obviously. Why not add great ideas from other games to this one?



Just an idea.. It would be cool if you  gave the option for the character to follow troops when your in the map -m- mode, as I find myself constantly falling behind when I have 7 troops to tell what to do. If not that, maybe a flank option that AI can do itself. Just something to speed up the commander process and make the game a little more on-the-go instead of play-pause-command-play-find cover-command etc.. Something more intuitive. A huge plus of this game is that it's got both MMO and FPS in it, which keeps the player in control of others, as well as ourselves. A great way to capture the minds of many different types of players. But if we have a bunch of troops to control, the FPS side (my favorite aspect) is taken away from, making it a tiny bit less fun for me.

Just in case anyone reads this whole post.. I love this game, has turned into pretty much my new favorite game besides GTAV. I am stoked to see it's development over the the next year. However, it is very early so I felt it might be helpful to put my two cents in. I'm sure I'll add more as I play more, those are just my immediate thoughts now that I'm about 5 hours in. 

Finally, keep going on this game. It's amazing, especially for how long it's been out. It's a great idea and I think there are infinite amounts of directions you can take it and features you can add to make it fully immersive, and bothy easy as well as challenging to play. I am excited to see what you guys do with it. Thank you for reading this as well as providing me with something I can enjoy while trying to escape from my real life and problems.

40033407.review: Заманили в игру отзывы сравнивающие эту игру с Mount & Blade. Не ведитесь! То что в этой игре частично передрали концепцию, переложив на рельсы шутера, это одно, но удовольствия от геймплея нет никакого. Хватило на полтора часа боли и унижения - шутер в котором ты бегаешь и клацаешь пустым магазином, потому что нет патронов (их можно покупать в городах, но их там всегда 3-4 магазина каждого калибра), звук от которого становится плохо, полное отсутсвие баллистики, я полтора часа пытался старательно понять по каким вобще законам физики тут летят пули, пока не убедился что по прямой с абсолютно рандомным разбросом. Оружие это просто ужос, пробуя один ствол за другим - убедился что один просто хуже другого. Я хотел скоротать пару вечеров в смесь M&B и шутера, в итоге не нашел вобще ничего в этой игре. У игры нет даже основы - состовляющей шутера, и пока разрабы не пофиксят стрельбу сделав её хоть чуточку адекватной и правдоподобной - нет смысла вобще что-ли бо делать в игре в которой нужно большую часть времени стрелять.

40033145.review:
Ok. I only put about 4 hours into this due to being busy this week, but when I get more time on the weekend, I'm going to binge it. Yes, its very shallow now. Not many features. No vehicles. No multiplayer. And Arma 3 Zuess can do the same thing basically, but its just a quick and dirty Mount & Blade with guns and mindless violence.

If it was just a pure Warband clone, it would be allright, but the FPS combat makes it stand out on its own. And to be fair, the AI won't mindlessly charge you like in Warband. If you attack a smaller group, they will try to wait for you to come to them but if they outnumber you they will try to attack you from all sides. That said, I have figured out how to cheese the AI by concentrating fire, but on occasion the eliete baddies will require me to cycle in my elites after my "villager" volunteers get wiped out.

Still... Be warned this is early access and you may only get 20 hours of game time out of now if the devs abandon it. Hopefully they will add mod support and multiplayer and this game will most likely get into the 100 hours of game play for me. I've spent more on early access games that were abandoned so $14.99 is a resonable price point as I could have just spent that on a bottle of vodka and it would have only lasted only 1 or 2 hours for me.

But would recommend a bottle of vodka and some Russian rock music for an addon.

Un brin de mount and blade et de Arma.
Recrutez vos escouades , armez vous et partez à la conquête des factions ennemies. (Actuellement  prendre possession de 10 villes , soit pas loin de la totalité ).

Quelques armes et equipements disponibles .
Des ressources à revendre pour faire de brouzouffes.
Une gestion des villes et troupes sommaire.

Je suis mitigé sur ce titre .
Le concept est vraiment sympa , un bon mix qui doit permettre au jeu solo de gagner en longévité.

Mais pour l'heure la réalisation est encore brute:
Vos pas font autant de bruit que les tirs . 
On dirait qu'il n'y a qu'une seul map pour les escarmouches.
La gestion des escouades est une plaie .
Mais ca tourne sans heurt (près de 8h).


Encore beaucoup de travail est nécessaire pour polir cette pierre.
Mais une défense de ville avec pas loin de 200 bots au total  qui s'agitent sur la map ça fait une beau bordel.

40030806.review: This is a great game and it is really going to get better. The devs are vocal and receptive on Discord and bugs are getting squashed all the time. At this stage you can have a 'blast' just taking on large groups of the enemy and attacking/defending towns. Trading is a thing but you make a load of dough just taking out rival armies. In the future there will be a broader selection of troop types and light vehicles to boot. Gun fights occur at pretty long range and getting to know your gun is important as the enemy is a pretty good shot. For now it is pretty straight forward. Kill enemies and controll towns but there is talk of missions, and factional conflicts. If you liked M&B and also enjoy tactics and a bit of shooty action then go ahead and pick this up.

40022808.review:
EL HIJO PREDILECTO

Echando un ojo a algunos análisis me encuentro con una mayoría de jugadores ensimismados con la idea... y no es para menos, por fin alguien es capaz de entrelazar dos géneros tan aclamados y venerados por la comunidad. Por un lado M&B, que resultó ser una obra maestra con su enfoque más que original y bien balanceado. Cualquiera que le dedique al menos 5 minutos se encontrará con un interfaz que roza lo calcado, así como sus mecánicas de juego o su mundo dinámico con diversas facciones (aún por implementar)

Por otro lado hay quién se encarga de atribuirle las características del título de simulación Arma. Si bien es cierto, se trata de un juego que está ambientado en la guerra moderna pero…. ¿Por qué  Arma si existen tantos juegos que cumplen esta misma premisa? ¿Por qué no Call Of Duty o Medal of Honor? Tengo que decir soy un activo jugador de ambos juegos, tanto M&B como Arma (desde que se llamaba Operation Flashpoint) y es bien sabido que fácilmente, he podido establecer diversas relaciones entre el primer título y el  juego en cuestión, sin embargo, me resulta casi imposible hacerlo con Arma. Pues aun habiendo jugado una media de 6 horas he podido observar que en FGW la inteligencia artificial es bastante capaz de tomar decisiones básicas y asegurar su supervivencia en combate (tomar coberturas o incluso avanzar haciendo supresión) algo impensable en Arma (soldados que no cubren sectores o que no son capaces de ponerse a cubierto, vehículos pasando por encima de tus tropas, helicópteros que se chocan entre sí….) así como la interfaz gráfica o más bien, la jugabilidad, que ofrece alternativas mucho más simples y funcionales que los enrevesados menús con los que Arma aturulla al jugador y sobre todo y más importante, en FGW mi personaje puede resistir más tiros que el T800 en Terminator, algo que en Arma resulta inconcebible, pues cualquier jugador sabe que puedes morir de un tiro a más de 800 metros por la IA que dispara sin ningún tipo de visor y con el viento en contra…. (La misma que momentos antes bajo tu mando no es capaz de seguir tus órdenes)

Dejando a un lado este ataque a la poca coherencia que me suscita la comparación con Arma, he de decir, que FGW se trata de una idea innovadora cuanto menos, pero que por el momento es sólo una idea. Creo firmemente que se trata de un juego que tiene que trabajar mucho y ofrecer al menos el mismo dinamismo en lo que el mundo se refiere que nos ofreció M&B. Por el momento, las facciones no se atacan entre sí, no existen sistemas de alianzas o ningún tipo de diplomacia y no hay más misiones que la principal (controlar territorios). En el apartado más innovador, la lucha en tiempo real con unidades modernas, Creo imprescindible adecuarlo al contexto inmediato, si bien es cierto que al tratarse de un mundo moderno el sistema de combate ha de adaptarse a lo que esta atmosfera requiere: implementación de vehículos y armas montadas que le aportarían al juego mucha más profundidad táctica y estratégica, sobre todo a la hora de tomar y defender fortalezas o puntos clave.

Por último considero necesario decir que tenemos que andar con pies de plomo, pues se trata de un early Access, algo con lo que estoy seguro, muchos de nosotros ya nos hemos llevado algún que otro chasco, no sólo porque no llegue a cumplir nuestras expectativas, sino como acertadamente ha recalcado un usuario en su review, “estamos pagando por un coche que aún no tiene ruedas” y eso conlleva cierta responsabilidad por nuestra parte a la hora de demandar y exigir a los desarrolladores que cumplan con nuestras expectativas. En definitiva, si te gustó Mount & Blade este es tu juego.

40022031.review:
The game is still sorely lacking in many aspects and feels very much incomplete as it is. 

The overall way you control your units whilst in a gun fight and whilst looking around for enemies can get considerably tedious as you try and balance seperating your troops enough to sweep for enemies whilst also keeping them near enough to support each other when the fight breaks out. Whilst this can be fun occassionally, it gets stale very quickly as the game doesn't currently have a "Delegate" option for your troops to command themselves, nor does it have an autoresolve feature, meaning you have to actively search for enemies rather carefully (even if you greatly outnumber them) every battle or risk taking heavy casualties.

That being said, the game has an extreme amount of potential overall with a whole plethora of great ideas that would hopefully one day develop into a great and grand game. 

There are a couple of things I would really like to see in the finished game though:

1. An option to have your troops autodeploy and delegate with the player being able to select if their troops should act on their own aggressively, defensively, or in a balanced manner.

2. Some small form of interactivity in the game in the form of a story line or quests.

3. More abilities/ traits such as the ability to spot enemies, highlighting them.

40012665.review:
A lot of potential to be a great game, feels like a modern version of Mount & Blade, but definitely still needs a lot of work, I think this game could have held off a few more months before coming to early access.
So far it is extremely challenging due to the enemies having significantly better weapons and armor than you at the start so it amounts to just roaming around the map trying to find small enough bands of enemies to be able to effectively fight them. Even then, you'll still have a very hard time beating these  enemies, I may have just had bad luck but the enemies were impossibly accurate, killing me very quickly at a decent range while I was proned.
I'm going to refund this for now but I'll keep my eyes on it to see if the devs balance the game and see how it expands. I'm interested to see this concept taken to a map as big as Calradia.

40011517.review:
[h1]I'm downvoting this game [b][i]for now[/i][/b]![/h1]
I eagerly await improvements to change my rating!
[b]The reason[/b]: this game is just too early to recommend as a game worth playing. I always believe that devs need to earn their upvote. I'm not a blind fanboy bandwaggon kiddie (plenty of those around!). If I am paying for something I expect it to deliver what I'm paying for.

[h1]So the important questions are...[/h1]
[b]Do I regret buying another EA game?[/b]
- Not sure yet. I have been REALLY burned on EA, but I chose to give this one a try anyway. Too early to tell if its another scam. But I am very optimistic about this game!

[b]Is this game in a playable/enjoyable state?[/b]
- Yes and No. Therefor the real answer is no. You can have 10 hours of fun but there just isnt much to do.

[b]Is this game balanced?[/b]
- Absolutely not. The AI is MUCH better than you. Take 30vs30 where your troops are superior (top-tier mercenary) vs their low-tier troops: your troops will still lose. I've run 50+ battles purely against uman terrorists and bandits (weakest troops on the map) vs my top-tier riflemen/snipers/veterans/MG squads. I carefully expand and try to flank and cover, getting my troops on high ground, in forest cover, etc. - but my troops always take higher losses than the enemy.

[b]Is this game polished?[/b]
- Absolutely not. There are critical & trivial things missing or broken. Dozens of them.
- EG: Garrison menu doesnt scroll to the bottom?
- EG: You cant even use the mouse scroll on inventory/squad menus?
- EG: Movespeed is broken. On worldmap with more than 100 men = you cannot move. Even with 30 skill (from cheats) and no inventory. WTF?
- EG: 90% of game items are useless / not implemented yet.
- EG: FPS combat is still quite buggy, troops are fairly retarded other than "see enemy, find cover" (which is good), but then its just a firefight.
- EG: Your own troops dont follow commands well. Give them waypoints? Flip a coin and hope they follow them without spreading out randomly and dying.
- EG: Town management is very simplistic, basically M&B copy for now.
- EG: Theres no depth to the game at all. You have an army, you can conquer towns and garrison troops, and thats it.

[b]So whats good about this game?[/b]
- So far it [i]looks[/i] like it is blending the FPS/RTS/RPG elements very well - but it has basically just copied Mount&Blade. Is that a bad thing? Hell no! M&B is one of the best games of all time! Gimme more!
- FPS combat is good. Bullet drop, weapon range, weapon handling, different equipment uses. Its solid enough but does need improvements.
- World map aspect is good, its literally identical to M&B. However M&B is 10 years old and I expect big ideas and improvements here. Not just a straight copy of a 10 year old game.
- The squad aspect is good, instead of having individual troops like M&B - this is the ONE thing I see some good ideas/improvement on over M&B.
- Equipment system is good, but also its a straight copy of M&B. Needs new ideas and improvements.
- Basically everything good about this game is just copied from M&B... So if you like M&B this will be fun for 10 hours.

[b]And whats bad about this game?[/b]
- Still very buggy. Sometimes troops spawn in the air, and then cant move because they cant find a path to move, so they are just stuck there.
- On a 130 troop town I sieged, all the AI troops spawned in clusters (like 40 troops stacked on top of eachother), and couldnt move. One RPG took out 20-30 troops (that was fun, but not supposed to happen).
- [b]Its a FRIKKIN UNITY GAME! AAAGH![/b] Unity engine is NOT a game engine. It is for uni students to learn how to make games - NOT for professional / production games. It is a flawed engine that is COMPLETELY unoptimized and simply WILL NEVER RUN well. Period. I'm a software engineer and have made 2 games. This is not a debate. I am very very very worried about this game like 100% of every other unity PC games out there that never get completed because this is a fact: when a dev uses unity, its because they lack the skills to create their own engine = they lack the skills to complete a full game. So this game will NEVER be optimized and run well. The more assets they put in, the laggier it will become until its unplayable (LIKE EVERY OTHER UNITY GAME!).
- So far its copying way too much from M&B and I see nothing new about this game. Its very scary to see a new indie dev take unity + copy M&B + put in guns = think they made a real game. Nope. Not even close. Thats not going to cut it.

40011010.review:
I'm currently 6 hours in and have taken my first town, put a few buildings in it and killed endless bandits. The game is in early access so if you're reading this review a few (substanial) updates in the future bare that in mind. The combat is fun but extremely, extremely repetitive. 
>Pick units
>Tell units where to go
>Run around looking for the enemys until the timer counts down and shows you where they are
>Kill them, rinse and repeat

The area to search is often so big that you really do end up searching for the enemys until the timer hits 0:00 and just shows you their location - which disrupts the flow and makes the fights boring. When the combat is strategic and you don't have to search for 5-6 minutes to find someone, the game really is good.

The unit variety is nice for a game at this stage in development however the dialoge between different settlments is very limited. Units pathfinding/collision needs a bit of work as they will often get stuck or just stand still, often near hills or around rocks. 

The weapons and gun sounds really shine through, they've put a lot of effort into the sounds and feels of the weapons in this game along with a lot of customisation which makes you want to keep playing. 

I am looking forward to seeing what the dev's do with this in the future and that's what this game really becomes after the initial excitment has worn off "I wonder what this will become". Unless you really, really want to get in on the action I'd hold off until another 2 or three substantial updates have been released.

It's got better gun control than call of duty, but it's super important to stress that this is still /super/ early access.

Walking can sound like literal gun fire, and it seems  to wildly change depending on what terrain you're walking on.

Speaking of terrain though, it appears to be nearly identical when you're not fighting in a city. Small hills, stumps, plains, small trees and grass everywhere. It'd be nice if the game had a little bit more diversity in regards to this,

40005986.review:
This game is simply unacceptable in its current state.
It's buggy, poorly planned out, and simply dull. Being in Early Access, it's very possible the game may improve, and some issues are to be expected. However, I believe that once you are selling the game, you are obliged to provide a playable product that resembles your pitch. This product is neither playable, nor does it resemble their sales pitch.

I was promised tactical, thoughtful, guerilla warfare. I received a cut-price Mount and Blade with guns. There is some additional strategic gameplay in giving orders to your units, but the staples of guerilla warfare are missing - hit-and-fade attacks aren't possible, and you deploy in a ridiculously small area, so surrounding the enemy is impossible.

As far as the technical gameplay goes, it's even worse. I purchased a scope that doesn't zoom, my gun shudders even when I'm holding still, and my bullets hit well above the crosshairs even at long range. The game claims that the red zone details roughly where your enemies are, and that most combat will occur there. However, several times I have deployed, moved toward the red zone immediately, and been shot from directly behind me before we got anywhere near it, so very clearly it means nothing at all.

Nothing in this game works as it is intended, and I cannot possibly give this a positive rating.

40005752.review: 这游戏想法还行，由于是EA版本，内容缺失可以后期再补，我自己骑砍也玩了不少时间了，ARMA3也玩了一点时间，这游戏目前不好的地方就是过于搬这两个游戏的一些系统，比如ARMA3的单兵武器配置，为什么非要一把长枪一把手枪一个发射器，而且这游戏目前没有载具，RPG打人而且还是在山地或者平原打，实在是觉得大材小用，我个人认为合理的武器配置是1.主要武器(步枪,发射器,机枪）2.冲锋枪(个人自卫武器,不限于冲锋枪) 3.手枪。还有望远镜对于这种游戏模式很有必要，目前版本的瞄准镜太难受，放大倍数小不说了，开镜照搬arma但是也要把视角缩放加进来啊，不然瞄准镜只占屏幕一小点打着是非常难受的，acog倍数有问题(和红点一样的acog那我不如用红点啊).这个游戏目前还有个问题是没把指挥和亲自上去打的平衡做好，如果想自己上去打显然是不能好好指挥部队，指挥部队又不能自己打，手下AI的自主性太低了，应该再加一个自由作战的指挥命令，也就是分散阵形接敌后集中支援的那种。还有一来一把马卡洛夫打个毛啊，手下都有半自动，再差也发把莫辛纳甘或者冲锋枪之类的吧。枪目前版本是真的少，虽然以俄系武器为主，但也希望能多出枪，武器自定义有待加强，第三人称加入最好考虑下(毕竟arma和骑砍都有).大地图太小，虽然虚构但是最好有点指引玩家的路线或者小任务。总是打土匪会腻，总打野战也会腻，ALT自由视角有点需要，还有标记敌人的最好也有吧(考虑加在望远镜内）指挥官索敌距离比ai远100m左右，手下的可以有先机开火之类的。弹道下坠有点夸张了，子弹飞行速度也慢了，和瞄准镜一样向arma弄下最好。目前就想到这么多问题，最大的问题是这游戏需要开放创意工坊，官方的游戏背景太过局限，游戏本身潜力很大。真的最后：Chinese we need, Steam workshop we need, too.

1.时间的动态变化，如昼夜，季节。
2.地形复杂化。
3.加入一些载具，可以是简单的。比如吉普车，全地形车等。
4.战略地图，改成等高线图可能更好点。
5.第三人称。
6.持枪动作可以靠右点。
7.任务多样化，可以加入护卫，押运，暗杀等任务。
8.加入中立NPC城市。
9.步枪附件可以加挂榴弹。

40000488.review:
It plays like everyone else says; Mount and Blade but with guns. (It's also a bit more barebones than M&B in its current state too). 

However, The devs are also extremely active and are releasing patches weekly as well, which is extremely nice to see, especially for EA.

The gunplay and movement feel really smooth as well and there is some degree of micromanagement you get to have regarding trading, cities, squads, and equipment.

The game will keep you busy for a good amount of time(if you are trying to beat it in its current state), as the main objective in the game is to conquer and hold 10 cities. Assuming you are playing without cheats, planning for each siege and winning battles with bandits/other factions to get money for more men & equipment will take a while. There is also currently one side mission implemented into the game (Escort mission).

[u]Issues/bugs that I'm currently running into in the current patch (v0.133) :[/u]

1. Troops that are placed near buildings on spawn have a chance to spawn inside/on top of buildings, which they get stuck in or on

2. Sometimes after loading a game, the city interface will not display when clicking on a city (requires you to close and reopen the game)

3. City numbers don't accurately match the number of troops you're fighting (Less than what is usaully displayed)

[u]Suggestions for the game (Strikethroughs = implemented into game) :[/u]

[strike]- Remove commanding skill limit (Currently capped at 5)[/strike]

- Multiple Save Files

- Weapon & [strike] Armor durability system[/strike] to encourage wide weapon usage and so Armor doesn't last forever (gun jamming could be added in as a gameplay mechanic from this as well)

[strike]- More customiation for squads (individual skills, weapons, etc) for each squad member  [/strike]

- Choose to side with a faction or take over the map yourself 

- Diplomacy options for factions & own faction

- Different starting points

- Vehicles

- Melee weapons/ability to punch

[strike]- Ways to reduce sway when aiming down the sights (upgrade the steady shot stat) [/strike]

- Campaign Mode for each faction (Story & Winning conditions would be different for each Faction)

- Additional places other than cities (Mines, Farms) Which could produce certain goods/provide bonuses to controlling faction

- Co-op/Multiplayer (Confirmed for the future!)

- More penalties for dying 

Other than that, I'm really enjoying the game so far. 

Keep it up, Devs. 

Really excited for the new content, quests, and more things that will be implemented into the game later

9/10 Extremely fun for an early access game.

tl;dr : The game is fun, is somewhat barebones in it's current state as there isn't much to do at the moment. However, the devs are working hard and are updating the game constantly with new content and bug fixes. 

Recommended for people who would enjoy playing Mount and Blade, but with guns.

39996430.review:
Im a fan of mount and blade, so i think this is a great concept with modern weapons.

 The battles felt fair, and the AI will try flanking and different basic maneuvering tactics like using cover (So just because you think you have the high ground doesnt mean your sniper squad is safe from getting attacked from behind!) the loot was on par with battle size, and its a pretty sweet feeling when you win a hard earned battle and get given a new sidearm you have been saving for

you have a few different commands for each squad, as well as a squad hotkey when giving orders on the battle map (nothing overly complicated, and easy to use for tactics) sometimes they get snagged on objects, and you need to cancel and remap there course but its early access and theres going to be little bugs

currently there are a choice of weapons from pistols, 2 revolvers, SMG, 2 Shotguns, Automatic rifles, LMG, RPG and 2 sniper rifles (However the ASVAL should not be counted as a sniper!) i would like to see more weapons and attachments but for now its enough to give you some variety. There is bullet drop so dont expect to grab a pistol and headshot enemies across the map, long shots will take some adjustment and the enemy will keep you busy as they dont sit still for long

the scopes sometimes bug out, and shake causing your shots to miss (but again early access)

There is town upgrades, and small amounts of managment options. 

Id like to get access to other factions troops instead of just mercs, and one squad of FCA

Still a good all around solid game, looking forward to seeing what they add to the game!

39991478.review:
My First 4 Hours in Freeman: Guerilla Warfare. I start off with my FCA Recruits and Volunteers. Then we kill bandits me getting some decent shots with the makarov pistol. Then after the third battle I am in my map and the battle ends. I get the inventory loot. Then I leave the battle and boom Crash. I get frustrated and go back in starting all over. I kill bandits/levelup. Get guys to max level. Then I decide to rush in my FCA Rangers and some low level Mercenary Militia squads against looters (the easiest enemy in the game(I think)) and the Rangers die! I get mad and kill the looters. I then decide to try and build up an army to siege the Bandits town. Meanwhile the Red Boys (Uman Terrorist who we are at war with by default) start to build their armies and chase me as I build mine. I siege the Bandit Town and retreat after killing 20 Bandits and losing nearly my entire army of elite troops. I kill bandits to get money to get more soldiers and attack. (Also be sure to have a good gun with sights before you siege, it helps alot) I come back with my 25 men to their 60 men and I start killing some of them and slowly dwindling their numbers while my numbers also dwindle. But I somehow captured the town and get 15k in money and alot of loot for more money. I build 2 buildings for security and go back to the town you start near to get some cheap soldiers to garrison it. While I am away a group of 55 Red guys (They are annoying) come and siege the town. I get back and I defend it, almost. I die when they had 9 of them left. My Soldiers bring me back to safety and I heal my Mercenary Veterans and go back in. I get my town back and then I save and leave. I

All in all it was a really fun experience and the AI seem to be pretty good except for a few times where they did not like to move. Combat is fun and exciting, charging your men around to destroy bad looters. Attacking towns is fun as their are buildings you can use as cover (I don't believe you can go in them, yet).

For 15$ This is a great game and I hope it gets even better as more updates come out.

Some cons are:
Not many Units. FCA Recruits -> FCA Riflemen -> FCA Grenadiers -> FCA Rangers.
Stupid AI at times where they refuse to move.
and maybe some I forgot to mention.

Bugs:
Only one I've seen if it even is a bug is where you have your map out at the end of a battle and leave you crash. I only did it that once and didn't try it again so I'm not sure.


That's it for my first review. If you made it this far I'm surprised since alot of time people don't read that  much. Ok enough of my terrible reviewing skills.

39991449.review:
To start off, I broke my own personal rule buying this game. I usually do not buy early access titles due to poor experiences in the past. This game is worth it though, granted I have only put an hour or so into it. The concept and gameplay sparked my interest and I had to try it. For a quick summery, it's a mix of the mechanics of the Arma series and the RTS elements of Company of Heroes/ other RTS series. This wouldn't necessarily make it stand out on its own, but the added first person and role-playing elements of trying to keep your band together while taking over or liberating towns is a fresh idea. I'll edit this as I play it more, but as of right now I'm quite enjoying being a war lord and trying to counquer the world.

EDITED
As of when this edit was made, I have about 6 hours in it. Since it is an early access title, it does have some of the standard early access bugs like clunky menues and rough finish so I'm going to skip over that stuff and discuss the more important points.

I must state this game is not for fans of COD or similar FPS's. You will die. A LOT. As for gameplay, it is a fun game if you enjoy RTS games, granted this game is not super forgiving if you're not on top of your troops and lead them into a bad situation since you can't keep making units while in battle, and if you like the Arma/Verdun/Argo FPS style and mechanics.  It does take a bit of getting used to since this mix of RTS and FPS does require you to be proficient at both aspects or either you will die, or you men will die. Battles start with you picking the squads you want to send into battle, these can be changed durring the battle, but it is much better if you can read the situation and enviroment and deploy accordingly. It does take time to get money and equipment for yourself and your soldiers but it doesnt seem forced. A lot of games make you grind for resources and it doesn't feel quite right. In FREEMAN there still is a bit of a grind but it feels natural and not like the devs made it purposefully annoying. I have yet to conquer a town, the garisons are huge, so I cant speak to those aspects at the moment. Once I do I'll update this again.

Still recommend it and am happy I broke my "no early access" rule.

39991047.review:
Review from an FPS player's perspective
I personally haven't played Mount n Blade before, nor do i have any huge experience playing RPG games.

First, there's no any sort of tutorial or instructions, i guess this game is really targeted to Mount n Blade fans
seeing the positive reviews, they already know what to do in game.

Second, for those of you FPS people who are interested in this game. you'll have no idea what's going on, the first minute you start the game. they'll give you a map and now what? some somalian guy meets you and wants to steal your money, but instead you fight. it's your first fight, but the game doesn't tell you what hotkeys to press, or buttons on screen, you're confused. now you found the "call a squad button" but now your squad is dead and you retreated, how do i stop the war? nothing, it continues until you either die or restart the whole game. and the fact that your squad owns a rifle but you the commander only has a pistol is ridiculous.

a summary is, this game is pure alpha with no clear instructions for people who haven't play Mount n' blade or any sort of game similar to RPGs.

Third, the UI looks bad and the sounds are cheap.

The in-game graphics (NOT UI) and FPS controls are 6/10, that's it.

The sounds are horrible ( i have to say horrible because it sound like CS 1.6 sounds can do better)
Devs should put more effort on the sounds because sounds hooks the players attention and also put some clear instructions, like teaching a person without any sort of experience on the game, because you're not only targetting the RPG community but also the FPS community and people who are really new.

I can't say this game has any potential at the moment, this game is extremely at its very early alpha version.

39990039.review:
Freeman: Guerilla Warfare bietet eigentlich ein interessantes Konzept vor allem, da ich großer Fan der Mount&Blade Reihe bin, der Trailer war natürlich auch sehr ansprechend gestaltet; Taktisch mit seinem Trupp vorstoßen, Befehle erteilen, aus der Deckung agieren, eben kein 0815-Bloodyscreengeballer.

Leider wird man dann doch realtiv schnell auf den boden der Tatsachen zurückgeholt.
während mein Trupp gut ausgerüstet startet mit Sturmgewehren etc. Wurde ich mit einer Pistole an die Front geschickt. Die Munition war nach einer Minute verbraucht und den Rest des Gefechts habe ich meine Nase ins Gras drücken müssen, während ich meinen Truppen über das Kartenmenü manövriert habe. 
Man fühlt sich einfach wie der letzte Depp, nicht wie ein fähiger Kommandeur.
Die meiste zeit ist man also auf Besorgungstour, gefallene Soldaten ersetzen, 9 mm Magazine kaufen, dabei ab und zu von einer Übermacht an Banditen überfallen werden,  bis man genug dollar zusammenkratzen kann um sich eine überteuerte, aber brauchbare Waffe zu leisten.

Ich weiß, dass der Sinn eines solchen Spiels ist vom Underdog zum Kriegsherrn zu mutieren, aber hier fühlt es sich einfach zu nervig, langwierig und öde an. 
Keinerlei Story, Charakter oder sonstiges. (Soll angeblich später kommen)


Bevor die Entwickler sich allerdings daran machen können gibt es zahllose Bugs und Soundprobleme (Laufgeräusche auf Wiese klingen wie Schritte auf Beton in einer Lagerhalle, Ohren bluten nach fünf Minuten dank zu lauten Sounds und Übersteuerung) zu fixen.
gelegentlich stürzt das Spiel auch einfach ab. Es gibt kaum Grafikeinstellungen, alles in allem wirkt es einfach -wie so vieles im Early Access- unfertig.

Ich bin gespannt, ob noch Verbesserung eintritt. bis dahin kann ich dieses Spiel echt keinem empfehlen.

39986328.review:
TLDR: Currently lacking alot, but has alot of promice and what it does have works great in general

The game starts you out with only a pistol, while even the lowest level basic npc troop starts out with rifles. You also start out with 10 riflemen, and if you defend properly you can usualy kill 15-20 without loosing a full unit and then just heal back up. There arn't many armies running around with that low troop counts but there are atleast a few if you look. An alternate way to earn some starting cash is to run between the towns trading (i would recomend this, much faster cash income early game).
Then after you figure out your best way to earn cash, you gear up, kill people to lvl up so you can command more troops and eventually attack and take over towns. Currently there are no quests or objectives other than "hold 10 towns and kill everyone". Even after taking every town from a faction, killing all his troops (or atleast i'm assuming they were all dead, overview put is army strength at 0) randomly that faction just spawns in 30+ armys with a total strength of 300k+. Luckaly if your town has atleast 50+ people in it, it will never get attacked but still it seems odd that a whiped out faction just spawns in massive amounts of troops randomly.
The combat is really fun, you need to make an actual stratigy and tell your troops to go to good spots, or they will just eat bullets and die quick. Once more gets added into the game this will be a great game, however for now there isnt much to do and after a few hours it seems like its too easy and you cant loose any fight (deploying 6 units, max army pop of 60 is when i found to be unkillable and every fight trivial)

39986019.review:
TL;DR Slavic Mount & Blade with AKs and lots of balaclavas, looks and sounds like AIDS but plays great. Is good game.

GAMEPLAY
Essentially boils down to if Mount & Blade had modern combat and the gunplay was something like STALKER (not too realistic but definitely not extremely arcadey). Guns can be a bit wonky at times and sometimes feel like something that was bought off of the Unity store but its already doing better than most workshop games. I'm assuming it's planned to be implemented but other bands of enemies can't gang up on you and assrape you like in Mount & Blade. AI is surprisingly smart for an early access game. They seem to actually react to gunfire by either running to cover or going prone. Your own AI, when not told to move, will move to rocks and trees and try and cover themselves. In town raids the AI is a lot more broken, not to mention you walk straight through doors and can't shoot through glass in towns, it's really easy for the player to just make a shooting gallery of them. There's also no quests yet but they plan to add that because there are buttons in game that currently don't do anything. Also, I'm pretty sure your war party doesn't eat food because I have yet to see any food get depleted.

GRAPHICS
This game looks better than Mount & Blade but is far from pretty. The terrain outside of towns looks like someone ate three different textures and puked them on the ground. The flora and rocks are a bit wonky in the mesh collider/hit detection department so just be careful when shooting from cover. The towns however look great, they really give off the vibe of an eastern European village. The UI is very basic, it gets the job done just fine but isn't very appealing.

SOUND
The sounds in this game are kinda shit to be honest, a lot of them sound like any old sound effect taken from an asset store. The voice acting essentially comes down to 4 voice lines that get repeated very often and get annoying after a while. Shell casings don't seem to scale with the other sounds on the sound slider so if you turn the game down via in the in-game options the shell casings will be louder than gunfire. Then again, I didn't expect much more from an early access game.

写下自己玩到目前的感受.目前到14级
1.枪械瞄具缺陷很大,尤其是ACOG装到部分枪上居然还会挡视线,比如AR41..

总体来说游戏潜力蛮大,但是现在还连个半成品都算不上只能算一个加了瞄具的骑砍MOD..因此暂时不推荐购买

You'll learn what tactics you enjoy and how to employ them better whether your sneaky or forceful, risky or defensive. How much time do you spend running? 39973902.review:
[h1]Early Access Review[/h1]

This game is a mix of Mount and Blade and Operation Flashpoint and for me also gives me a Jagged Alliance vibe, its like p

The game lacks content, being able to recruit faction troops and not the "default" volunteer/mercenary troops, more weapons, quests, more cities or camps, more map varieties, weather, companions and veichles (this last one isn't a "must" but it would be nice).

One of the aspects that bothered me the most is despite all the faction being in war with one another, but in the world map you don't see any fights, enemy armies just stay put near their borders and thats it, they don't even chase bandits.

The game at this point is entertaining but you will get bored after a couple of ours since there isn't any deepth in this game, besides conquering every city by shooting everyone.

The battle phase is the most important aspect of this game and at this time the game deliveries it well but could be improved, adding quick command orders is a must, otherwise everytime you want to issue an order to one your your squads you take cover open the map and give the order. This aspect "slows down" and takes away the rush of being in a shooting.

You will find some bugs, the one that stands out more is when defending a owned citie where your garrisson troops won't join the fight but still count to the squad cap. So you will have to fend off a group of 30-50 enemy combatants just with your gun and a couple of troops. ( It's a major bug yes, but you will have some fun defending a town just with a couple of guys).

Despite all the bugs you will find (the dev team, is working on fixing those bugs) and the lack of content you should buy the game at this point.

39973146.review:
SI je fevais résume ce jeu,je dirais que Mout & Blade a fusionné avec Arma ou simplement que c'est un M&B modern.

Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare vous donne le contrôle de votre commandant qui dois former et diriger ses hommes dans des combats en FPS avec un système RTS pour dirigez vos squads sur le terrain.
Vous allez devoir les faire monter en niveau,acheter des meilleurs arme et équipement pour votre personnage qui doit aussi monter en niveau.
Une fois que vous avez pas mal de soldat bien entraîné et que votre équipement est correcte,vous allez devoir attaquez des villes et villages pour les prendre sous votre contrôle.
MAIS,je jeu vient de sortir,et donc il y a peu de possibilité comparé a ce que M&B nous a proposé.
Il y'a pas mal de bugs encore non corrigé,les animations de armes sont mauvaise est les IA plutôt conne.

Mais pas contre,les devs sont extrement actif dessus et sotre un patch tous les 2 jours et une nouvelle version qui ajoute du contenue +- tous les 3 jours.
J'ai vraiment confiance en ce jeu,et je suis sur qu'il va devenir culte d'ici 1 voir 2 ans,un peu comme The Forest.

SI vous avez 15 euros a mettre,je vous le conseil a 100% mais en son état actuel,je vous conseil d'attendre un peu.

39971371.review:
- Modern slav-combat clone of  M&B.  No more RTS than Hidden and Dangerous. 
- Press "End" for cheat menu. (It's alpha so who cares, go test the hell out of it!)

You have your map screen with all the towns and such populated by factions and bandits, just like M&B.  You start off hostile to the bandits and one faction, but the rest have towns you can visit to recruit, trade or attack, until you own them or forge an alliance yadda yadda yadda.

Basic functions are there to gather squads, barter and fight with stat points similar to M&B (cap the amount of squads, inventory space, discounts etc. etc.).   

I admit I have yet to try talking to any armies to get quests or faction points, but the system is there to make allies and enemies. 

Pretty fun so far!  Combat is interesting, but mainly involves maneuvering your guys so that you aren't caught with your pants down when the wandering enemy squads cross your line of sight.  There is some pretty basic strategy involved, such as utilizing high-ground for your sniper/mg teams while your assault teams hang just below a berm to get those close shots.  Gun sounds at a distance definitely need work, because as of now they just sound like a crappy tiny speaker.  The guns are pretty visceral to fire, comparable to Squad.  


I definitely recommend this to any M&B/FPS fan, as I can imagine it will develop into something very entertaining.

39968509.review:
I have been in this region for ten days, tasked with the job of ridding the interior marshlands of brigands. The ARF seem to be fairly receptive to my presence, as well as the FCA. The Pozna Battalion may prove to be a threat in the coming weeks, but for now we hunt the bandits. Our numbers have swelled from a mere dozen to fifty fighters, many veterans of previous conflicts, the others among them hardened by the endless skirmishes in this place. My Makarov was long ago sold to a merchant for food, but in its place, a modern American pistol, and my trusty RPK. Our outfit recently pitched in, and purchased an RPG launcher. Soon, we will be ready to launch our campaign to take up perminent residence in this fractured country. Then, the real conquest begins.

Update: 2/24

If we ever had a foothold in that god forsaken swamp, it was brief. One sound defeat, those overwhelming numbers in Berezno, and it was all for nothing. But we started anew. With a new campaign, this torrent, this continuous rainfall; in a steaming hundred degree hell we patrol, and head off the relentless attacks from the Uman Brotherhood and the Bandit consoritium. But there is hope. Gorinka, our home is thriving. A rose in the rubble. Police, and grocers, crops swaying in the cruel heat, left hydrated by the constant summer rains. But those rogues outside our walls have grown wiser, angrier, deadlier. Just days ago, two groups of brigands converged outside our gates, and proceeded to attack. Nearly 50 men, dead to the man. But we prosper, the cost may not be just, or right, but it is what it is.

39966092.review:
Bueno realmente tengo ni 2 horas al juego pero voy a comentar mi experiencia y cómo veo todo desde la perspectiva de un chaval que fue un pedazo viciado al Mount & Blade.

Empecemos, 3 facciones te da el juego como posibles aliados a los que unirte o pelear y otras 2 facciones contra las que siempre estás hostil (una es bandidos mítica en estos juegos, la otra no se muy bien el por qué). En  cuanto a las ciudades bueno tenemos la parte más superficial (DE MOMENTO A DÍA DE HOY) que es básicamente mercado (muy guapo), reclutmiento (súper innovado) y hospital (para curarte las heridas), y obviamente también puedes atacar las ciudades (debo decir que aún no se si una vez capturadas las ciudades o pueblos puedes pasearte por ellas como hacías en los castillos del Mount).

Pasemos al gameplay y aquí es maravilloso, admitamoslo todos odiabamos que nuestras tropas en el mount fueran tan robóticas y con movimientos tan simples (el juego tiene sus años y es obvio que fuera así), pues bueno bienvenido a la nueva p u t a generación porque ahora tienes tu modo campo de batalla como un soldado más y el modo mapa táctico donde como un comandante en campo vas a liderar a tus tropas y decirlos donde ir y cómo ir.

Pasmos a tu banda, todos sabemos que el mount empezabas con tus 4 matados y los mejorabas hasta que llegaban a ser esos preciosos caballeros swadianos que reventaban, aquí en este juego simplemente coje eso y mejóralo por 1000 porque si ya en la 0.1 puedes mejorar las escuadras de distintas maneras y puedes cambiarles incluso el equipamento a medida consiguen veteranía voy a flipar cuando este juego sea 1.0.

Luego último punto a destacar el juego a día de hoy tiene 0 historia, simplemente moverse, comprar, atacar, asaltar, armar, reclutar e invadir, que no es poco la verdad, pero lo que mola de estos juegos es eso LA HISTORIA, y no les recrimino, obvio van a desarrollarlo mucho y tendrá de todo en la versión final, pero actualmente si pides misión o tareas te van a decir los personajes siempre que quieres o que necesitas y el juego solo te simplemente la opción de irte y ya está, sólo vas a interactuar de momento con personajes para atacarlos.

En fin, por 15€ recomiendo el juego, conociendo todos la industria es un precio miseria para lo que tiene de potencial el juego, a demás merece la pena apoyar siempre estos proyectos. Lo recomiendo en un 9/10 porque el 10/10 se lo daré cuando esté la historia implementada.

39962804.review:
As I finished my second hour of playing Freeman Guerilla Warfare I have high hopes for the game itself and the future of its development. 

Freeman: Guerilla Warfare at its current stage of development is a game that takes a moderate level of military realism, and combines it successfully with the army and town management of the Mount & Blade games. Currently, F:GW has a surprisingly impressive arsenal available to the player, though some in need of work in areas such as animation, the over all quality of the game's firearms is impressive for an early alpha game such as this.

I often felt surprised by how I would engage the enemy combatants at first seeing mindless hordes until the tactical side of their AI took over. While the AI itself isn't massive in scale, I would often find enemy's out flanking my spear heads or assailing me from all directions, taking a charge at me if they felt that my men weren't up to the challenge of defeating them.

Currently as it stands, there isn't much to do but that is to be expected and is actually very acceptable. The game is very wide, and with each passing day gets deeper and deeper as the men and women at KK Game Studio continously update this game day in and day out. I watched gameplay from release and all ready there are new features in the game that I was not aware of, such as guns now being lootable from the enemy which originally wasn't implimented or as widely available.

As the game moves forward, I'd hope to see it incorporate much more militarism and potentially the political alliances that are tied to such a warzone. The potential to make alliances, friends, companions, outfit your army with armored vehicles (More so APCS and less tanks, as I feel tanks would perhaps be a little too chaotic on such small maps), and develop a story for your faction.

At its current price, I do recommend F:GW, the game is excellent for its state of development and I see such a purchase as a way to support the development team further. I would hate for this game to collapse under its own ambition and be left to rot in the cesspool of forgotten gems, lets not make Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare a forgotten gem, but support it in its excellency.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Review Scores: - Please take these scores as a resource for feedback and not an actual rating of the game and its quality, all of these are subject to extreme levels of change and are only hereby relevant to version 0.110

Gameplay: 7.5/10 - Will most likely increase with development, weapons need some fine tuning, perhaps some mechanical annimations. Explosions are a bit bland at the moment but those faults can all be rectified and even if they remain it barely impacts the over all feel and enjoyment of the game itself

Game World: 6/10 - The weakest part about F:GW in its amazing state of alpha release is the world is too bland and empty. You can only explore towns you are besieging and the enemy factions have no leader for you to hate or feel a friendship towards. Your player character is nameless and faceless, a possible character creation system would help benefit the world as well as implimenting the ability to enter settlements to access the markets/recruit squads/and visit the hospital. The world itself also feels very small and I hope that perhaps in the future it will be up scaled to prove an even greater challenge with more factions, more towns, and even more battles to be faught. 

Variety: 6.5/10 - F:GW has a moderate level of variety not to be scoffed at. It has a varried list of weaponry that you may arm yourself to take on your enemies and do so with delectable cunning and efficiency. Wether the amount of items stays the same, the game would benefit greatly from more weapons and in the worst case more equipment variation. 

Sound: 6.5/10 - The sounds of bullets rushing over your head, the impacts of rounds on the opposite side of your cover, the explosion of RPG's impacting around your men. All of these excell in driving player experience to the brink of wonder, however while F:GW does these features well it is not rude to say it could use a bit more work. The Sounds are fine currently as place holders, but could use with some drastic improvement. Perhaps in the future, should profits be acceptable, KK Game Studio's should look into outsourcing or hiring a Audio Technician to touch up some of the game sounds as currently distant fire simply sounds like the volume of the effect was turned down, and all the weapons unfortunately sound the same at distances.

Overall Ranking as of Version 0.110: 6.8/10 - F:GW is a great game, a 6.8/68 shouldn't be scoffed at and is indeed a positive review for such an early product. I will continue to put many hours into the game itself and will update this review as such when significant improvments are made. If you wish to support the game and its development, its current asking price is not, In my own personal consumer opinion too much to ask for. I look forward to continued updates for KK Game Studio and hope any would be buyers enjoy their time as I have with F:GW.

I haven't played that much, because I want to wait until the game is more fleshed out. But what I have seen is promising.

Gameplay's solid both on the campaign map as in combat. Same goes for the graphics. The gun's pack "oompf" and they sound very convincing, albeit a bit too loud. The AI does it's job okay-ish for now. The UI is decent. Customizeable factions & modding support would go a far way in helping this game grow in the long run. Diplomacy too!

In it's current state the game is certainly worth $10-$15. That's one trip to the movies, by yourself. And this game offers a lot of replayability.

Buying into Early Access games is a very risky business. But the people at KK Game Studios are pumping out patches and content in a steady stream. I'm confident that they'll succeed :)

[h1] Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare : ยิงกลยุทธ์ + First Person Shooting + Sandbox  บริหารเมือง ที่มีกลิ่นอาย RPG มาเต็มๆ"[/h1]
เท่าที่ผมเล่นมา 22 ชั่วโมง พอจะบอกคราวๆได้ดังนี้ครับ 

[h1]ยิงกลยุทธ์ [/h1] ปืนกระสุนตก เวลาบวกต้องเข้า cover แล้วโน้มตัวซ้ายขวายิงเอา  AI สะกิดสองสามนัด นอนนับดาว : FGWเป็นเกมแบบนั้น 

[h1]มีปืนหลายแบบ[/h1] Pistol Shotgun SMG Rifle Sniper HMG แต่ปืนแต่ละหมวด ยังมีไม่มากเท่าไร น่าจะอัฟเดทในอนาคต 

[h1]มีระบบแต่งปิืน[/h1] ใส่ Red dot ที่เก็บเสียง กล้องแบบต่างๆได้ :  พึ่งอัฟเดทมาไม่นาน มี bug อยู่บ้าง

[h1]มีระบบ Level : UpSkill[/h1] กลิ่นอาย RPG ตัวอย่างเช่น เพิ่ม HP สูงสุด เพิ่มความแรงปืน ลดรีคอยปืน lootของได้เยอะขึ้น เพิ่มช่องกระเป๋า 

[h1]มีระบบ UPGRADEหน่วยรบ(ลูกน้อง)[/h1]เอาไปรบบ่อยๆ พอได้เวล เลือกอัฟได้ :จากทหารรับจ้างอัฟเป็น สไนสเปอร์ พลปืนกล หน่วยรบพิเศษ

[h1]สามารถสั่งการลูกน้องได้[/h1] ใน mapกลยุทธ์ เช่น ให้เข้าป่าทำแนวยิง ให้ตามคุ้มกันเรา รึยิงคุ้มกันอยู่กับที ทำได้ดีทีเดียว ง่ายสะดวก และสนุก 

[h1]มีระบบตีเมือง ยืดเมือง มาเป็นของตัวเอง[/h1] สร้างเมืองได้ มีสิทธิ์โดนบุกคืนได้ด้วย (=A=')\


[h1]ข้อดี[/h1]
มีระบบหลากหลาย ยึดเมือง lootของ ขายของ ซื้อปืน แต่งปืน มากมาย เป็นเกม Sandbox ดีๆนี้เอง 
Gun Play ทำได้ดีและสนุก

[h1]ข้อเสีย[/h1]
Bug เยอะอยู่ ต้อง Update อีกมากกกกกกกกกกกมาย 
AI ragdoll บ่อย
