ทีมงานก็ขยันอัฟอยู่เหมือนกันครับ แต่ต้องดูยาวๆ ว่าจะขยันอัฟขนาดไหน? [/b]

[h1]สุดท้ายก็แล้วแต่ ผู้เล่นล่ะครับ ว่าชอบรึไม่ชอบ สนุกรึไม่สนุกเพราะแต่ละคน ชอบไม่เหมือนกันอยู่แล้ว [/h1]

39957296.review:
Je recommande en l'état pour ceux espérant financer ce jeu prometteur proche d'un mount and blade version époque contemporaine. Maintenant il faut espérer que les dévellopeurs n'abandonnent pas en cours de route ou ne répondent pas à nos attentes/espérances.
Vous aurez déjà une dizaine d'heures suivant votre patience face à la répétitivité actuelle (tout jeu est plus ou moins répétitif suivant la personne mais parfois un jeu est ressenti majoritairement par les individus comme répétitif et là c'est clairement le cas) et à la difficulté. Mount and Blade est extrêmement moins répétitif mais on est dans une alpha, donc on accepte pour le moment.
-Les graphismes sont largement potable pour ce type de jeu (à mes yeux qui ont 10/10 aux tests de vue lel). Les armes étant plutôt jolie même.
-On a une carte à la mount and blade, bien moins grande, bien moins variés dans ses paysages. 
Quand un combat démarre, cela ne prend pas vraiment en compte le paysage du lieu, et les décors de ces combats stratégique et fps (à la mount and blade donc) sont très ressemblant, beaucoup trop. Toujours la même herbe, les mêmes cailloux, les mêmes petits bois. Ainsi il y a une lassitude visuelle.
-Pour une alpha, je trouve qu'il y a pas mal d'armes même si on en a vite fait le tour. La personnalisation est très minime, quelques viseurs pour l'arme principale, bientôt des silencieux semble t il. On a divers pistolets et révolvers, pas personnalisable. On a un lance roquette (rpg). On fini aussi par ressentir une lassitude des armes utilisés.
-Peu de choix pour le moment en terme de vêtement/armure, mais varié dans ce que l'on peut porter, il y a des gants, des protèges genoux, un casque, un gilet par balle, un haut, un pantalon, des lunettes de protection.
-L'IA se met assez à couvert, l'ennemi sera parfois de tout côtés ce qui rendra les combats très difficile. Les tireurs d'élite font très mal surtout à vos troupes qui seront décimés. 
-Pas énormément d'ordre mais cela me parait suffisant.
-La gestion des villes capturés sont très peu intéressantes. On construit quelques bâtiments mais qui ne change pas l'aspect de la ville, et à part gagner un peu plus d'argent cela ne change rien du tout.
-On ne peut pas personnaliser ses troupes, seulement le chef d'armée que vous incarnez. On recrute des troupes qui peuvent gagner de l'expérience et être upgradé jusqu'a un certain niveau.
-La défense d'une ville peut être excessivement trop dur. L'ennemi doit prendre le contrôle d'une zone, plus il y a de troupes qui y sont, plus la barre de contrôle monte vite. Vos troupes même les meilleurs se font massacrer assez facilement vu que vous êtes facilement submergé suivant la zone d'apparition d'ennemis. Dommage de ne pas avoir de possibilité de créer des défenses qui se verraient lors d'une attaque.
-On est très limité pour faire apparaître des troupes (même en ayant le niveau max dans la catégorie en lien), tandis que l'IA peut en avoir plus, donc vous serez très souvent submergé.
-Un côté rpg sympathique, 3 grandes branches (constitution, dextérité, intelligence) et un bon nombre de petites branches.
-On avance extrêmement lentement sur la carte de campagne, elle dépend d'un trait qu'il faudra donc monter (impossibilité d'accélérer le temps), de ce que vous portez sur vous et du nombre de troupes sous vos ordres (l'IA n'est pas affecté par ces malus...)
-Plusieurs factions, mais pas énormément, très peu de différences visuelles en plus.
-Les factions ennemis ne se font pas la guerre, aucun combat entre l'IA pour le moment donc. La diplomatie est au strict minimum dépend de votre réputation (je me rappelle plus des chiffres exact mais en gros 50 on est copain, 0 on est neutre, -50 on est ennemi). L'IA en guerre contre vous viendra par contre attaquer vos villes qui seront très difficile à défendre.
-L'IA ne donne pour le moment aucun mission. Votre seule mission, c'est de massacrer tout le monde.
-Pour gagner du pognon sans faire la guerre, on peut trouver dans les villes des objets désirés par la ville et donc les lui revendre.
-Peu de bug. Aucun crash perso. Optimisation correct.
-Musique correct. Effects sonores très sympathique.

39948720.review:
10 HOURS PLAYED :

Yes, this game draws a lot of its features from Mount and Blade. Maybe a little too much. I'm a big fan of M&B (400h+ played) and been around the game since the beggining. As much as this game is heavily inspired by M&B mechanics crossed with tactical FPS like Arma, it has the potential to get really really good. It's still on Alpha, but the 10 hours I spent playing it were really great. 

The +
- The difficulty in combats is much higher than it is in M&B. You can be anihilated if you don't use proper tactis (unless you heavily outnumber your opponents) and if you rush like a morron you'll get killed.
- Even if the orders are still very basics for now, the waypoints allow you to make complex mooves if you use it well.
- Even if the graphics and sounds aren't that good, you get a good immersion into the heat of the battlefield, specially when you try on taking cities. 
- Cities managment is archaic but promissing as you can build several buildings and stuff.
- The troop managment is also cool, as you have a moral component, troop trees, wages, etc...


The -
- the UI is what makes you feel this game is still in early Alpha. It's not really pleasant and fluid navigating in between menus. But it's okay for an alpha.
- The RPG side is a bit less developped than the tactical/fps ones. You can develop basic skills, but can not really get involved into diplomacy which is sad regarding the "eastern Europe guerilla" style setting.
- There are a few AI inconsistencies, making your mens as well as your enemies to act weirdly.
- It's a bit repetitive for now as all you do is taking on looters to recruit and train your mens and get some gear and then you take on cities to expand you territory. There's no real other micro objectives like quest or sutff. 

WHAT I'D LIKE TO SEE IN THE FUTURE : 

- It really needs to add a companion system like in M&B, with their specialities and backstories.
- A minor crafting system, to maybe create inbattle stuff like sandbags or whatever to fortify positions in some battlefields, being able to recycle some junk found on enemies, etc...
- More units and kind of enemies of course,  but i'm sure it's already on the way.
- As I said, some micro objectives like quests (manhunting style)

Great game for an Alpha though, very promissing.

39945284.review:
So at the time of writing I've put almost 9 hours into the game. Here are my thoughts, for those who are curious:

[b] TLDR: One of the best and brightest examples of a hybrid-genre, early access game to date. Although it has flaws, you'll still have fun. [/b]

At its core, as I'm sure 90% of the reviews state, it is the love child of Arma and Mount & Blade. It does both overlord real-time strategy and FPS combat surprsingly well given that it is a small indie team, and its EA was just released a week ago.

[h1] Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Good balance of FPS and tactical strategy
[*]High replayability, since groups and actions are randomized
[*]Already dozens of hours of gameplay from domination mode alone
[*]Functional trading, recruiting and rewarding town ownership
[*]Very decent skill and perk tree after leveling up in combat
[*]Stomping out the Uman Brotherhood because wow they make me angry
[/list]

[h1] Neutral:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Graphics are not bad. Nothing to write home about either. Environments are sharp but character models, not so much
[*]Very limited selection of soldiers to include in your party (about 7ish or so)
[*]Same with weapons. A good variety, but could be more
[/list]

[h1] Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Enemies can usually see you, although you can't see them. Unfortunately this is not a two-way street (they can see through trees, bushes, solid ground)
[*]Lower level enemies can still wipe out a veteran squad of mercs with relative ease in some cases (i.e. need to add higher level friendlies)
[*]With only one gamemode, if you have a short attention span it will get old. Don't fret, the devs are working very hard
[/list]

All in all a very positive experience imo. Shows what EA titles can be when passion is put into them.

39944310.review:
[h1]TL;DR at Bottom[/h1]
[b]Let me know what you thought of this review in the comments below![/b]

[h1]Verdict :[/h1]
[b][i]Exemplary combat hampered by just about everything else; Purchase only on a heavy sale[/i][/b]

[h1]All Too Familiar[/h1]

I count Mount and Blade among my favorite series of all time, and one which I will both never forget and never stop playing. Many a time I wondered what this would be like if it took place in the modern day instead of the medieval era, and after playing Freeman: Guerilla Warfare I have a pretty good idea. If I told you FGW was a similar game to Mount and Blade I’d be lying, it’s the exact same game just with a different setting and some extremely minor gameplay tweaks. The character stats screen is the exact same, the town system is the same, if not worse, and even the overland max is pixel for pixel a mimicry of Mount and Blade. The only thing I can say that’s even remotely different is the pre-battle screen where you can send out orders to your squads, other than that? Nothing. I suppose the fact that the men under your command are in squads, as opposed to just being individuals of a certain class, is unique, but it’s not in a particularly good way. See, FGW has a system of morale for your squads. If it gets too low, they run away at the first signs of combat, and even if they don’t they’ll face significant penalties to effectiveness. This is absurd. Mount and Blade did see you worry about morale, but it wasn’t nearly as bad because it actually went up by a significant amount if you won battles or increased certain skills. In FGW, the only real way for you to increase squad morale is to give them a pay reward of a couple hundred dollars, and though you can get morale from winning battles it’s such an insignificant amount that it doesn’t matter. In FGW you’re already going to be tight on money, so having the only way to really increase morale be through pay makes for yet another drain on your already almost exhausted resources. That’s not the only drain however, you also have to deal with absurd troop wages and weapon costs. You start out with a squad of volunteers and a squad of militiamen, with the latter being significantly better than the former in just about every way. If you want to upgrade or pick up some better squads, you have to be prepared to pay out the wazoo for the privilege. This makes it incredibly hard to actually upgrade the men who fight alongside you. I hate this, because the AI is great and I’d love to make better use of it with stronger teammates. However even if I could afford their initial cost, better squads are simply not viable for the long-term. On top of increased wages, you also have to pay respawn costs for every single man that dies in the squad, each costing hundreds to replace. It’s just frustrating feeling like your resources are constantly being drained while your enemies only grow stronger.

[h1]Too Poor to Prosper[/h1]

When you start the game, you’re given a pathetic loadout of just a single 9mm handgun and some fragmentation grenades, while the squads beside you carry full assault rifles and submachine guns. So you’re forced to almost wholly rely on your squadmates to do all the work for you, having to sit in hidden cover so that you make it out alive. Like Mount and Blade, FGW ends the battle if your commander dies, which is quite possibly the dumbest mechanic in the whole damn game. If you die and choose to send your men in without, never expect to win. Even though you may have crack troops and top-tier weapons, you’ll still lose 9/10 times. It seems the AI has swung the entirely opposite direction on the pendulum. Whereas the in-battle AI listens to your commands and tactically operates, they seem to turn into lobotomites when you’re not there, losing battles where the enemy is both outgunned and outnumbered. If you do manage to lose all your men, you may as well just start a new game instead of trying to work your way back to where you previously were. What was perfect about Mount and Blade is that no matter where you were, you could always find a town nearby to recruit ambitious peasants to fight and die at your side. This meant that regardless of how bad you messed up you always had a way to replenish your army and head out to win back the day. In FGW, even the most basic of volunteer squads with the most inadequate stats and dirt-poor gear costs way more than it should, meaning if you make a mistake it’s almost impossible to recover. The root of all my problems comes back to that one point: you never have enough money to actually get to the fun parts of the game. In a game like Mount and Blade, you can just do quests for different lords, compete in a tournament, become a merchant, or even rob small towns if you had enough men. In FGW you can’t do nearly as much. You can either loot the armies which you’ve conquered for some money and random plunder, or run dry and starve. That’s about it. There are quests in the game, but I went to dozens of different armies and every single one told me that they had no work available for me. I went around and checked the towns and, you may have guessed it, they were devoid of any sort of paying work as well. So I don’t know if there actually are quests for you to do or not, because the only ones I ever had in my quest log were the few that you start off with. Things like annihilate another faction or control 10 towns, things you simply can’t do without more resources.

[h1]Missed the Mark[/h1]

If it sounds like I’ve got a serious bone to pick with this game, well that’s because I do. While I’ve compared the game itself to Mount and Blade, the combat in particular is closer to that of ARMA. It’s incredibly tense and equally tactical, making for some memorable engagements that felt borderline real. Every gun you pick up has the most satisfying kick and feels like you’re out on the range instead of playing a video game. I was overjoyed when I fired even the most basic handgun, and don’t even get me started on my feelings once I finally acquired an assault rifle. Not only is the act of firing the guns themselves satisfying, but commanding your men in the midst of battle, while being extremely basic, makes you feel like a badass squad leader. Some of the sounds need a bit of work, but the gunplay itself is impeccable and the aspect of command is something I would love to see improved upon. Sadly though, there’s a catch. You can never get the most satisfying weapons like the AK-47 or the M4 because you’ve spent all your money trying to keep the various squads under your employ from deserting. You can’t afford to buy better squads to make even more money because you’re too busy trying to scrounge up the weekly pay for your squad. Which sucks not only because it’s annoying and discouraging for the player to deal with, it also makes it borderline impossible to get to the actually fun part of the game: the combat. I could go on for hours and hours, spewing page after page of praise for the combat in this game, but there wouldn’t be a point. It doesn’t matter if the later parts of your game are perfect if you can’t ever get there in the first place because the early parts of the game are too frustrating and grindy. It’s not fun, and it shows the game not only holds no respect for your time, but holds just as little respect for your money. Sad as it is, the one or two redeeming aspects of Freeman: Guerilla Warfare are gated by so many absolutely infuriating trivialities that it’s just not worth your time.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Trivial core mechanics constantly hamstring the only good part of Freeman: Guerilla Warfare, the combat, and keep it from truly shining.

[h1]If you found this review helpful or entertaining then feel free to leave a comment and join my Steam Curator Group at  [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9577715-Mudkips-Gaming/]Mudkips Gaming![/url]
39944310.developer_response: Hello, thanks for the honest review! We agree that the core system is imbalanced and too hard to progress and we are very aware of that issue. We are on our way to balance it out with our community while we are on Early Access. And we will step-by-step add more features and content. So the player will have multiple ways of making money, for example, doing some missions. Most importantly we will focus on the difference and bring our customers real value. Your review is very constructive and instructed us on how to improve the product.

39944152.review:
Ok, over 8 hours in and gonna give my 2 cent, for what its worth. 

This is a LOT like M&B; like I read before I bought it. That's great! I love M&B. Toss in guns and babam! great game, right? Well... yes...someday.

Just not today... 

While I was fully engrossed when I fired this one up, I quickly felt it get stale beneath my gaze. I wanted to like this... I really did. It just lost its fun factor way too quick. At first; stalking through the tree line was visceral and the bullets flying past you exhilirating. I realized after the first few maps these battles would take a bit to unfold and sure enough, 20+ units a side and it takes forever to track down all the rest of those pesky terrorists. 60+ per side seemed to bog my system down to near submission. I'll check back in a few months.

Long story short. I dont feel I got my moneys worth at this point, hopefully I get a return on this investment one day. I'm thumbs upping the potential but you should probably wait for a sale if you want to see this in its current state

39943278.review:
This will be temporarily negative, hopefully, but for now I can't say this is a very fun game. I've had a good amount of pet peeves of mine presented to me in this game in such a short amount of time, it's bizzare.

 - Sound design/music gets annoying quick
 - Mouse sensitivity turns into a snail's pace upon aiming down the sights with ANY weapon, making shooting unfun, unless you're the type that never uses ADS
 - Input and mouse lag, even on lowest settings on a high-end rig
 - A moronic "realism" feature where your camera does not stop moving when your mouse does, effectively "slingshotting" your camera around to try to simulate head movement
 - Combat is the epitome of "Get shot from every direction not knowing where from"
 - Battles can drag on for a very long time, just looking for enemies that have retreated and are hiding around the large combat map
 - The strategy portion of combat is more of a chore than a tool to help you win fights; your soldiers will literally sit there and do nothing unless you actively tell (each individual squad) what step to take next, meaning they become useless if you're in an extended firefight that requires your full attention
 - Grenades slide against dirt and rock like ice

Minor problems -

 - No 'hit markers' or easily visible kill messages letting you know if a shot connects, or if a kill was yours, just light green tiny text on the far right that lists out every single kill, just replacing one of your potential soldier unit names with "You"
 - No world map overview
 - Money from enemies cannot be looted
 - Once a reloading animation finishes, it takes a second or two for the game to actually refill your magazine, leaving you unable to shoot for a time where it seems like you could
 - Hospital bill is the same amount no matter how damaged you are
 - Armor is weird; There is no permanent armor, just different pieces you can equip which grant armor points that are used up as you take damage, meaning high-end armor can be useless if you don't already get shot a lot during battle 

The rest are just issues that come along with it being in early access, which are forgivable. I can't personally invest in a game with such a sucking array of trivialities.

39942164.review:
So for starters I dont have very much time in this game but I will say its a fun game and I feel like so far I have gotten my moneys worth, combat is fun, the strategy part adds a nice change of pace but I have a few complaints that arent game breaking but still frustrating which ill list off. I would also like to say that I am not writing these to discourage people from playing this game becayse it has only been out for a week so things could change.

Firstly you only start off with a pistol, normally this would be fine but this game doesnt lend itself to close quarters combat considering almost all the combat takes place in open fields. This leaves you at a huge disadvantage from the get go since all AI start off with rifles and will attack from a distance, for my first 4 batlles i had to rely soley on my squads to defeat enemies which is fine but makes the FPS portion pointless till you can scrounge up the money for a weapon that can reach out and touch someone.

Second issue, tree hit boxes suck. Sometimes you can stand right next to a try and hit an invisible wall and sometimes you can succesfully peak around a tree without issue. This can be frustrating if you aree using a sniper rifle as well.

Third issue, I have yet to encounter any weapons in loot. This may have been fixed in a recent update that is downloading as I type this.

Fourth issue, the second squad upgrade is either bugged or mislabeled. Visuaally they receive an upgrade as well as some units in the squad recive better weapons but their health, total damage, and other stats do not improve.

Beyond that this game is fun, I don't want to get myself to hyped over this game in case it gets abandoned but I really hope this game doesnt end up getting nuked by an update or become broken.

39941560.review: Never review games this early but this is just outstanding, devs are 2nd to none, what a game! and its only early access!!

39941517.review:
Like many other reviews have stated, this game is like M&B and Arma/Squad had a child.
This game is fun if you enjoyed Mount and Blade. If you enjoyed Arma or Squad at all, you may enjoy this.
HOWEVER, right now it is early access and is very barebones.

-As of now, I've played right under 2 hours and I can already say there isnt much to do yet.
-The combat feels okay to me, but like I said, very barebones.
-Mostly open fields...which is a bit dry. Needs more hills or cover objects or something. Make it a warzone, developers.
-The AI can be rather decent to be honest.
-Sometimes you can't actually click on your squad in the overhead RTS view..
-The audio is very loud, and it. is. GARBAGE. It sounds like every sound in this game was recorded in a tunnel..especially the footsteps....oh god the footsteps....

I still recommend this game, because I enjoy it, but I highly recommend only purchasing it if you want to support development. If you don't want to play through the hell this game will go through in development, then just wait.

39936554.review:
这游戏挺不错，策略养成结合FPS，开局一把手枪,两个小队。玩法跟介绍的一样，进行交易、升级装备、攻击敌军、围攻城镇，没什么好说的，写的挺详细了。
              当你以第一人称视角进入战局后，你会感觉鼠标有明显迟滞感,我在游戏中暂时没注意到垂直同步设置(可能是我没找到)，不过还算可以接受，习惯就好了。战局内自己还是以指挥队伍为主，你要是自己莽上去被干死就GG了。但有些时候AI枪法太感人，你得依靠树木等掩体自己贴近点射击敌人。另外还是要想办法走有利位置尽可能避免远距离交战，近中距离交战你自己打的好点，效率就高，远距离交战经常看AI对射很长时间，运气不好对面没死几个，自己小队死伤严重，队伍别走太暴露的地方，走树林山沟会好很多。画质方面跟商店页面的图一样，没什么说的。

==============这些都是3小时的游戏体验，老实讲，玩的进度比较慢，我上面说的可能只是前期的感觉，后期可能枪支、瞄具、队伍的各种变化打法之类的跟之前有较大差异。

39935198.review:
ซื้อมาเล่นเพราะล้างบาปครับยอมรับเลย

-แนวมันคล้ายๆ Mount and Blade เลยครับ (แต่ยังไม่มีระบบแต่งงานนะ มีแต่แต่งปืน 555)
-ตามที่บอกด้านบนครับ มีแต่งปืน ปืนหลากหลาย (แต่ไม่มากเท่าไหร่ มันจะมีมาเพิ่มอีกเรื่อยๆนั่นล่ะ)
-มีอัพเกรด squad พวกทหารรับจ้างต่างๆ มีอัพสายแยกสำหรับลูกน้องด้วยนะ
-อนาคตเห็นว่า มีแพลนไว้ว่าจะทำ co-op และ multiplayer
-อนาคตอีกแล้ว มีแพลนว่าจะใส่ Light Vehicle (พวกรถไว้โดยสาร บางคันอาจจะมีติดอาวุธ แบบ HMMWV ฯลฯ แต่พวกรถถังและเครื่องบินไม่มีแพลนจะทำ)
-อนาคต(อีกแล้วหรอ) จะเพิ่มประเภท squad ต่างๆเข้ามาอีก mortar team, medic squad, ฯลฯ

39935026.review:
Seit dem EA Release auf Steam gab es jeden Tag ein Update, und das Spiel wird von Update zu Update besser. Es ist ganz klar eine moderne Form von Mount & Blade, mit den First Person Elementen die mich, als PUBG Spieler, ganz stark an eben jenes erinnern. 
Man fängt mit einem kleinen Trupp an, bewaffnet mit eine Pistole und ohne großen Schutz. Durch besuchen der Städte und Handel, sowie ersten Raids, ich habe mich am Anfang  nur mit kleinen Banditen (Lootern) angelegt, hat man dann die Möglichkeit sich mal eine bessere Waffe und auch Schutz zu kaufen. 

Verbesserungswürdig:
Die Weltkarte ist relativ klein.
Der Feind auf der Kampfkarte verteilt sich teilweise großflächig und es kann schon passieren dass man den letzten Gegner minutenlang suchen muss um den Kampf zu gewinnen.
Die Werte und das Verhalten der Waffen muss noch nachgebessert werden.

Zusammengefasst ist dies sicher die ausgereifteste Alpha die ich bisher gespielt habe und jeder der das Team ist dieser Phase mit den paar Euro unterstützt begeht keinen Fehler

39934693.review:
Very promising game that's worth keeping a close eye on. As most, if not all, reviews have mentioned it's the love child of ArmA and Mount & Blade. But this is done with the best from both worlds! Like the clunky and glitchy nature of ArmA and uber gun realism is replaced with a smooth gunplay that's throughly enjoyable.

You through waypoints order your squads and participate in first person yourself. How much weight you assign to each part is up to you as you grow your army and conquer the map. Game is still in very early phases making it unpredictable, but if it keeps this up it'll be great for sure!

I've only played Freeman: Guerrilla Warfare for 12 hours at the moment however, I can tell that it's going to be one of my favourite games. The game is still in Early Access, though, the team that is actively developing this project seemingly never stops, with daily updates, sometimes every two days, you can bet that a ton of bugs are being crushed underfoot.

The game right now is, I'm not going to lie, pretty bare, but the ideas and suggestions they take from the community that play the game will make this game one of the best in 2018 (though 2018 has just started).

The Developers are active on the discord and on the forums located on steam and even if they're not online, there is a team of Moderators who can be just as helpful. With such a great community you can spend your time while you're not playing, talking to some amazing people.

Overall, it's a great game that you can get many hours of joy from and it's being actively updated.

39933175.review:
This game is a very cool concept, it is basically a modern guerrilla war version of Mount & Blade. The core elements are there, and if they manage to fix up the game right I will be turning this negative into a positive. There is a ton of potential here and I hope to see the devs succeed at their vision for this game.

However in its current state I cannot recomend you buy it yet, unless you just want to support the project finincially. There are alot of problems, serious missing components to features. Here are a few examples:

You spawn with just a pistol and a few magazines, and the cheapest rifles from shops cost 5-10k money which will take you very long to get. You fight battles with friendly and enemy soldiers who are all armed with rifles, and you cannot fight properly with a pistol. You cannot loot guns from friendly or enemy bodies so you are stuck with it. You run out of ammo incredibly quickly with just a couple of pistol magazines, and you cannot loot ammo from bodies either. So in every single battle, you run out of ammo spraying with your pistol at targets 50 yards away, and then you have to just sit and wait hoping that your ai team will win the fight. It totally ruins the fun of the battles. Even if you manage to get enough money to buy a rifle (which I have not yet despite winning many battles, because I have to spend all the looted money on troop upkeep) you will still not be able to loot ammo from bodies in battle and will have to conserve your ammo very carefully.

There are other smaller bugs/missing items that are less impactful, but also not forgivable. For example there is a leveling system like M&B with skill points that you assign into various talents, but the character HUD does not show you how many points you actually have to spend. You have to just put points in talents untill you run out, not knowing how many you even have to spend. Its a completely ridicoulous thing to not have put in the game, especially because it would take a very small amount of work. There are alot of bugs like this.

Basically they seem to have released this too quickly. I understand how early alpha access works but there is a limit to what you can have missing from the game before it comes across as just laziness. I will keep an eye on the updates and see how it goes in the future, but for now I would avoid this game.

39932211.review:
现在这个游戏还在高速开发更新中，评测时版本为0.110

有关这个游戏的玩法，官方的说明就已经很准确了，这是一个结合了骑马与砍杀和arma的游戏，标准骑砍式的模拟经营和角色扮演，加上arma式的战斗。

在“骑砍”的方面，现在这个游戏的完成度还很低。没有不同的地区特产和由之衍生的跑商玩法，阵营数量少且缺乏复杂和多样的阵营间互动，而且世界规模太小，加上城镇没有自己的地图，代入感有点差。另外，角色培养上，目前没感觉到太大的差异，毕竟这是个fps，枪支本身的特性带来的差异和影响远大于角色本身的属性和技能。不过升级和加技能带来的角色提升也不算很小，平衡性上控制的还不错。

而在“arma”的方面，现在这个游戏表现出来的素质和完成度已经相当高了。
fps方面，枪支的手感贴近arma的风格，数值方面，虽然有rpg的升级加点元素在里面，但整体仍然是传统fps的枪伤高人皮脆几枪就倒的风格，不会出现某些fps游戏里，一个人站在那你突突他一梭子都打不死的情况。
小队指挥方面，这个游戏现在的质量也很高。在战斗中你需要注意地形和掩护。躲在丛林和植被中可以让你的队伍更加隐蔽难以被发现，但开枪增加暴露队伍的暴露度。地形和掩体可以决定你在对射中是否占据优势，包抄和夹击也会取得明显的效果。而游戏中的AI在战斗中的表现也刚刚好，没有某些fps游戏中粗暴的透视自瞄但也会采用一些诸如包抄、侧翼打击的战术。游戏中不同的兵种也有着不同的优势和特色。比如擅长远距离狙击但近战弱势的狙击，比如配置了大量手榴弹以起到各种作用的掷弹兵，等等。以现在的完成度来说，你甚至可以全程赖在战术地图界面，把这游戏当一个rts来打。

总而言之，现在的这个游戏拥有一个非常优秀的框架，欠缺的只是足够的时间，来让制作组添加丰富的内容和对一些细节进行打磨。但即使以现在的完成度和质量来说，个人觉得也是对得起40块钱的票价的。

另，游戏的语言需求很小，没汉化也能玩。

OK after playing for half of hours i can see how wonderful this game is, You control a group of your squad and attack enemy or "Lowest level enemy" to grind your XP so u become stronger like RPG game also your main objective is to capture all citys so you can become the strongest faction, Just like RPG game. I always have a dream of FPS RTS PRG game combine into one and this just capture what i wanted. Also Dev keep updating the game faster than some AAA company....

Gameplay:
-On gameplay It more like ARMA style which is large map, no idea where enemy are until mark (ai did it for you) 

-You can join your troop to fight with them tho your troop aim not the best but they get job done

-Sure the voice of your soldier sound like from indie game out there but I really hope to see it get fix in future. Dev If you can, Make those guy speak in Russia it sound better than indie military voice

39926948.review:
EDIT: Apparently one of these bugs is now fixed (The quicksave keys have changed) although the ultrawide monitor issue still resides. Once that is fixed, this will no doubt become a positive review.

EDIT 2: Changed to a positive. While some bugs still remain, the changes that have been implemented so far are fantastic improvements, and it looks set that this game will continue to improve.

TL;DR: At the minute, it's too frustrating to recommend, but aside from that it seems as though it's going to turn out to be a great game. I'll start with the negatives, if you can see past those, then by all means go ahead and support the devs.

Negatives

-Bugs, specifally the following: Ultrawide monitors aren't yet supported, which is fine - but if you alt-tab out of the game it will bump you into ultrawide resolution. This wouldn't be so much of a problem if the UI didn't render outside your resolution and make quitting a battle impossible (resulting in you having to Alt + F4 and lose your progress). The second bug, and the one that's made me put this down for now, is that you can select separate squads with F1-5. Only, F5 is also save. But when you press F5, it brings up the save option, as well as a dialogue box that tells you you're entering a town... Which you can't get rid of, and because you're in a fight, it won't save. So that's another 3 hours of progress gone.
-Sound: Some of the footstep sounds make you think there's gunfire going on, when it's actually just your crunchy feet.
-Your ability to see enemies is low, while your men seem to have eagle sight.
-Janky overworld graphics, and not a great deal of things to do yet

Positives

+The gunplay is excellent, similar to ARMA and PUBG
+The general idea of the game is excellent
+Good strategies tend to win battles
+It's Mount & Blade with guns

I'll change my review to a positive once it becomes a little more fleshed out and I can get over the fact I lost progress twice in a row, but if you can tip-toe around those negatives for now (or if they get fixed in the near future) I can easily recommend this as it stands.

39926012.review:
Day 1:  With only a pistol and a handful of volunteers I began my journey to become the greatest warlord in all the land.  Freeing the country of a few bandit groups was no hassle for my men under my superior strategy; however, my pistol could only do so much.  As we marched to the next settlement to buy ammo, we were suddenly outnumbered by a large amount of terrorists.  They demanded money to cross their lands, and to spare my the lives of my men, I gave them my money leaving very little for wages.  I now know my greatest enemy.  

Day 2:  After a destroying a countless amount of bandits, I know had enough money to buy my very own rifle.  An AKM with 4 magazines.  My men have also grown stronger after the many battles and are no longer just armed civilians, but warriors.  I am proud to lead them.  Tomorrow we will march against the terrorists that took so much from us before.  

Day 3:  We attack a group of the terrorists in a open field from the hills.  I have rush of power as I massacre 21 terrorists alone.  They may have just been recruits, but my bloodlust has begun.  We attacked four more groups that day.  They would run away and we would chase them down and rip them apart with 7.62s.  I set my eyes on their settlement.

Day 4:  I got overly confident and lost my 25 men to a overwhelming force of 120 and now I'm im trading bread and lighters just to have enough money for ammo.  

10/10

39925859.review:
This game is a great mix of both Arma and Mount and Blade for what it is at the moment.
It's pretty barebones in terms of content right now, but its a great platform for what they can add onto it, and updates seem to be frequent at the moment and I pray the developers do not lose this momentum. The discord for this game is lively with people suggesting ideas and showing bugs/exploits that get passed on and patched. 

The strategy system works surprisingly well, even if the AI can be god awful every now and again. The factions and units seems to be a bit funky but that'll probably be updated with more story and quests. The gunplay is relatively solid and the combat is very suspenseful especially when battling a big force.

If you don't mind that it's still in alpha (v0.105 as of typing) and like the  idea of MnB/Amma while you wait for Bannerlord then go for it. If not, keep an eye on it while it develops and wait until a finished product arrives, it'll still take less time than Bannerlord!

39923609.review:
Released a few days ago, it both is, and feels, very early access. The Mount and Blade comparisons are fair, the game plays and feels quite similar and honestly screams potential; it can certaily become a super enjoyable sandbox strat/shooter version of M&B on an engine that fits it.  

Right now, the parts you can access are fun, but limited. Few towns/factions, and a small map limit total gametime, but more than that the battles all feel the same. Where a battle happens doesnt feel like it changes much. Everything is long ranged potshotting - even to take towns. As it stands, I can think of no conceivable reason why you would ever own a shotgun. 

All that said, the game does what it already does extremely well. The gun fights are great, even if you can't modify weapons and start with a pistol (would be cool, if it were possible to use in current meta). The game doesn't make building up a chore, and you'll find you hit the ceiling before you tire of it. 

Understand what you're getting. Its not a complete game, but the price is reasonable, the content is still fun, and the future seems promising. Definite thumbs up and no regrets on the purchase.

39923336.review:
So far this game has been alright. It's still plauged with early access bugs and glitches however it has a lot of potential for great things. The first person shooter is a cool aspects to add to this style of RPG.

1. Its quite repetetive as there is no story or quests what so ever even though the option for quests are available from the wandering armies.

2. The random spawn points are terribly placed. ESPECIALLY WHEN DEFENDING YOUR TOWNS. out of the 3 defenses ive played my spawn was right in front of the enemy advance. 

3. All other nations other than Bandits will absolutely obliterate you. They can play with their entire force even though you are limitted on yours based on your skill level of leadership. 

4. Most other armies are veteran levels with stars to establish their dominance. My armies can only seem to advance to new improved classes. But they can not become veteran squads with stars at all.

5. I wish there was an option for cover when in a fire fight. Bullets ALWAYS seem to find a way to hit me no matter where or what im behind.

6. When using garrisoned troops i can only deploy one squad before it says too many squads to be deployed. Basically if you deploy one garrisoned army it counts as the entirety of the garrison and you can not deploy any more soldiers.

Now it is a fun game and definitely kept me entertained. Im sure the Dev's are working on some great things and its in very early stages. My best recommendation is allow the entirety of your rucruited forces to be deployed in any given battle. To match the enemy forces that have a full on assult of max forces. Keep it up so far so good and im excited to see what comes.

So let me first start by saying that the only reason I recommend this game at the moment is 
because it has massive potential. 

As most other people are saying this is essentially Mount and Blade but with guns and that isn’t a bad thing in the slightest. I have played close to 4 hours by now and it is pretty much what I expected. 

With that said this is early access so at the moment the game is in a rather raw state of existence, bare bones to say the least. Sound design, optimization, UI; they all work, but could be better. Again, I understand that the game is early access so I am not trying to take a dump on it, I quite like it and see its genuine possibility for what it could become. 

If you are looking for a rich gameplay experience then possibly wait a little longer on this title, but I still recommend this game because I would really love to see what the devs do with it and throwing $15 their way to help speed that up is pretty low risk since they seemingly deliver regular updates.

39920903.review:
So immediate impressions:

For EA it's pretty good and if you are seeing it for $11 it might be worth picking up.

The graphics are fair. My first impression was that it was a M&B mod but the movement and combat are solid.

They increased the hit detection and right now it might be just a little too much but it looks like they patch frequently so I have no doubt they'll work it out.

Running a town is a little sparse. You can build things and unlike M&B it doesn't take a month to build. You just have to have the cash.

Morale is maintained through manual payments which is nice.

Combat gets annoying rapidly. There's a timer but I can't discern what purpose it serves and you can spend 10 minutes looking for the last enemy. Right now you have to “find the enemy location” and while it adds some challenge to your starting strategy it doesn’t play out well.

Anyway not too detailed a review but I will say that my initial reaction to this game is the same one that I had when I first played Rust and that that there is a lot of potential here. I’m really looking forward to seeing where it goes.

Great game and great idea. It is such a great idea for a game I wish I had thought of it.

Having that capability of moving troops anywhere you want and how agressive you want them to move is an amazing feature. 39917512.review:
首先：这游戏确实很好玩。
优点:
1.融合了骑砍和arma3的风格，骑砍的大地图，倒买倒卖,商店页面，属性，背包也和骑砍很像，加上arma3的战斗风格，可以我很喜欢.
2.可以控制小队的战略，攻击，跟随，进攻路线等等，刚开始只能使用2个小队战斗，一个小队最多5个人，通过加属性来提升带兵容量，但是我看不懂哪个才是添加容量的.如果有小队死亡，可以按m键，再召唤一个小队。
3.敌对玩家：地图上有很多敌对玩家，他们会追着你跑，追到了就要你交钱，这里和骑砍很像。
4.战斗系统：玩家可以按q和e来实现左右倾斜，包括蹲，趴，瞄准镜是写实风格的，不是类似csgo那样右键全屏然后中间一个十字，包括望远镜以及rpg都是如此。
5.商店以及城池功能，刚出生只有1000，你买不了任何步枪以及冲锋枪等等，你可以通过倒买倒卖来赚钱，记着遇到劫匪要跑远一点，要不然追到就没钱了，当然你也可以选择肛，开局一把手枪，全局得靠队友，当然子弹也不是无限的，需要买，买了只有需要装在装备栏里才行
槽点
1.队友动不动就朝你开几枪，被人打了还能站在那装个逼，有时候你回头一看发现你的队友在朝另一个队友扫射，要么就子弹全往地上打。
2.当你不小心走出地图时，记得要直接走掉，不要继续攻击，因为你会出生在和队友不同的位置，而且这时会出现个bug，敌人怎么打都打不死。
3。功能性太少了，城池只能攻击，商店，医院，招募，也没有任务
4.没有载具，所以RPG有啥用，但是我感觉载具后面会出，这游戏潜力很大
5.无汉化，希望有个汉化把，毕竟我连属性都看不懂。

以上只代表个人，打算入的萌新可以参考一下，游戏还是不错的

39917444.review: Very addicting even at this stage of early access. Build your army up Mount and Blade style and conquer towns. Game really opens up when you take over a town and sucks you in. Looking forward to the content they add in over time. Well worth the price tag even at this stage.

39917437.review:
このゲームは本当に楽しい。
mount&blade というゲームの現代ゲリラ戦みたいな感じですね。

現在、アーリーアクセス版なので
ほぼ、英語読めなくても今はストーリーが無いので問題ないです。

YouTubeで動画にしてみたから見てくれると分かるかも。
生配信の映像なので飛ばし飛ばし見てほしい。
https://youtu.be/CTz4NTQSHws

ゲームの流れとしては、

1.シンボルエンカウント型の見下ろしマップを歩き回る（RTS要素）

2.敵対的なシンボルと、中立でクエストをくれて味方になってくれるシンボルがいる（選択肢は出るが実装されてない為、クエストは受けられない）

3.シンボル同士が重なった場合、ほぼ戦闘になる。（お金払って見逃してもくれる）

4.戦闘マップに移行して先ずはRTS要素の部隊の設置と移動の指示、敵に合った時の戦い方など選択肢などをおこなえる。

5.7分間という時間がありそれを過ぎると敵の位置に濃い赤い丸がマップ上に出てきてゲームスピードを早めてくれる。

6.戦闘が始まるとMボタンでFPS視点と切り替えて戦う事が出来る。（初期武器はハンドガンだけ）

7.倒した敵からすぐに武器は回収出来ず戦闘が終わった後のリザルト画面で貰える。（消耗品ばかりで武器はほぼ無い）

8.弾のリロードに気をつけて欲しい。
マガジンに弾が残ってる状態でリロードするの残りの弾は捨てられてしまう。

9.自分で敵を倒していくと経験値を稼ぐことが出来る。

10.戦闘画面で弾薬庫がリスポーン地点にある。

11.弾薬庫を開くとステータスポイントの振分けが出来る。（非戦闘中は上手くできない）

12.commanderみたいなステータスを上げると戦闘に出せる部隊を増やせるので積極的にあげていこう。

39916381.review:
Здравия, что об игре
+Качество графики - смотрел и на максимальных и на минимальных, смотреться почти что одинаково кроме мелких, но очень приятных деталей.
-Оптимизация - в игре идут небольшие проседы но учтя что игра вышла 1 февраля это вполне терпимо.
Игра не сложная но тактическая, учитывать надо всё : способности союзников и врагов, сколько у тебя обойм в оружии. Буквально за 30м-1ч вы уже поймете что к чему. 
-Боты - Боты туповаты... Они стреляют в тебя сквозь что угодно, будто холмик или что то небольшое им всё равно, они не умеют обходить, а так же туповаты в сфере точности/прицеливании из-за этого бой может расстянуться что не очень желательно.
+Отличная механика, ситуации как в знаменитых на всю катушку играх на подобии PUBG не бывает, физика просто шикарная.
+Разнообразие - в игре ещё хоть и нет большого арсенала оружия или брони, тут всё вполне хватает: маска, шлем, очки, перчатки, туловище, штаны и калаш 47-й с 5-я обоймами мне вполне хватает.
Так как игра новая факт о том  что тут нет транспорта не очень удивительно, но очень было бы приятно увидить какой нибудь миленький Hammer с стрелком сверху и ехать по бездорожью.
+Фракции - Факто о том что скоро (это точно) в игре будут доступны свои флаги, то полюбому 50-55% хоть раз сделают свою маленькую уганду... А так есть группировки Бандиты , те и ещё кто то, в общем примерно группировок 10-ть на карту и это норма. 
Ну моя оценка для начала 6/8 по разным категориям, спасибо!

-  It is a good steal for $11.99
-  It is in active development, so it will just keep getting better.

39912205.review:
Не смотря, что игра очень сырая  (а то и понятно ибо, находится в раннем доступе), могу сказать следующее:
Игра имеет огромный потенциал, т.к. сама задумка интересна и необычна, так что, если разработчики не просрутся и будут работать над игрой не покладая рук, то получат действительно годную игру, которая будет пользоваться популярностью. Может не такие высоты, как какой-нибудь там PUBG, CS:GO и прочее, но своё эта игра возьмёт.

А теперь о небольших недостатках:
Т.к. я играю на мониторе с размером экрана 1280x1024, выставляю соответствующий формат. Но, к сожалению выставляется 1280x720, следовательно, появляются те же черные полосы сверху и снизу, которые ломают глаза, да и в целом картинка выглядит так себе. До обновлений я хотя бы мог растянуть экран одним багом. Просто нажать Alt+Tab чтобы свернуть игру, и также, чтобы развернуть, но уже без этих гребанных черных полос.

Бывают моменты, когда перед нападением сохраняешь игру, чтобы напасть на противника. Нападаю, что-то может пойти не так. Загружаю сохранение - а противник либо исчезает, либо его кол-во бойцов уменьшается на столько, сколько уничтожил ты и твоя команда в прошлом бое, который ты решил переиграть.

При захвате города, с последующим выставлением в него гарнизона, не совсем понятно, как он работает. Нападает противник, иду защищать свой город. Но отбивать могу только своими ребятами, которые находятся в моей команде, а не в гарнизоне города. Если бы появились в бою весь гарнизон города, то шансы отбить атаку, естественно выше, чем пытаешься отбить элитные войска противника со своими лысыми новобранцами, которые толком стрелять не умеют. Не то, что бравые элитные бойцы, которых я оставил для защиты города.

39912048.review: The game idea is very cool and refreshing in todays market. Its very early access and the game does seem a bit bare and clunky, frame rate is also kinda bad. Cant wait to see where this games leads a year or so from now.

39912006.review:
I dont usually make these long winded reviews but i really love the concept that you guys are developing, i cant remember how many times when i play total war i think to myself how cool it would be to be on the ground fighting. Ijust have some issues that i hope you devs and others who read this would agree with.

1. balance in P V E is a bit off,  you start out with no controlled town while the factions you fight start out with a town and multiple armies (idk if i just cant figure it out but i dont see how to build other armies).

2. if youre going to make my skills/attributes determine how many soldiers i can recruit/command (which i really dont agree with that feature) the AI definetly shouldnt start out with so many soldiers (ex: the main faction you fight started with 99 dudes defending their base and like 5 different armies with 25-40 soldiers).

3.  stuff costs way too much,between replenishing my troops and paying rewards to increase morale( i dont agree with that feature, also my dudes sometimes lose moral even when i win the battle) and recruting more for my army i dont see how im able to save up enough to buy weapons/gear for myself. I thought that maybe once i took a settlement id get way more funds but i only get 325 per day (day cycles last to long since i depend on taxes).

4. I dont really see the benefits in having settlements, i think that feature needs to be fleshed out more like what does more security and prosperity provide me? why should i spend money on construction?  idk maybe thats part of the game that im not playing right.

5. a mini map (kinda like the total war map) in first person would be much apprieciated, when the battles get big im unable to enjoy your awsome 1st person feature because i cant view my troops  or the enemy locations that pop up or even see where im going.

6. also im assuming the red circle in the deployment phase is suspected enemy locations but sometimes ill move my dudes towardes it and the enemy will be like right behind me or off to the side far away from the red circle.

7. there seems to be no advantage given when im defending either in a open battle or a siege, if im the one defending we should be givin the oppurtunity to set our defense within our deployment zone just like the AI does (set ambushes, emplace weapon systems, put my guys in buildings, maybe even a feature where they dig fox holes or smething).

8. vehicles would be a cool feature.

9. smoke grenades would be nice.


10. finally some kind of fire support feature (mortor team, artillery, or air assets)


again i love what you guys are doing i hope you and whoever else reads this agrees with my points.

39908751.review:
2018.2.8.  2：20 #增加17以后的意见
2018.2.8  14:23  #增加31以后的意见
是看了一篇微信推送后买的，确实让人耳目一新，果断好评请收下
玩到十级了，游戏体验相当不错，操作也相当容易上手，强烈推荐
已经安利好几个朋友入手了，就冲着制作组好几天连续更新，如此良心必须支持
虽说制作组名不见经传，但是游戏处处能感受到制作组的用心
作为一名十几年的FPS玩家和七年多的骑砍玩家，在此提一点意见和建议
1、游戏界面和交互框略微有些简陋，虽然简单明了，但质感确实有些简陋了
2、需要官方汉化
3、在大地图上无法自由移动视角，这样无法宏观的把控整体布局
4、人物在大地图上移动时经常莫名卡死，而且时常卡顿，很多路走不了，一定会莫名绕路
5、兵种可以更多一些，比如各种职业搭配和不同的单位（参考骑砍，INSURGENCY或者DAY OF infamy）
6、大地图内容可以更丰富一些，比如速度、士气等等
7、建议在装备和交易界面增加个人形象，不然买了装备都只能靠脑补
8、希望武器可以自由购买和搭配配件
9、希望战斗节奏可以加快一些，有时候在地图上和小队搜了几分钟都没见到对面的人，一直到七分钟结束有提示才找到
10、希望能有更多的和NPC的交流（骑砍和骑砍2的开发日志就是最好的参照）
11、AI可以透视，无论躲在哪儿AI都能看见敌人，经常无脑射地板，就跟吃鸡里锁头挂打在掩体后面的人一样
12、维持军队的费用太高了！严重影响游戏体验，没事就得打赏，有好多次打一场赚的几千全拿来犒赏部队和补员了
13、希望可以进入城镇或村庄场景，而不是只有一个图标
14、遇到一个bug好几次，枪经常打着打着打不出来了，装满子弹却无法射击
15、希望能加入载具系统！摩托吉普装甲车甚至坦克
16、希望游戏内容能够更丰富一些
17、希望画质还能提升一下，毕竟这是2018年的游戏了
 #补充
18、希望增加屏息射击（大多数主流FPS都有）
19、希望武器和装备种类能更加丰富
20、攻下城镇后希望可以建设防御设施（沙包、机枪、无坐力炮等等）
21、希望增加昼夜更替以及天气系统，不然怎么算一天都不清楚，莫名的就给部队欠薪了
22、再次希望军队单位种类能丰富一些，多一些兵种树和单位供选择，需要一些精锐部队
23、扩大地图，增加多一些城镇或村庄，同时城镇不同的地位要体现出来，比如首都、商业城镇、村庄、要塞、堡垒等等
24、没看懂食物消耗是怎么算的，但是七百多单位的食物一天就吃完了，而我只有24个人
25、右键瞄准时，枪总会莫名抽搐==就一直在 抖动，然后准心也是偏左不在正中间
26、作为这么大的战略地图来说，在战斗场景里初始能连续跑动的距离有点少了，点了running会好一些但还是杯水车薪
27、游戏的初始界面确实有些丑，背景图不够凸显游戏特点
28、增加人物属性点上限，目前似乎是5点就满了
29、敌人经常莫名其妙开局出现在红区以外很远的地方，或者开局直接从菊花绕出来，不知是我理解错了还是红区代表的并不是敌占区
30、副武器就是火箭筒感觉不太合适，觉得爆炸物应该有单独的栏位，两把主武器一把手枪的搭配就会很舒服（和吃鸡一样）
31、需要近战武器，不然子弹打光了就成了傻子（或者我还没发现近战攻击键）
32、再提一次，部队维护费用太高了！整天在地图上疲于奔命，不是为了买装备而是为了养部队..打仗又容易死人，好的一下掉士气，补员奖励一下子等于没打了，就这样一直循环
33、玩家所能使用的雇佣军部队战斗力和正规军战斗力太悬殊了，甚至都被红鹰的恐怖分子爆锤，即使都是顶级机枪狙击游骑都一样被爆锤，希望能给玩家招募一些精锐部队，或者给玩家招募正规军的渠道，不然每次打红鹰军都死好几队，太伤了
34、希望能有一些侦查的手段，敌军在战斗地图上总是莫名出现在红圈外的野区世界的尽头，希望能有一些侦查全图的手段比如无人机，加快一下战斗进程，不然很多时候真的就在藏猫猫
35、城镇防御战中防守方并没有什么优势，而且AI不会进屋子，所以就毫无优势可言，希望能增加巷战
 
#ps：各种装备和武器弹药等等这些都可以参考Innawoods！当年就很喜欢在里面自己搭配的感觉

目前就这些，日后会继续补充

#看到很多评论里别人提到的问题已经被解决了！真的为制作组的效率疯狂点赞！非常支持这款游戏，看好它的未来！希望你们能坚持下去！把这个游戏做好做精！！干掉无敌跳票王骑砍2哈哈哈哈哈

总的来说想法非常不错，制作组非常良心，即使是现在的测试版也是一个值得一玩的很有潜力的游戏，希望制作组能坚持下去！把你们的想法发扬光大！路还很长，加油！支持你们

39908259.review:
I tried the game today, and ended up sinking 7 hours into it.  The mix of tactical real time strategy and first person shooter works extremely well together, in my opinion. You start out with a pistol and some soldiers, and then fight looters and bandits until you get better gear and soldiers, and then fight more powerful enemies and so it goes. A lot like in Mount and Blade. 

The enemy AI is a lot more intelligent than I had expected. I've seen them hold their fire and attempt to move around my forces, staying out of sight so as to flank me. The AI is also extemely responsive, rushing for cover or falling to the ground the moment they get shot at.

However, the game has very little content in it right now, and after my playthrough I can't find much else to do as of right now. The devs have release updates every single day so far, and adress issues and bugs the community encounter. 
The game is very enjoyable, even in it's current state, and I would definitely recommend picking it up in order to support the devs, so they can make it excellent.

And another important note, as of right now atleast, the system requirements are false. You definitely do not need an i7 4790K with 16gb of ram and a 970 to play on ultra.. I use an i5 4460, 8gb of ram, and a 1050 ti and play on the highest settings with no problems at all.

(Side note : How awesome will this game be when the game is fully released and there are mods?? We could finally have a good Warhammer 40K shooter game)

+ Birliklerinizi çatışma esnasında komuta edebilme.
+ Birliklerinizi çatışma esnasına geri çekme veya destek getittirebilme
+ Şehirlerdeki Borsa olayı

+ Çalışanların oyunla ilgilenmesi

39906213.review:
Great game, worth a buy already at its current price. FPS and strategy fans alike will enjoy this one. Definitely some similarities to M&B, but with better pacing (Easier to build up troops, etc. so it doesn't take as long to jump in).

What really gives me hope is the dev team. Bought this game a week ago, thinking "it'd be great if gun mods were a thing, and if there was a more fleshed out recruitment system". 

Literally not 5 days later, extensive gun customisation (Scopes, silencers, etc.) were added in, along with a prisoner system and more quality of life improvements and bug fixes than I could count. What I expected would take at least several weeks was implemented on a daily basis, support the hell out of this game!

39905221.review:
На первый взгляд кажется, что эта игра может дать то, чего так не хватает в жанр FPS - симулятор партизанских действий. Но в силу причин (ранний доступ, завышенные ожидания, очевидные недостатки игры) - это не так. По сути, эта игра ничем не отличается от мода с огнестрельным оружием на M&B. Да, здесь новые модели и механики управления отрядами, но ничего принципиального нового разработчики ПОКА не предлагают.
Минусы, из-за которых я оформил возврат средств:
- из лута не выпадает оружие, получить его можно только купив у торговца в городе
- слабая возможность оказывать активное влияние на ход боя (непосредственно остреливая врагов)
- отсутствует кастомизация оружия
- игровой процесс представляет собой повторение однообразных перестрелок (с апгрейдом отряда будут добавляться РПГ, домовые завесы и пр.), содержание боевого столкновения - тупо стрельба, без разведки, прикрытия
- нет заметного разнообразия в юнитах
- слабые тактические возможности управления отрядом на поле боя в силу слабости AI
Надеюсь, разработчики не бросят игру и допилят ее, не бросив в состоянии зародыша.

39904017.review:
Manage a group of soldiers in a post-apocalyptic world, command your squads in combat and fight beside your soldiers. Basically this is a Mount & Blade : Warband mod with fully reworked combat, and with modern firearms. Surprisingly it works, and feels like an obvious genre, now that someone thought of it. Already a great early access title, with fantastic potential.

This feels right, and hopefully gets done right. It's amazingly playable even at this stage (v0.105). The campaign map mode is lifted straight from Mount & Blade: Warband, many menus and functions are exactly the same. But hey, I love Warband, and the familiarity helped me get right into the game. But I do hope they make it more their own.

The combat parts are a lot of fun. Balance feels okay already. Several important features are missing at the moment, though. These include not being able to use binoculars, no compass, can't command squads unless looking at the map, etc. Even still, it's very playable. Really looking forward to seeing how the game will develop.

39902805.review:
此短评写于2018.2.7 游戏处于抢先体验阶段
《自由人：游击战争》这款游戏是一款即时战斗策略类游戏，与传统策略类游戏不同，玩家可以享受自己上战场厮杀的快感，可以说就是一个现代军事版的《骑马与砍杀》，有着非常真实的操作体验，压枪需要很高的技术，而且要考虑地形再排兵布阵。英文版本有些用词具有一定歧义，这也是必然的文化差异所造成的。在汉化过程中，我们也尽量使其本地化，口语化。游戏本身易于操作，容易上手，耐玩性强，玩家姥爷们可以很轻松就了解这个游戏世界的规则。
3DM在此祝各位玩家姥爷游戏愉快，也欢迎各位使用我们的汉化补丁。
游戏当前还处于抢先体验阶段，作者的定期更新可能会让汉化失效，我们也会视情况进行定期跟进。
由于游戏目前不支持多国语言，游戏文本和代码混杂一起，如需更新新版本汉化相当于要完全重新汉化一次游戏，故我们目前不会对每天更新的每一个游戏版本都重新制作汉化，请谅解！

39901369.review:
[h1] 开发商自评到位，这是一款模式学骑砍、战斗向武突squard靠拢的作品。而在骑砍2上架前，它应该可以作为替代品苟活一阵子，勉强兑付着玩个几十年。[/h1]

-游戏目前尚处于EA阶段，在功能开发方面欠缺良多。城镇只有功能菜单没有内景，NPC也几乎么有互动内容，任务以及剧情线之类的东西更是无从谈起。枪械的操作手感以及弹道设计中规中矩，在拟真和娱乐两者之间找到了一个均衡点，上手比较容易。

-战斗方式较之骑砍没有变化，只是以枪械驳火取代了冷兵器拼杀。
 内置的小队指挥功能使玩家可以在战术地图上部署小队并下达命令、设置进攻路径、索敌并予以消灭。
 希望能在战斗场景中加入更多的地形和建筑。目前除了攻守城战，其他时间基本野♂战。

-部队会以小队为单位（3-5人）加入你的队伍。他们的武器配置各不相同，而且会跟随小队等级提升而提升。
 补员变的更加简单，只要一支小队没有尽墨即可直接花钱补员。
 伤亡和胜利都会影响士气，而士气高低直接影响了部队的战斗意志和承受伤亡的最大限度。在这里想以战养战，依靠不断的胜利来维持高昂士气似乎不太现实，唯有红包和现金日结才能抚平手下兵丁的炮弹恐惧症。

-阵营部分已经有了雏形，但还只是个壳。
 玩家开局会与2个势力敌对，交保护费可以改善外交关系（1000起捐，强盗除外）。
 人数少的敌方不对不会主动逃离玩家，但人数多的肯定会主动尾随玩家而且很难甩掉。所以有时候以少胜多真的是迫不得已，当然也会有被对方某Leader单位一发手雷/榴弹/RPG炸飞了整支小队的悲惨境遇。

-生存之道：钱&苟。
 玩家开局真的只有一把手枪，NPC枪法神准且游戏的中弹惩罚也比较严重（黑红屏+晃动+娇喘），在护甲值不高的时候很容易被几发入魂。不过得益于部队指挥功能，我们可以像R6一样伏在行李箱旁边玩手机。何况以玩家初期的实力也只能刷刷土匪，其它有家室的势力大佬不是2队兵就能撼动的。
 至于钱的重要性，除了每战过后要看情况发完红包发工资（貌似下调过一次，欣慰），给势力大佬交保护费之外，比较坑爹的一点是这游戏的装备基本全靠 [strike] 打 [/strike]  买（战利品内容种类和掉率已经修改，但依然是惨不忍睹）。奸商那边的SMG售价在3-5K，步枪5K以上，狙击步枪火箭筒过万，好一点的头盔胸挂护膝价格基本也与武器持平。

-游戏目前没有中文，以后应该会有。不过这并不是一个痛点，因为游戏内几乎没有大段文本，你与NPC的互动内容基本也仅限于 “prepare to die！” x2。

-游戏的大小补丁每天都在上线，制作者的开发热情可见一斑，望再接再厉。

I love Mount and Blade, I spent hundreds of hours on the series, and I am eagerly waiting for Bannerlord. This game is a wonderful surprise. It emulates Mount and Blade in modern times with Arma elements very well.

The game is obviously in early access. There are bugs, it's not feature complete, the performance isnt great, UI is pretty bad. But despite all those things, it already feels like it has a very solid foundation. It is playable and it is very fun, especially considering the humble price tag. The developers are proving that they are competent, with frequent (currently daily) updates and blog posts.

I bought this game to support the development team, they seem to be a new but experienced studio and I hope my contribution helps them deliver an excellent product. I wish them all the best and I will be keeping an eye out on this game.

I easily recommend this game if you are willing to put up with the usual (but much more promising) early access woes.

I will update this review in the future.

This should be an instant buy for people who are:

1) interested in a mixed RTS/FPS/Strategy game

2) interested in some of the modern conflicts including irregular soldiers

3) fans of mount & blade

This game is basically mount and blade set in an undisclosed area of Eastern Europe, where you play as a group of Guerillas trying to take over their 'homeland'. You will have to manage supplies, order your troops around, level yourself & your troops up, and maintain order over your cities.

Cons at the moment (Feb 2018) include lack of map variety and an overall lack of polish you would expect from a finished title. I expect this game to do well and continue to be developed, so it might be worth your time to support it during EA

39899604.review:
Edit: The devs of this game are making really quick work with this game. I have changed my review as they are showing their promises to the supporters. If you have any interest in this game buy it, updates are coming out like wildfire and the game is at a good place even for right now.

Previous review
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Game needs a lot of work done, right now it is skin and bones. As everyone else has said the game has limitless potential, but right now it is very basic. 

Sunk around five hours thus far, and it has been a rollercoaster so far. Obviously most people buying this game are taking it as it is, a newly released game with the need of support from players. It being new and in need of support does not justify the game being released in the current state. Although they have been spitting out updates like rapid fire, I still feel the game should have had more work done before being released to the public. 

The glaring flaws, are, well, glaring. The audio is the first thing that comes to mind, it is just terrible, nothing is balanced correctly. Gun shots from a distance sound as if they are coming from a different planet, and most of the time it is difficult in telling where shots are coming from. Not even mentioning the footsteps, I have no idea what is up with that. Can also be updated, the audio feels outdated. Audio needs to be fixed immediately, it breaks immersion and makes the game feel poor.

UI could be updated, just makes the game feel poor. Not much else to be said here.

I read what the devs had to say about the early access and one thing that stuck to me is the comment about the AI. "...advanced AI and territory conquest/defend/management are all in there but need further polish." The game is far from advanced AI, the AI, to my suprise is decent, enemies committed to basic tactics such as flanks and evasive maneuvers. Beyond that the AI is really basic, when commanding troops you have basic commands, and when your troops engage in combat they just stop and open fire. I also have no idea why there is a cease fire command, no situation would benefit from this. Anyways, friendly AI just shoot at enemies and enemies use basic tactics, to call it advanced is a bit of a stretch. 

Game just feels really old, for some reason I feel like I am playing a game made 10 years ago, it may just be me getting the Arma 2 vibe but it feels old. No idea why this is but I do not feel like I am playing a game made in 2018.

Battlegrounds are really redundant, it is as if I was playing in the same battleground over and over, granted I have not explored the map too much, I still feel like I am playing the same map over and over. Anything different would help, a couple buildings here or there, but besides that you only see a difference when attacking a town. I fear for this one as it may be hard to fix due to where the game takes place in, but it still should have plenty of variety.

Everything outside of combat is lackluster, trading, inventory/equipment, and everything else has little to no purpose. Towns are pointless besides capturing one, making relations is also pointless, everything just has no belonging. I can't put my tongue on it but it all feels empty.

My final rant is on the game just not making sense early on. You start with two squads fully loaded with automatic and semi-auto rifles. And you start with a Makarov. It is almost like hell to fight with that thing considering you are fighting from a distance 80% of the time. Makes no sense that you kill enemies with rifles and small arms and you cannot pick them up or do anything with them. It is a mess trying to buy a weapon. I can buy a squad of five vets two times over for the price of a rifle. And for higher grade rifles such as snipers and such, I can but ten vet squads for the price of it. It just does not make sense to me, if I am buying a rifle it should cost a fraction of what a squad of highly trained soldiers for hire should be, not the other way around. 

The game in the current state does not justify a buy for those looking for a great game currently. I am a huge fan of M&B so I will support this game but I still stand by my statement that this game should have been released much later even if it was for support. 

The plus that the game has going for it is that it is fun. I enjoyed playing, the reason I do not reccomend is that somebody who stumbles across this game and is not a M&B fan will not enjoy the game. Also it has way too many flaws to even have a public release which is also why I do not reccomend it.

As for whether you will get your money's worth. It will definitely pass. I can feel myself sinking 50+ hours into the game before it really gets going and probably 200+ at full release. Passes the time while we wait for the new M&B.

39899529.review:
Its a bit rough, but loaded with potential. Currently there is around 6-15 hours of standard gameplay, more if you are a hardcore player and aren't put off by its current lack of features, which are as follows:

Pros:
    -Not a whole lot of different items to loot
    -Difficult in the beginning, but good strategy triumphs easily enough.
    -No weapon customization or attachments (Yet, this is a planned feature.)
    -Not much in the way of interaction with owned settlements
    -Fairly slow character progression (Personal opinion. Not meant to be a run-and-gun game.)
    -Not a lot of options in terms of squad variety.

Now, most of this will probably be fixed or addressed to some degree in the future, this is just a review as of Patch V0.105. What this game does offer, on the other hand, is simply down right impressive for its current stage:

Cons:
    -Seemless switching between FPS and RTS modes. (Seriously, you can switch back and forth all you like.)
    -Decent enough graphics running on the Unity Engine.
    -Command and upgrade multiple squads, giving exact orders of where to go and how to get there.
    -Settlement seiges, including defenses and captures.
    -Good variety of weapon classes to suit play styles. (If somewhat lacking in actual different weapons.)
    -Settlement customization, tax collecting
    -Barebones diplomacy system including demanding tributes, paying tributes and opting for truces.
    -Barebones mission system with missions and side mission planned in the future.
    -Slight RPG focus with character customization, i.e armor slots, weapon slots, equipments slots etc and a fairly fleshed 
     out skill and upgrade system.

Overall, I would say buy the game and enjoy it for a few hours. Maybe you will like it enough to put in 10+ hours, maybe not. Either way, the devs have an outstanding track record for updates, releasing a patch almost daily. For 14.99, I would recommend this game not for its current gameplay, but for its potential to create an entirely new genre of games, and a damn good one at that.

39898008.review:
Point and click strategy meets first person modern guerilla combat. 

OBJECTIVE:

Start out with minimal resources and a squad of militia. Command your squad with waypoints on where to go and how they proceed with the fight. Attack small untrained bandit squads, win the fight, secure the loot. Rinse and repeat.

Upgrade to stronger weapons, armor and also your militia squad. Sell un needed items at trade posts and stock up on ammo, meds and food.

With enough fighting experience, turn you and your small milita group into fully geared mercenaries and trained fighters.

Take control of bandit occupied towns or towns that belong to other factions that are neutral or enemy. (if you got the firepower and army by your side)

GAMEPLAY:

The game has decent graphics with basic adjustments, for example: Low, Medium, High or Beutiful. With a grass and shadow setting.

The first person gunplay feels great in my opinion. There's bullet drop and travel, so there's a challenge when it comes to aiming.

Friendly and Enemy AI feel pretty balanced. They have stupid moments at sometimes where they aim their guns straight into the air, but besides that, at least they can hit their target and play a big part on your team, they are not useless and can be your biggest strength.

The animations are actually well done and some are decent. The AI has a very smooth combat run animation along with crouching and prone. Along with reload animation that are pretty well done. Also you can chuck grenades hella far...... for some reason.  


This is a very enjoyable game and I rarely play these! Maybe because the first person modern shooter got to me in a way, but remember it's early access. Everything is bound to change eventually.

39897302.review:
No tak sa na túto vecičku pozrime trochu z vtačej perspektívy, nakoľko mám teraz odohraných len 10 hodín. Titul Guerilla Warfare je vlastne mount and blade zasadený do súčasného sveta. Celá hra sa odohráva vo fiktívnej lokalite niekde v Rusku? (čo je pomerne zaujímavé nakoľko tvorcovia majú uvedené, že pochádzajú z USA). Začínate s partiou žoldákov. V hre máte zatiaľ 3 neutrálne frakcie a dve nepriateľské. Vaším cielom je eliminovať všetky frakcie a obsadiť a udržať desať miest. 

Po mape sveta (ktorá je podľa môjho názoru EXTRÉMNE MALÁ) sa pohybujete rovnako ako v spomínanom kultovom titule mount and blade. Čiže máte postavu, ktorá predstavuje skupinu vašej armády. Presúvate sa z mesta A do mesta B. Po mape pochodujú ďalšie armády, či už neutrálne alebo nepriatelia. Čo sa týka neutrálnych armád, tak tie tiež môžete napadnúť, môžete od nich vypýtať quest (zatiaľ som žiaden nedostal, táto možnosť je zrejme neimplementovaná), alebo sa ich môžete spýtať čo na danej lokalite robia. Čo sa týka nepriateľských frakcií, tak tie môžete prakticky len napadnúť, alebo nechať ich tak. Rovnako z času na čas si nejaká nepriateľská armáda zmyslí, že vás chce napadnúť, tak vás začne prenásledovať a pokiaľ máte skill pohybu na mape na nízkej úrovni - tak vás spravidla veľmi rýchlo dobehne. No a následne môžete vaším prenasledovateľom buď zaplatiť a nechajú vás tak, alebo sa s nimi môžte pustiť do boja.   

Žiaľ nevytvárate tu postavu, ale postavu tu levelujete. Základné body sú telesná konštitúcia, presnosť a intelekt. Potom máte radu rôznych dovedností, ktorých význam je prakticky totožný hre mount and blade. Čo sa týka žoldákov, ktorých si najímate, tak tých si môžete najať v meste. Žoldákom platíte žold na dennej báze. Taktiež máte jedlo (ktoré vám mizne podľa veľkosti vašej armády). Akonáhle začnete bojovať s nepriateľskými frakciami, teda prakticky okamžite tak začnete levelovať seba aj vašu skupinu hrdlorezov. To levelovanie žoldákov je opäť veľmi podobné sérii mount and blade. Vaši žoldáci majú niekoľko tried a levelov. Postupne môžete žoldákov povyšovať na snajprov, guľometčíkov, prieskumníkov, atď. 

V meste máte obchodníka so zbraňami, zmiešaným zbožím a vybavením. Opäť obdobne ako v mount and blade. Taktiež v meste môžete seba vyliečiť za pár rubieľ. 

Postupne keď už nebudete len tlupa ožratých demoralizovaných ničemov, ale vaša skupina bude predstavovať elitnú armádu zabijakov, tak môžete obsadiť nejaké to mesto. Po jeho obsadení, vám toto mesto generuje taxu, ktorú môžete denne vyberať. Výška vybraných daní záleží od leadershipmentu. V dedine môžete postaviť niekoľko budov, ktoré zvyšujú vašu prosperitu, obranu, spokojnosť. Stavanie je opäť na úrovni mount and blade. Nečakajte žiadne zmeny vo vašom meste, proste sa vám zobrazí len ikona s textom, že takú a takú budovu ste postavili. V súčasnosti ich nie je veľa. V meste tiež môžete umiestniť posádku, ktorá bude mesto chrániť. Samozrejmosťou je aj obchodník a nemocnica. 

Celkové hodnotenie: 
Grafika - 7 
Zvuky a efekty - 6
Animácie - 6
Hrateľnosť (s ohľadom na EA) - 8
Celková zábava - 7
CELKOVÉ HODNOTENIE - 6,8

VERDIKT - v súčasnom stave pomerne beznápaditý klon sérií mount and blade, ktorý má svoje kúzlo a taktiež aj potenciál

A to by bolo prakticky všetko! Hra je zatiaľ v EA prístupe. V skratke nie je zlá, len si myslím, že je komunitou dosť nadhodnotená. V tomto momente dávam 7/10, nakoľko teraz je to len vyložene o likvidácii nepriateľských skupín a kúpe a predaji lootu. Po čase keď bude v hre viacej obsahu, tak aktualizujem aj recenziu.

P.S.: mimochodom nepochopil som prečo niektorí ľudia prirovnávajú túto hru k hre ARMA?! To akože každú hru kde pobehujem v prvej osobe v uniforme príslušníkov Alfa (specnaz) a v rukách budem mať Vintorez, tak mám teraz automaticky prirovať arme? :)

39895575.review:
好游戏，有潜力，但是现在买等于扯淡，加油更新吧，中文都没有（we need chinese)，还好我的高中英语还能用。先贴个标签。
重点来了：
       2月6日22：00买了游戏，连续玩了6小时，期间崩溃（心态）一次，很难找到窍门。
       现在时间2月7日凌晨4：33，我愤慨地写下这篇评测。首先告诉大家，这个游戏目前叫商人（free businessman）前期刷小野怪得不偿失，只能苦记每个城市的需求产品（还好有点人性需求不会变）然后绕着地图一圈一圈刷（保护费是常有的）。部队维护费高得吓死人，这些当兵的个个都是大爷。雇佣兵的武器价格连他武器的十分之一都不到，搞不懂。千辛万苦打出狙击也只能说将就，为什么呢？请不要只能让我用rpg当副武器！！！
       经过我深夜数个小时的摸索，我终于攒了三组机枪两组狙击进而顺利攻下土匪城，可喜可贺（此次战役我一个人用狙击打死19个，还是很菜。。这游戏个人英雄主义很困难！！尤其是初期，3、4枪就挂了）
       然而转折点来了，在我欣赏了"快速"而“简陋”的城镇建设后，我发现每天的固定收入连给我的兵发工资都不够，于是我决定再下一城（匪城左上100多号人的那座）。有了之前的经验，我果断选择了带满弹夹，因为我知道光是凭借我的15号人是根本干不过100多人的。一开始战况还行，我方损失一人把对面干死50个，我开心的看见14比49的标志，稳了！正当我拉兵向前，准备起身突击的时候……我发现我的z键和leftcontrol键都失灵了，而且不是键盘的问题，因为在游戏里面还可以改键（改键的时候z和leftcontrol还能有反应）可是不管我改成啥我就起不来了！玩过这款游戏都应该知道，伏地的视角配合地上的草有多么奇葩，我在悲痛与绝望中，看着我的14个弟兄死光，并且我发现在这个过程中敌人越打越多？？？？？
       含泪读挡，攻了30分钟的城，结果被系统制裁了，按键失灵，厉害厉害（赶快改进吧！！！！）这游戏对新手一点都不友好！虽然有刷商品的套路，但是我觉得这个很没有新意，并且任务啥的都还没有呢。。。。。
       支持新游戏，但是请提供中文，不是每个人都有耐心去看英文！请尽快修复bug，谢谢！
       It's a nice game, but we need chinese version.Not everybody has such patience to read English. Please delete those bugs, thanks!!!!!

39890891.review:
总的来说瑕不掩瑜，在我这20小时里发现以下问题
1.有崩溃和界面bug，各遇到一次，问何处可提交崩溃报告？
2.虽然没遇到其他玩家所说的前期经济困难，但是敌人不掉落枪支和防具的确影响体验和不符合逻辑。目前为止只缴获过初始的长裤、红围巾和头巾。
3.小队的指挥很僵硬，只能做粗略地部署，希望添加比如进入掩护、队伍朝向、拉近距离等命令。
4.小队的兵种树短而单一，大致是志愿军-征召兵-步枪兵-突击兵/机枪手/狙击手，希望出势力特色兵种。
5.战斗时很难识别单个小队交火、遇敌状态，当然无线电和枪声是一种提示，但是希望像全战那样面板上能给更多反馈信息。
6.士气系统比较迷，总结了下小队有伤亡就掉一个档，小队受到火力压制也损失若干，小队击毙敌军加若干，战斗胜利集体加若干，发工资集体加若干，小队补员集体+1，小队发奖金+20，建议受到火力压制的士气损失在战斗后能够自动回复，或者消灭敌军集体加士气，不然战斗胜利也总会有小队掉士气。建议发奖金补士气应当遵循边际递减规律，更多的注意战损和战斗性价比而非无脑加士气。建议增加玩家作为指挥官的士气buff。
7.小队有伤者撤离后重新部署就自动回人。
8.重新部署后士气为0使得重新部署没太大价值，在不考虑上一条的情况下。建议增加重新部署CD和士气回复。
9.指挥技能只能点到5？战场部署就只有7个小队，在敌人一波刷出的情况下只能添油战术。
10.防御战出现问题，首先受上一条影响面对100+的敌人兵力本就不足，小队数量计算还出现问题，部署一个小队占了4个小队名额？这就没法玩了，我现在就死档卡在这里。
11.城镇建筑密度过小，防守方的加成不足。
12.希望出玩家人物模型，也希望有更多的兵种模型。
13.战胜后敌方溃退兵力保持不动，而且较大概率会继续溃退，可以反复刷。
14.还有一些AI方面的小问题但影响不大。

Komuta menüsü ve silah animasyonları geliştirilirse daha güzel bir oyun olabilir. Komuta menüsünde askerlere emir vermekten dolayı bir çok kez savaş dışı kalıyorum. Bunu düzeltirlerse güzel bir menüyle daha kolay oynayabiliriz. Tüfekler güzel ve gerçekçi ama zoom in/out olmadığı için ironsight oynamak yoruyor. Arma'da ki gibi dürbün eklentisi vs. getirilirse daha güzel olabilir. Sniper tüfekleri de güzel, gerçi sanırım tek tip var. Zoom/in yaptığınız da çok da realistic olmuyor sniper tüfeği daha çok browser oyunuymuş gibi bir dürbün görüyoruz ancak sniper tüfekleri oldukça güçlü. Oyun içi fiyatı da bir o kadar pahalı, oyunun erken safhalarını düşününce. Para cepte kalmıyor uzun bir süre anladığım kadarıyla, çünkü silah almak, şarjör almak, askerelere yiyecek almak, zırh almak, askerlerin maaşlarını ödemek, morali düşük olan takıma ödül parası vermek vs. sürekli para harcıyorsunuz. Parayı en güzel savaşarak kazanıyorsunuz pek tabi. Armoured bandits'ten erken safhalarda uzak durun derim. :D Oyun güzel, Warband/Arma/Total War karışımı bir oyun, mantığı ve akıcılığı güzel bu yüzden. Eğlenceli, zaman öldürmek için birebir. Oyunun erken erişimde olduğunu varsayarsak daha çok geliştirilecektir. Umarım geliştirme işi bittiğinde güzel bir oyun ortaya çıkmış olur. Tavsiye ediyorum.

F:GW has huge potential. Movement and gunplay so far feels smooth enough for an Early Access so early in it's development at the time of writing this, and the very core, basic systems that F:GW is trying to build upon from the M&B series are present -- I just hope immensely they see the chance they have to build upon and improve those systems, make them deeper and more complex and also breathe new life into things like menus, GUI, and truly make this game something unique in it's own right. So far it's cool that it's so obviously inspired heavily by M&B, but I will be sadly let down if they don't take it and run with it and make it their own. Community moderators/developers so far also seem open to player input. 

Just don't forget KK Game Studio, keep one foot in the community input side, but also one foot planted firmly in your own inspiration for the game! People will buy and enjoy a game you pour your efforts into, you have a great foundation -- don't let anybody boss you around.

39889813.review:
When I saw the concept of this game, I was excited. The combined elements of an RTS, FPS, and RPG all in one package. My love for RTS/FPS combos go back to the days of the Empires Mod for source, and of course my adoration for the RPG elements comes from mount and blade.

Is it worth getting now?

Yes.

The game currently is in a roughly playable state. The mechanics are there, you can play a game and enjoy it as of now. Of course, the polish isn't there. Sounds are a bit jarring, graphics leave much to be desired. AI is pretty bad. Weapon and equipment is fairly basic in all honesty.

However, the devs seem involved. They seem like they've got a decent plan togeather. I'm excited for where this game could go. Its rare that I buy into Early Access (its become a joke among me and my friends about "Shitty indy games") but this one dose not seem like just another early access cash grab.

Fantastic game which could have so many possibilities to entice Mount and blade fans,  RTS and roleplaying.

Graphics are ok for an early access game and the gameplay is very similar to how M & B is;  you navigate on the main map, click on enemies to attack them and then deploy troops.

What I would like to see different is the ability to use items that you find either from looting or trading with merchants in some uses.  For example, compass which enable a boost to travel speed around the map,  Binoculars to help spot the enemy on the battlefield and to tag them so your troops can concetrate fire and spot threats quicker.  Tools and building materials so you can construct a base where you could train, recruit and deploy trrops from as long as you have the right designated skill to do so.  Multiplayer where you could do skirmishes against each other or perhaps a grand campaign!

So there is lots of opputunities for this to be a great game where the life expectancy of the game is huge.  For what it's worth come and join in to support this Dev and the team as I'm sure they will make this a great game!
